Title: Software Engineer
FRONT-END DEVELOPER (PAID INTERNSHIP)
Description:
At REIZ TECH, our goal is simple: we aim to provide the insights, tools, and connections you need to launch a career in the IT field. Whether you take part in our internship program in person or join us online, you’ll have an immersive experience that’s tailored to you and your goals.

What We Offer

3 months full-time paid internship with the flexibility to adjust to your university/college/school or part-time work schedule;
You can take part in our internship program in person or join us online
Full support system, starting with appointed manager to team members and colleagues
Tasks to get you comfortable with new career path and challenges to level up your game
Guidance, help, and quick answers hitting a roadblock on the project
Guidance on navigating through different roles according to your needs
Database and documents to fully support the writing process of compulsory bachelor's internship thesis
Intercultural working experience (colleagues from 20+ countries)
Opportunity to grow on a horizontal career path – 80% of interns stay and are successfully employed at Reiz Tech after the internship.

About The Role

Currently, we are looking for a Front-End Developer Intern with an understanding of React and Typescript and a passion for building modern web applications.

About The Client

It's one of REIZ TECH internal projects.

Title: Junior Java Developer
Back-end Developer
Full-Stack Developer
JAVA DEVELOPER JR./INTERNSHIP
Description:
With more than 300+ professionals, REIZ TECH develops individual software solutions. By using diverse technologies in various industries around the world, we require highly qualified specialists with extensive technological experience. We believe in the power of cooperation, and the infinite potential of each individual unlocks the door to success.

About The Role

We are hunting for a Jr. Java Developer to join our team

About The Client

NT Sandoriai is an internal Reiz Tech project.

Title: Software Engineer (Delphi)
Java Developer
Software Engineer
Description:
Description

About Rystad Energy:

Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, and with offices across the globe, Rystad Energy is a rapidly growing independent Energy research and business intelligence company providing data, tools, analytics, and consultancy services to clients exposed to the energy industry across the world. Rystad Energy has a range of global databases and research products for companies in the Oil & Gas, Oilfield Services, and Renewables sectors, as well as Investors, Investment Banks and Governments. Rystad Energy combines a high-performance culture with a deeply collaborative ethos, providing ample opportunities for growth, learning, contribution, and career advancement.

Rystad Energy is also an IT company. The Technology team is responsible for bringing all our content to our clients and for supporting our work processes. The team has been a key factor for the company’s success, ensuring modern technologies are applied to provide customer value and attractive customer journeys.

The company is growing and we are strengthening our Vilnius developer team – join us helping the world navigate the energy transition!

The opportunity:

If you have skills of writing elegant, robust code, if you are motivated and passionate programmer – we are looking for someone just like you!

As Software Engineer you will be working in a team to rebuild whole company’s data platform from scratch. That platform involves:

“Data Upstream” (collecting huge amount of data. Both manually and automatically)
“Data Midstream” (storing, processing, and analyzing data)
“Data Downstream” (selling data, analytics, insight to client through different channels/applications)

It might seem boring, but it is not. Complexity and challenges add up when you consider scale, scalability and extensibility.

We work and live by SCRUM values – Courage, Commitment, Focus, Respect and Openness. We honestly believe in them. Hence, we value what we do, how we do, and those, who do.

About you:

By applying, you are obligated to:

Know what difference between bit and byte is
Know what Turing machine is
Know what Object-Oriented Programming principles are
Freely express your thoughts with C# (statistics shows, that this might take you about 2 years of daily practice to get here, though that is not a rule)
Understand how .NET ( { Framework || Core || Standard || ALL } ) is working.

It is beneficial (would be great if you would, but no worries, we will teach you if not) experience with following:

Clear Code
Clear Architecture
S.O.L.I.D., K.I.S.S., D.R.Y. or any other fancy abbreviation – mnemonic—guide to help produce high quality code
Domain Driven Design
Test Driven Design
Event Driven Design
Angular. Or React. Or Vue. Or Aurelia. Or just Vanila.js and HTML.
Building highly-available and scalable systems
SQL
MongoDB, Elasticsearch or any other NoSql databases
Docker, Kubernetes, Helm
RabbitMQ, Kafka
Logging, Monitoring practices
SCRUM. Lean. Kanban. Scrumban. XP. Agile methodology in general.

Why Rystad Energy?

Our goal is the challenge of our time – to guide the energy transition based on facts and insight
A global and quickly expanding international business culture with more than 60 nationalities
A diverse, inclusive, and dynamic working environment
Competitive compensation and benefits
Opportunity to grow and develop professionally
Opportunity to join a globally leading energy knowledge house
Trips to Oslo!
Flexible working arrangements

Title: Frontend Software Engineer - Marketplace (Remote)
Description:
Description

Frontend Software Engineer - Marketplace

We’re looking for talented, friendly and adaptable Senior Frontend Software Engineers to help build our suite of consumer and supplier facing products. We believe in Agile principles and values, our teams typically use Kanban and various XP practices, we love DDD and we are embracing eventual consistency in our new services.

You will be working on a variety of exciting technologies. Our UI applications are written using React & TypeScript, served using Node.js and packaged using Yarn. Our backend is written in Java 11/Spring Boot and provides a well defined, collaboratively designed API to your UI applications. All our applications are deployed within Docker containers and monitored using Prometheus. Everything runs in AWS.

We don’t just ship features, we’re building a Europe-wide platform & team, and know we need to do great work to succeed. To achieve this, we need people who love being challenged, learning new things, and growing with their team.

You Will Be Responsible For
Working as part of a Agile team writing and shipping high quality code frequently
Working on a variety of exciting technologies (Typescript / React, Redux / GraphQL, CSS-in-JS (Emotion), Github / Github Packages managed by lerna, Docker / Kubernetes, AWS S3 / Cloudfront)
Deploying the application through automated pipelines in CI/CD and monitor it using Sentry and Google Analytics for business metrics.
Do whatever you can to help your team meet or exceed its goals and you will drive incremental improvements in both the way we work and the software we deliver.
Helping us to realise this vision and accelerate the journey, knowing what great technology looks like and mentoring our existing team.

About You
You have expert level JavaScript & Typescript skills.
You’ve built high quality web interfaces using modern technologies & practices and are familiar with our frontend tech stack.
You are comfortable with the running and maintenance of your team's applications in production.
You understand component based CSS methodologies, like CSS modules.
You’re familiar with design systems and how to translate them into reusable components.
You know good UX, visual and good technical design when you see it and how to ensure quality is embedded in the software development process.
You’ve been part of a high-performing, autonomous Agile development team who deliver continuously.
You like learning new skills and challenging yourself & your team.
You’re a good communicator, fun to work with and enjoy being part of a vocal, passionate team
You get a kick out of mentoring and empowering the team around you.
You’re keen to help promote the great work we do to the software development community, whether through blogs, meetups or open source contributions.
You feel comfortable communicating in English. Any other language is a plus.

About Treatwell

Hi, we’re Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We’re a team of 800 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We’re the industry’s smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe’s leading booking platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries and processing over 8 million bookings every month. And….breathe.

But we’re not done yet. We’re on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might have just the role for you.

We’ll Treat You With
28-days holiday, plus bank holidays
Monthly 40 EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too
Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team
Private Health Insurance to take care of your health
Enhanced parental and sick leave
100% remote position with flexible working
Annual Treatwell retreat to a sunny European destination
All the tools / devices supplied to do the best job you can eg. laptop, monitor, keyboard etc
Salary of 50K EUR to 70K EUR

Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‘Open to All’ employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.

Title: Software Engineer, Full Stack JavaScript
Description:
Description

We create powerful, beautiful and intuitive digital products. We don't blindly follow trends. We take our understanding of the latest technologies and build the best solutions for our enterprise clients. We’re big believers in collaboration across engineering, UX and product teams. We combine our individual expertise to solve complex challenges.

We seek team members who care about results and are not afraid of taking ownership.

Main responsibilities
Research, evaluate, architect and deploy new tools, frameworks, and patterns to build sustainable software solutions for our clients
Stay on top with latest technologies
Share knowledge and know-how of software best practices inside and outside the team
Work as a part of cross functional agile team acting as a single business unit

Requirements
Experience in JavaScript/TypeScript development
Experience with at least one of the frontend frameworks (React, Vue, Angular or AngularJS)
Experience building backend services with NodeJS (Express, Koa, Hapi or Nest.js)
SQL/NOSQL database experience (PostgreSQL, Mysql, MongoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch)
Experience with testing/static analysis tools (eslint, prettier, jest, mocha and jasmine)
Good knowledge of asynchronous programming, micro-services event driven development
Mindset focused on code quality.
Knowledge of design patterns, clean code and SoC design principles
Experience in Agile development environment
Fluent communication in English

Desirable Skills
Knowledge of mobile app development with React Native
Knowledge about app/package deployments (CI/CD, npm, yarn)
Knowledge of messaging technologies such as RabbitMQ, WebSockets.
Containerized application development/deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
Serverless development (AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, GCD Cloud Functions)
Experience with cloud providers such as AWS, Azure, GCD and Openshift.

Benefits
A digital products focused company with a variety of challenging engagements with upper mid-market and Fortune organizations
A chance to work with the top talent professionals and award-winning teams across different countries
Opportunities to grow your competencies: self-learning days, training, sponsored participation in professional improvement events, etc.
2 additional vacation days
Private health insurance and psychologist consultations
Personal accident insurance
Great team-building events and out-of-office activities
Sports activities including gym benefit and sponsored participation in sports events.
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.

Salary range for this position is from 2700 EUR to 6625 EUR gross.*
Salary offer for the candidate is determined based on the predefined salary ranges for the position and depends on the level of competence and experience of the candidate.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
We plan to strengthen our team with an additional Software engineer. We are looking for a solution-oriented team player who would like to develop and maintain the Trade Finance service together with us!

With Us You Have The Opportunity To
Be part of a team with a great team spirit and agile thinking where we constantly aim to learn and develop ourselves and the team.
Improve or build your experience in the Trade Finance area.
Have a positive impact on Swedbank’s growth, create solutions and work according to Swedbank’s strategies.
Follow best practices of Agile in daily work.
Contribute to networks, strategic initiatives and collaborate with colleagues within LC&I and other parts of Swedbank.
What You Might Need In This Role
Write queries in SQL with ease (preferable PL/SQL)
Experience or willingness to learn Oracle Forms and Reports
You might have knowledge or open to explore different technologies like:
Message Broker programming
Systems integration (RESTful API)
API bridges maintenance (Java)
Automated test scripting
Linux/Windows platform configuration knowledge
Master common tools like: Git, Jenkins, Jira
Automate everything that is boring, especially tests.
Build or share DevOps mindset
Experience of agile ways of working.
You are self-motivated and have a strong “can-do” attitude.
The most important capability is however that you have an open mindset to learn new skills, are a team player and realize the value of working together to achieve common goals.

At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. We support continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. We take care of your wellbeing by providing a sustainable and flexible working environment. As an employee you will be part of the Group performance program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. It’s all about delivering a positive and unique experience for our customers through collaboration and team-work – together we make a difference.

Be part of our today and future

…and we will give you opportunity to work with motivated people with high competence and expertise. Our value stream goal for 2023 is to increase flexibility and impact delivery lead time. We believe in diversity and think it is very important to have an Open, Simple and Caring work environment. We are responsible for developing very important and crucial products and processes for the business area Large Corporates & Institutions within Swedbank, and there are great opportunities for personal development within many areas. We believe that everyone in the value stream contributes and is important to succeed!

We look forward to your application at 31.01.2023 the latest.

Contacts: Recruiting manager: Helena Ölander Wettergren, +46858590084

If you are to be employed in Lithuania, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 2500-3700 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Frontend Developer
Junior C# Developer
Description:
The team is growing and we currently are looking for a developer who is motivated to learn new technologies and grow with the product.

Due to the extraordinary variety of goods and better pricing structure in US e-commerce, global shopping in US retail markets has been popular for many years now. However, this industry is mostly used by a handful of tech savvy users, who understand how e-wallets, VPN’s and other technologies work, enabling them to buy overseas. We are building this platform, so the remaining majority of global shoppers are also able to gain access to the vast online shopping sites in the USA.

As a Software Engineer, you will:
Be a part of a new worldwide startup product that is still to be released
Mostly work with backend development in the beginning and grow into full-stack developer in the long term
Develop dockerized C# and JavaScript services hosted on Microsoft Azure and Kubernetes
Collaborate with other colleagues in agile environment

We expect you to:
Have good knowledge of C# and JavaScript
Have relevant work experience and personal projects / contributions in public repositories
Learn and grow where the product needs you most
Be responsible to maintain everything you develop
Have good spoken and written English

Salary
Gross salary FROM 1,500 EUR based on skills and experience.

Location
Work from anywhere - see you online. We have offices in old-town Vilnius when you need or feel like coming in.

What about perks?
Outgrow your role. Join other initiatives. Build your skills and test your strengths.
Learn. All the time. Would you like to attend conferences or take paid training? There is a budget for that.
We will not let you become obsolete. But whatever you do - give it your best.
Pitch your ideas about anything. We build startups! Let’s build yours together.
Work hard, play hard. Adrenaline junkie or zen. Or a casual all-nighter in the city.
Take time off. Even if you don't - still do. Don’t feel bad about taking a day with a same-day notice. We have all been there. Just be respectful of your responsibilities and to your team.
Additional health insurance. Take care of yourself. It just makes sense.

About Us
We build cool stuff and have fun doing it. Adroiti is a stack-agnostic technology incubator company. Founded a decade ago, we wondered a lot, built a lot, and learned a lot. We are a diverse group of 60+ engineers, artists, facilitators, avatars and entrepreneurs, empowered by technology. We aim to build disruptive, meaningful, and incremental innovations. We are informal, and we relish adaptive work culture.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
At Humbility, you will work to find new ways to improve and optimize code performance. We are an algorithmic cryptocurrency arbitrage trading firm specializing in DeFi and CeFi across multiple chains and exchanges. We are a market-neutral trading company and we develop low-latency arbitrage trading bots in a very competitive environment.

Our highly motivated and skilled team of 25 software engineers and data analysts is passionate about solving mathematical and logical challenges. In order to win in a low-latency game at the microsecond level, we are constantly looking for new technological solutions and improving our infrastructure and code.

We are actively growing our team by hiring top talent with an interest in various mathematical and infrastructural optimization tasks. Let us know if that sounds like you! 

Your responsibilities

Develop quality software
Develop asynchronous processes and ensuring they run smoothly
Dive deep into latencies, choosing the best winning infrastructure
Optimize our code down to microsecond level

What we hope you will bring 

At least several years of solid working experience in backend software engineering (JAVA/ C#/ Golang or similar)
Good mathematical skills and passion for solving difficult problems 
Ability and passion to learn new concepts quickly
Willingness to become a one step better every day

Work environment 

The environment is quite quick and we need to communicate a lot. Therefore we like to work from our office most of the time (Vilnius, Technopolis). We found no better way to quickly share information than face to face (yet) but we are curious to hear your ideas and what works for you
Your job won’t go unnoticed - yearly bonuses and performance reviews will help to ensure that your work is rewarded accordingly
Once in a few months we have a well organized team building and support internal initiatives whether that is random skiing afternoons, chess tournaments

Title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
.NET Developer
Description:
Currently, we invite Full-stack (.NET) Developers to join one of the teams at twoday - Pension Broker and Addo.

Requirements

Requirements vary per different team and their technology stack. Visit https://twoday.lt/karjera for more information.

Benefits
No-nonsense culture: from the food we eat together to things like workplace design - we, the employees, are the ones who make the final call.
Committees: you’ll be able to join 1 of 10 committees which steer the company and have the chance to create an organisation you dream to work in.
Competence: we provide all opportunities to hold certificates, attend courses and conferences. We also have our own library and anyone can order new books.
Wellness program: we care about your health, that’s why we'll provide you with health insurance and mental & emotional support from third-party consultants.
Geeky amazing stuff: flexible working hours, pizza Fridays, hobby corners, lounge spaces, sports clubs, free parking or even a sauna - yours for the taking.
Work from home: unlimited work from home policy.
Gross salary: 2500 - 7000 EUR. Your salary is based on your competence and experience.

Thanks for reaching out, please fill the form. We will contact selected candidates.

Title: Java Software Engineer (Mid)
Mid Software Engineer (Java)
.Net Software Engineer
Description:
NET Core Developer

Track-POD is extending our Software Development Team by adding world-class software engineers and if you think your profile will catch our attention for a Senior Engineer position in our company - Apply for our job right now.

If you like working with world-class software engineers, and take full ownership and responsibility to deliver tangible results, Track-POD is the right place for you! You will design, develop, and maintain the Track-POD Hosted Application.

Why us?

We have a very strong product with 90% inbound of which 30% are referrals, targeting last-mile delivery companies. We are already trusted by over 1000+ companies without any outbound efforts!

Track-POD received numerous nominations as category leader from software review sites. It is rated as one of the best software by users around the world. Don’t take our word for it, read what our customers have to say on Trustpilot, Capterra, GetApp, and G2. We'd like to invite you to join us to grow together.

Responsibilities

Implementation of the new modern approaches to backend developments
Stay on top with the latest technologies and modern tech-stack
Working closely with Google Maps API, Mapbox SDK, Open Street Maps API, Stripe
Developing our notification service using #1 Global Market Twilio communication platform
Lead and work as part of a team, as well as independent work toward assigned goals
Full ownership of the entire engineering stack required to deliver features and results to business stakeholders and customers
Establish good engineering practices and mentor other team members

Required Skills

A minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in building web-based applications
.NET Core 5/6, .NET Framework
High-load, micro-services architecture
ORM tools (EF Core, Dapper)
OAuth 2.0 (IndentityServer)
AMQP (RabbitMQ)
Distributed Cache (Redis)
Databases (PostgreSQL)
CI/CD (Team City)
Architecture patterns (CQRS)
Agile development environment (Jira)

Preferable Skills&Experience

Postgres SQL
Rate Limit, Polly
Work with external providers such as Google APIs, Stripe, Twilio, Sendgrid, Shopify, Xero, QuickBooks, Woocommerce
Mapbox or Google Maps APIs
Kubernetes/Docker, AWS/Azure/OVH/DigitalOcean

What We Offer

Top of the market salaries, Salary range at 5000 - 8200 EUR gross, based on experience
The latest Tech-Stack
A chance to join a world-class software engineers
High-performance laptop for personal use
Gross plus annual bonuses
Private medical insurance
Free Parking
Hybrid working environment
Exciting, fast-paced global environment (we are shifting the global market!)
A chance to join a fast-growing tech company
A great international team to work with and the chance to bring our exciting technologies to the new level for the market

Our Software Products

Delivery Driver App on IOS and Android
Route Optimization Software and Route Planning Tool
Delivery Management & Sign-on-Glass App
Transportation Management System (TMS)

Description:

Title: Backend Developer
Description:
We are one of the fastest growing podcast & audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an experienced Backend developer to join our tech team in Vilnius.

Come join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.



This is the role
In this position you will be a part of a small yet ambitious backend development team of talented professionals. The team is fully responsible for the whole process, from refining requirements to the architecture, releases, testing, development and maintenance of solutions.

Your main responsibilities in this role:
creating and implementing new features
closely working with Product Managers and CTO who are also based here in Vilnius
This is you
We are looking for a colleague, who would be passionate about podcasts and audio content, as well as understanding the concepts of working in an international startup environment to make it a fun ride. In more detail you would succeed easier in this role if you: 


have 3+ years of Back-End development experience using Java, Kotlin, Scala or Nodej.js
have 1+ years experience using Spring Boot
have experience in developing REST APIs
have experience in using MySQL or PostgreSQL
have experience in using RabbitMQ, PubSub or similar messaging solutions
have some experience/are willing work with clouding solutions
have some experience/are willing to work with Async programming
have good communication skills in English and Lithuanian
Naturally, being passionate and knowledgeable about podcasts, audio content, media, and entertainment is a big plus!

These are the benefits
Six month fully paid parental leave for all new parents - no matter your gender and no matter where in the world you live
Learning and development opportunities to make sure you stay on top of the game
Flexible work. Opportunity to work flexible hours and remote
The chance to make an impact at an international company and see your work pay off immediately
Delicious lunch with great colleagues
Salary ranges from 3500 EUR GROSS depending on your experience
This is us
Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.


We're a courageous and curious bunch. We respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions and time and we approach our work with integrity and humility, and recognize the value each and everyone brings. We believe that we are better together and we have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about creating, finding, and hearing great stories. We care for our creators and the beautiful stories they share and we have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we love to have a good time doing it.


We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world we’re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.

We’re currently active in Denmark, Norway, Germany, Nederland, Finland, and Spain, but watch this space: we’re expanding fast.

Title: Frontend Developer (CSS/React)
Description:
About us:
We are a product and technology company working with the rising stars and established leaders of iGaming industry. On a good day of the week we have enough players to fill the biggest sports arenas in the world. We welcome ambitious professionals to join "Kickertech" - a modern and creative IT company uniting technology and results-driven professionals who strive to deliver world-class products to their customers.

Currently we are looking for a new Frontend Developer to join our team!

As a Frontend Developer your responsibilities would be:
• Interchanging of data between the server and the users.
• Running the React application on the frontend and using RESTful API web services to fetch the data.
• Practice disciplined software engineering (e.g., debugging, automated testing, code reviews, document, writing clean and pragmatic code).
• Ensuring smooth connections between applications and other (often third-party) web services.
• Following set standards to create innovative solutions for businesses.

What will make you successful in this role?
• Knowledge of React, TypeScript or any other JavaScript frameworks
• Knowledge of HTML, CSS, Sass, JavaScript.
• Ability to build web from given designs (PSD/Sketch/Figma or others)
• Experience with Git is considered as an advantage.
• Ability to work in a team.
• Good communication and problem-solving skills.

Working with us implies:
• Competitive base salary and other benefits, including health insurance, employee referral program, and additional training.
• Memorable company parties and social activities like team buildings and monthly birthday celebrations.
• New modern, bright, and comfortable office space in the center of Vilnius, with a great working atmosphere, in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers.
• Free parking for your car or motorcycle and showers if you prefer to cycle to work.
• Opportunities to build valuable skills, work with unique and interesting projects for the sports industry, express and implement your ideas and grow your career!

Monthly salary range for this position: € 1500 - 4200 (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
LIFE AT SATALIA
As an organisation, we push the boundaries of data science, optimisation and artificial intelligence to solve the hardest problems in industry. Satalia is a community of individuals devoted to working on diverse and interesting projects that will challenge, and allow you to develop new skills, lead and contribute to the overall community.
Following our recent acquisition by Wunderman Thompson (WT), Satalia is currently going through an exciting phase of growth, and is now looking for a senior engineer to join our team and help scale the business. Our ambition is to become a decentralised organisation of the future. Today this involves developing tools and processes to liberate and automate manual repetitive tasks, with a focus on freedom, transparency and trust.
At the core of our thinking is an approach to wellbeing and inclusivity. We unpack human behaviour and unpick prejudice to ensure a safe and inviting environment.

THE ROLE
As a Java Software Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role within the DFS client / Satalia Retail client focusing on supply chain solutions. You’ll be working on multiple Java back-end applications deployed across AWS and GCP.

More about the project: https://www.satalia.com/clients/dfs-delivery

The technology stack we work with: Java 11, React, Spring Boot, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Daily communication with client on technology solutions
Develop production grade back-end software
Take ownership of your own code design and quality, ensuring the highest standards are met
Follow technical and ways of working best practice
Effectively communicate on design decisions, problems and solutions
Contribute to architecture workshops and decisions

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS
3+ years of software engineering experience
Strong understanding of generic code design
Strong communication & collaboration skills
Willing to work as a team player
Ability to learn client business domain
Mathematical background is a bonus

WE OFFER
Development - focus on bringing the best out of each other
Annual bonus - when Satalia does well, we all do well
Remote working - café, bedroom, beach - wherever works
Impactful projects - focus on bringing meaningful social and environmental change
People oriented culture - wellbeing is a priority, as is being a nice person
Learning budget - personal budget for your growth
Truly flexible working hours - school pick up, volunteering, gym
Transparent and open culture - you will be heard
Extra paid holiday time - in total 25 days per year
Extra Health insurance - after probation period.

Satalia is home to some of the brightest minds in AI and if you’re looking to join a company who not only values autonomy and freedom, but embraces a culture of inclusion and warmth, we’d love to hear from you.
We aim to respond to all applications within 2 weeks. If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks this means your application has been unsuccessful.
By applying to Satalia you are expressly giving your consent for the collection and use of your information as described within our Satalia Recruitment Privacy Policy.

Good luck!

Salary 2500-5000 Eur/month gross (based on skills and experience)

Title: Technical Data Analyst (VAG)
Description:
About the job
Voltas IT – innovative technology company operating worldwide, creators of professional diagnostic software – OBDeleven. Distributed in 21 country OBDeleven is rapidly gaining popularity among automotive enthusiasts. Endless software possibilities lead us towards the goal – to become number one in intelligent automotive diagnostics. Together we can do more and your contribution is very important to us.

Before going through the requirements and responsibilities of a Technical Data Analyst, there are a few in-house terms we want to share with you in order to understand - what this role is all about.

Who is Technical Data Analyst that belongs to OCA’s team @Voltas IT:
Our OCA team consists of skilled engineers with a strong technical automotive background who conduct relevant market research, develop One-Click Apps (further OCAs), and provide technical support to our companies’ specialist teams, moderators, and customers.
What is the One-click application:
One-Click Apps are pre-coded adaptations that will allow our consumers to change or adjust vehicle settings and functions using the mobile app in just one click without having extensive automotive knowledge. Or as we like to say we made the coding for them.
How it is made:
Our OCA team members search for possibilities or gather our community requests for the needed features activations in the cars, making them into applications, and testing them on particular vehicles.
Your responsibilities in the role as a Technical Data Analyst will include:
Monitoring of One-Click Apps (OCA's)
Analyzing vehicles control units for OCA's creation
Searching, copying, and adapting existing OCA's for different car models
Developing and testing new OCA's
Maintenance of OCA builder - suggestions for improvements
Connecting vehicle control units for car simulation

What we expect from you:
Technical knowledge of automotive engineering (ability to explain car components principles of operation; principles of vehicle control units communication, etc.)
At least minimal VAG car coding experience and ability to code the car control units (long codings, codings, adaptations etc.)
Understanding of car diagnostic tools possibilities
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in a technical field (electronics, automotive, or related)
If your degree is from a different field - your application is also proper. But we must receive arguments that you have some knowledge/practice regarding car electronics or automotive diagnostic solutions
Ability to work in a team as well as find solutions independently
Attention to detail with excellent follow-up practices
Good knowledge of English and fluency in Lithuanian
Some knowledge of German would be an advantage
What we offer:
Involvement in the development process of a global brand
Transparent remuneration system and stock options
Opportunities for personal and professional development with a yearly training budget included
Annual performance reviews and bonuses
Flexible working hours and remote work opportunities (possibility to work remotely for up to 183 days per year abroad)
A modern office based in a heart of Kaunas
Private health insurance
One paid Self-learning day and a sick day per month
Team building events
Stocked kitchen & each Friday lunch out of the office
Gross salary in a range: 1569 - 2279 € /month (depends on your experience)
Still having doubts? Learn more about:
our product. OBDeleven – an innovative automotive diagnostic software, operating via small Bluetooth device helps daily drivers to customize their vehicles via mobile application. is officially licensed by Volkswagen AG and BMW, and honoured by two international design awards. 2,3 Million vehicles are already connected to OBDeleven.
our company. Voltas IT is the first Lithuanian company announced a winner among the fastest growing technology company in Central Europe in 2019. It is awarded "For Innovations" in Kaunas District Business in 2020. Company is a member of AAAA (Australian Aftermarket Automotive Association, Equipment and Tool institute; Kaunas Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Crafts; Lithuania Diversity Charter and a partner of Kaunas University of Technology.

Here at Voltas IT we feel the vibe, take ownership, never stop learning, enjoy teamwork, being ambituous and smart. If our company‘s culture maches your values let‘s join forces and prove that on a scale of 10 we are ready to go for 11!
Confidentiality guaranteed. Only selected candidates will be informed.

Title: Business data analyst
Description:
About the job
Do you want to help Telia Lithuania by driving business results with analytics? Are you a professional with proven track record of successful execution of analytics projects? Keep on reading, you may have just found your next career step that you were looking for!

Hi, my name is Domas Meilūnas and I am building Digital Analytics team. As we are starting a new truly data driven era in Telia Lithuania we are now looking for an inspired Business Data analyst to help us build modern capabilities for business growth and operational efficiency.

Our team is part of Telia Lithuania Digital and Analytics organization. In our ever-changing environment, we need teams who dare to challenge the current status quo, reduce the complexity and care for our co-workers, customers and our society. We don’t believe in rigid hierarchies, rather in people who thrive within a self-leadership culture.

We set high goals for our business and for ourselves. Through constant feedback and regular coaching, our leaders ensure we are on the right path. That is why we want driven and skilled people like you to join us in continuing to make our goals a reality. Boost company culture of data driven decisions

Business Data Analyst

We are looking for Business Data Analyst to join our Digital Analytics unit. Our team is based in Vilnius and has the overall responsibility for providing organization with a variety of analytics and analytical products, data management, customer behavior activities and active organizational support on reporting and analytics. Your contribution will be central and you will have a great opportunity to influence the work that our team and organization is doing.

Your next challenge?

If you want to be a key player in the forefront of establishing our capacity to become data driven organisation and work with one of the most innovative organisations in Lithuania, you are perfect for our team.

In this role you will actively participate in our Organization‘s transformation, roam through our IT landscape and enable the business to understand the value of data we hold. This role will partner closely with Online sales, Marketing and Personalization teams to analyze performance and to communicate business impact, risks and opportunities.

Your responsibilities would include:
Working with the marketing, personalization and online sales teams to ensure that online campaigns are supported with the right data;
Working with business leadership to identify the right KPIs to track;
Creating reports for management and other team members to update on website performance and to highlight growth opportunities;
Qualifications and skills we are looking for:
1+ years with any programming language (SQL, Python, R etc.)
Data visualisation toolkit (we use QlikSense, though knowledge of any other major tool works)
Good visual and verbal communication skills;
Excellent attention to detail, accuracy and organization;
Ability to work well with different levels of stakeholders as well as both technical and creative people;
Bachelor’s degree in business, mathematics, statistics, computer science or similar;
What will you find at our home?

We believe that people thrive in a purpose driven and values-oriented culture. You will be a part of an exciting journey to shape the new generation Telco and we promise to help you grow, both professionally and personally. We believe in self-leadership where you take the responsibility for expressing yourself and achieving great results. IT & Telecommunications is not just our business, it’s our passion. You will join a winning team, to work with talented people and help create ideas and solutions for efficient business and better lives.

We offer a monthly base salary from 1500 EUR to 2300 EUR, depending on your competencies. Additionally, each Telia Lithuania employee receives additional employee benefits package which includes:
Health insurance
Various Telia and Partners discounts and offers
Flexibility that enables work-life balance
Workcation in EU
Chance to grow both personally and professionally with our internal programs
Open, relaxed and fun working environment
+19.000 awesome colleagues across Nordics&Baltics
Interested?

Found what you were looking for, do not be shy and apply! But if there is still something that you would like to know before that - give me a call me on +370 620 23096 or get in touch via LinkedIn.

Welcome to Telia – Home to you next big opportunity!

Title: Solution Architect within Group Business Intelligence
Description:
About the job
Are you passionate about leading new solutions for a modern Analytics ecosystem and working closely with BI architecture?

In Swedbank You Have The Opportunity To
Build and grow the Swedbank Infrastructure ART (Agile Release Train) capabilities within Group Business Intelligence Architect Guild.
Design solutions for Infra ART, which enable smooth integration of new applications and analytical systems into the whole software and hardware landscape.
Support and guide Infra ART teams in developing and maintaining analytical platforms, applications, and tools.
Help to define architecture roadmap for the system integration and lifecycle management related works.
Be part of Swedbank’s mission to increase its analytical capabilities and diversify its data management landscape. We constantly search for the ways to serve our customers better and find new and better ways to gather data and produce valuable insights, as well as to ensure quality reporting.
Be an active member of the BI architects community.
Work within Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).
What Is Needed In This Role
Relevant academic degree.
Proven experience in design and implementation of BI solutions or in system integration, also in leading hands-on technical work.
Knowledge of system-2-system integration technologies.
Good understanding of different SSO technologies, such as Kerberos, SAML, etc.
Knowledge of various BI analytical tools, applications, and software lifecycle management.
Knowledge of technologies related to building data pipelines and ability to design and work with data flows (from source to end user).
Readiness to work with new applications and tools, integrate them into the current setup, prepare architecture documentation and guide teams in the implementation of needed changes.
Good SQL knowledge.
Being business oriented and striving for the solutions, which accelerate business value.
Good presentation and communication skills.
Fluency in written and oral English.
At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. We support the continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. We take care of your well-being by providing a sustainable and flexible working environment. As an employee, you will be part of the Group performance program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. It’s all about delivering a positive and unique experience for our customers through collaboration and teamwork – together we make a difference.

"Join our team and...

be a part of the community that jointly delivers key data services in the bank and play a critical role in fulfilling data demand towards our business stakeholders.” Johan Stridsberg, your future leader

We look forward to receiving your application by 30.09.2022.

Location: Stockholm, Tallinn, Riga, Vilnius

Contacts

Recruiting manager: Johan Stridsberg +46 73 072 28 03

SACO: Henrik Joelsson

Finansförbundet: Åke Skoglund +46 8 58 59 02 88

If you are employed in Estonia, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 3300-5000 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

If you are to be employed in Latvia, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 2850-4250 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

If you are to be employed in Lithuania, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 3500-5200 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Senior Data/Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the job
Reporting into Head of Reporting UX/UI, you will be responsible for creating cutting edge data visualizations and producing insights to our clients across various domains. You will be working alongside the Technology, Engineering and Commercial Teams to support our clients.
The successful candidate will form a key part of the Technical Delivery Team based in Vilnius.

Responsibilities:
Designing intuitive and effective visualizations along with other team members to create great user experience,
Building functional, and if required complex data models using SQL and/or Power BI (DAX, Power Query, etc.),
Developing interactive, audience specific reports covering different processes within a client organization (Power BI),
Communicating to stakeholders,
Capturing project related documentation,
Supporting stakeholders on ad-hoc data requests by providing simple analysis and/or guidance,
Maintaining and improving existing reporting processes and reporting assets repository along with other team members,
Supporting junior team members

Required Skills and Experience:
Knowledge of and experience in SQL (expert level)
Knowledge of and experience in visualization tools, e.g. Power BI, Tableau (expert level)
Proven capability in providing analytical solutions to unstructured problems
Excellent written and verbal presentation skills, particularly in rendering complex data outcomes to a non-technical audience in English
Able to prioritize, take initiative and execute with excellence
Action orientated, goal driven & resourceful

Preferred skills and Experience:
Analytics experience in Health Care sector
Sound knowledge and/or application experience of UX/UI Design
Experience and/or sound understanding of Data Engineering

Salary 3000 – 4500 eur/gross per month depending on skills and experience

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the job
UAB „SME Finance“
We are a team of experienced professionals in the fast-growing Fintech sector devoted to help businesses grow. We offer a wide range of financing services for businesses: factoring, business loans, payments, credit line, leasing. We are the leading B2B financing platform in the Baltics, having created an exclusive ecosystem in which 'SME Finance' operates as a ‘fintech’, and a neobank 'SME Bank' that operates as a ECB licensed legal entity. We have ambitious ideas and aim to become the most professional digital lending platform, recognized by clients and partners not only in the Baltics, but also in many other European countries.

What will you do:
Inspire and mentor the team of data analysts
Perform hands-on activities such as data exploration, insights generation, reports/dashboard building
Communicate analysis and complex concepts to non-technical audiences
Perform ad-hoc and recurring reporting and analysis as needed
Help build data warehouse from scratch

What you need to succeed:
3+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst (the finance sector is a plus)
You have experience mentoring and growing team members
Experience in writing readable and performant SQL
Experience designing & building data models (dbt, Looker, etc.)
Experience building reports and dashboards with data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Proficiency with modern development tools (Jira, Git, etc.)
1+ years experience working with Python

What we offer:
Private health insurance
No legacy, we are building everything from scratch
A competitive compensation package
Working with a diverse and results-oriented team
Company events and team retreats

Salary:
3500 - 6000 €/mon. gross

Title: Data Scientist (R&D)
Description:
About the job
About Syntropy
We transform the public internet into a secure and user-centric internet, where encryption and optimized performance are built-in and automatically enabled for anything and everything connected to it.
Syntropy technology is compatible with the current internet yet allows for the better utilization of internet resources. It removes bottlenecks and limitations, ensures security and optimization by default, and unlocks greater scalability potential for future technologies and applications.

About this role
In this role, you will be building an analytics pipeline, analyzing unique data sets, building complex models, and contributing to the innovations within Internet technology, computer networks, and Web3 technology. You will join in the first dedicated data role within the company, therefore you will have a lot of space to shape your career.
The product is technically complex and we work in a fast-paced environment. Therefore in this role, you will need curiosity, accuracy, eye-to-detail, ownership, and the ability to communicate and explain your work to others (for example, less technical people).
‍
Main responsibilities will be:
You will create and own data analytics, outline problems, set hypotheses and present insights to various stakeholders;
You will be creating reports and cost analyses for our products;
You will build an SDN infrastructure cost forecasting model;
You will work with our DevOps and developers to build specialized data storage and analytics pipelines. A follow-up would be to build a data ingestion pipeline for the server metadata.

Requirements:
The most important is your capability to use statistics to tell the story, think on your own, come up with ideas for analysis and visualisations and your ability to work with little guidance, taking ownership of the project if required;
we expect 2+ years of working industry experience;
You can easily write SQL queries and you have solid experience with open source language Python (alternatively, R);
Experience working with Grafana is a plus;
A machine learning experience and big data frameworks like Hadoop is a plus;
Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer certification is a big plus.
To communicate with your colleagues we expect that you fluently express yourself in English.

You get:
A professional & personal development budget worth $2000 annually.
An innovative and attractive compensation structure (salary + company-issued cryptocurrency tokens as bonus).
Flexible working hours (office & remote work).
A possibility to grow into different roles with higher (or broader) levels of responsibility.
The opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and ambitious start-up team at an exciting time of growth.
Syntropy embraces diverse applications. Apply today!

Title: Analyst (SOAP) (Bangkok-based role, Relocation provided)
Description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Supply, Operations, Analytics and Programs (SOAP) team is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s non-accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Supply, Operations, Analytics and Programs (SOAP) team is a fast growing and dynamic team within Partner Services department of Agoda. The team is responsible for developing and scaling a range of marketing solutions for accommodation partners focusing on growth, visibility, conversion, pricing recommendations and financial products, as well as advertising and display marketing solutions for businesses and travel organizations.

The team scope includes strategic planning, business development and sales operations, project management, contracting operations, risk assessment and collections operations, product development work and data analytics. Team members closely work with multiple internal stakeholders in product and tech, finance and legal, marketing and partner services in our HQ as well as in multiple offices around the world.

The Opportunity:

The role sits within the Supply Analytics team under SOAP team of Partner Services, where new business ideas, and partnership types are incubated and scaled. As an Analyst/Senior Analyst at Agoda you will use your data skills and business mindset to make a difference in our fast-growing global business across our top hotel partners. This role will be involved in strategic projects and work closely with commercial owners and business stakeholders, using data to identify and translate business needs and opportunities into actionable initiatives.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

2-6 years of experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy
Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, Python, R, or similar
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge is a plus (regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources
Experience utilizing Python for Automation
Knowledge of Pandas and other associated analytical packages
An advanced level of SQL including parallel computation approaches (i.e. Spark)
Tableau/other BI visualization experience

It’s Great if you Have:

MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience
Asian market experience
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience
