Title: Python Developer
Description:
About the job
We are a team of curious hackers & tinkerers, who love to build random stuff just for the fun of doing it. We like to spend our time in a major hackerspace where we have access to lots of toys for the big boys: CNC mills, laser-cutter, 3D printers, etc. We are considering building a remotely controlled cart, or a pulse jet engine, or maybe a rail gun, still deciding. Because why not.

Oh, and we are also a B2B engineering company that builds high-tech aerial inspection systems for helicopters, airplanes and other vehicles. Think of flying precision laser scanners, high-res & thermal cameras, fiber-optic gyros, satellite communications, etc. Occasionally, we get onboard an aircraft to fly around and test what we've built. Which is sometimes just an excuse to go up in the sky!

We genuinely love what we do, and it just happened so, that we've built the most awesome system in the market of this kind (for reals, no bullsh*t). Now we are selling it all around the world for geospatial companies, utilities, helicopter operators, and other businesses alike. They use it to detect defects and potential problems on critical infrastructure, such as power lines, railroads, etc.

Following yet another successful funding, we are expanding and looking for a few like-minded, curious, nuts-for-tech non-junior Python Developers to join us. We have a juicy backlog with tons of fun features, and we need your help squeezing them out.

You would be a part of the team, working on a software solution that controls all aspects of aerial data collection and pilot navigation. This includes:

Interfacing with hardware devices (e.g., cameras, lasers, power controllers).
WEB-based front-end UIs for system operator and aircraft pilot.
Back-end services for running navigation routines, real-time data assessment and storage, mission status tracking, flight optimization, hardware control, etc.
Main software application package to integrate and orchestrate all of the above.

If you happen to tick at least a few of the requirement's bellow (we really don't expect you to tick them all), drop us your CV at career@aispeco.com or just click "Apply" and we'll get in touch:

Python (non-web, non-scripting): 3+ years
C/C++: 3+ years
Comfortable with Linux (not necessarily a pro)
Comfortable with VCS systems
Web based GUI development
Building cloud apps
Working with databases (SQL and NoSQL)
Software testing
Multithreading, multiprocessing
Raw IP sockets

Bonus points for:

Embedded development
Communicating with external hardware (over Ethernet, USB, Serial, etc.)
Understanding how photography works
Experience with gRPC
Advanced Linux User/Admin
Experience with git
CI/CD setup & maintenance
Defining system architecture specifications
Knowledge of GIS & Geospatial
Applied mathematics (linear algebra, optimization algorithms, etc.)
Have participated at least 3 times in No Trolls Allowed.

If we will turn out to be a fit for each other, we can promise you:

Flexible work hours.
Work from home or from the office, as you prefer.
Exposure to high-end technologies, devices and aviation.
Engaging and challenging work, that gives opportunity to grow and learn.
Real chance to influence company-wide technological decisions.
Opportunity to get on an aircraft and see the “big picture”.

Title: Aspiring Data Engineer in Information Platform at SEB Global Services Vilnius
Description:
About the job
SEB is a leading financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?

SEB is the best place to become a Data Engineer in Lithuania

Best track record in the market for becoming a Data Engineer
Learn “on the job” from the best and biggest data engineering team in Lithuania
We are the SEB Data Engineering Center of Excellence
The best technologies and stack (GCP, Gitlabs, Terraform, Airflow, Confluent, Ansible, and many more)
GCP is the primary data platform

What You Will Be Doing

As Data Engineer, you will work in an environment with multiple Agile teams located in both Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data technologies.

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Create data products offering ease of use, through well-defined self-service to make data available for various business users and applications.
Develop new technical Big Data capabilities for Cloud platform.
Provide innovative solutions for complex problems.
Who we are looking for:

Java, Python and/or Scala knowledge
Public Cloud platform skills (GCP, AWS or Azure).
Basic knowledge of Spark
Creativity to solve complex problems
Willingness to take on the Scrum Master hat in the future

It will be an advantage if you have:

Enjoys doing explorations and learnings in different stages of the development process
Terraform & Gitlab
Infrastructure as Code
Focus on CI/CD and Automation
DevSecOps mindset (*)
What we offer:

Best place to be a Data Engineer in Lithuania
Extensive training and learning opportunities (Pluralsight, Coursera, Innovation days and more)
Diversity of data engineering work and technologies to choose from
Work-life balance
SEB Remuneration package (health insurance, learning budget, contribution to your pension 3% of a monthly salary, profit-sharing program, additional paid vacation days each year)
Possibility to work remotely 3 days per week

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

We are looking forward to your application by September 30th, 2022.

Monthly salary range for this position: 1900 - 4200 EUR (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today.

Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers

Title: Data Scientist, Trust Intelligence
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

You’ll become part of the Trust domain with a mission to protect the Vinted community from malicious content and activity. Trust Intelligence is the ML hub of the domain - a team composed of machine learning specialists working on designing, developing, and deploying scalable solutions in areas of safety & security, member support, and content quality.

You will report to the team lead of Trust Intelligence and work closely with other machine learning specialists in your team and collaborate with Product Managers and Decision Scientists across the Trust domain.

In This Position, You’ll
Drive projects across teams, domains, and functions to successfully design, develop, and deploy data products
Develop scalable predictive models and classifiers to prevent, detect, and moderate malicious activities
Take ownership of challenges & opportunities in the trust & safety area, including ways to improve the Trust Intelligence team
Write and own clean and understandable code, make sure it is re-usable where relevant
Engage in exploratory data analysis to identify and investigate fraudulent and suspicious activity and opportunities to address it
Help improve measurement and tracking of safety at Vinted
Contribute to a culture of curiosity and experimentation.
About You
A proven track record in machine learning, data science or analytics
BSc or MSc and at least 2 years of industry experience
Able to effortlessly communicate complex technical and statistical information to business stakeholders
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 2,500–4,600 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Growth
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

As our new Decision Scientist in the Data Science & Analytics department (Growth domain), you’ll help Vinted achieve its mission of making second hand first choice worldwide. By solving complex problems you’ll improve the Vinted product and facilitate data driven decision making. You’ll be working on complex and strategic projects that will substantially impact the course of the company during this exciting phase of rapid growth. Growth domain at Vinted is focused on expanding our user base by optimising the user funnel, ensuring sellers are as successful as they can be, and taking care of efficient geographical expansion and marketing tools. The focus of this role will be on growing lister engagement.

You will be part of a cross-functional product team working alongside Product Owner, Designer and Engineers. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics, Growth and you will be part of the Vinted Data Science & Analytics Guild with fellow data roles from other domains (i.e. being part of the same guild, you will collaborate and learn alongside other Decision Scientists from other domains).

Description

To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
In This Position, You’ll
Be your team’s primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questions
Ensure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses
About You
2+ years working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Business Strategist or in a related position
Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills
Excellent written and spoken English
Strong interpersonal skills
A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Programming experience (Python/R/Scala)
Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques
Advantage: experience working in a tech company or in a cross-functional product development team
Advantage: 3+ years of working experience
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 2,500-3,000 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Staff Analytics Engineer
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

As our new Staff Analytics Engineer in the Data Science & Analytics department, you’ll help Vinted achieve its mission of making second hand first choice worldwide. By driving the design, building, and maintenance of Vinted’s data models and pipelines, your work is crucial in improving the Vinted product and helping the company grow. As the most senior Analytics Engineer of the company, you’ll be leading complex and highly strategic projects that will substantially impact the course of the company during this exciting phase of rapid growth. You’ll mentor other team members and take Analytics Engineering at Vinted to the next level.

You’ll also be a part of the Data Science & Analytics Guild – a team of smart and curious data geeks who’ll offer you all the support you need to excel in this position.

In This Position, You’ll
Drive complex and strategic company-wide projects, spanning multiple quarters
Be the driver of improvements to our data platform usage through setting standards; from data model design principles to usage policies
Set our analytics engineering standard and guide other team members
Be the voice of our department around our data platform needs
Participate in the analytics engineering community outside of Vinted
Proactively identify and drive opportunities to make Data Science and Analytics within Vinted even more impactful
Generally contribute to the effectiveness and wellbeing of the entire department
About You
8+ years or equivalent working experience in the data space (advantage for data engineer, ETL/ELT dev, analytics engineer)
Deep knowledge of data modelling, data access and data storage techniques
Extensive working experience with large scale (billions of rows) data warehouses
Capable of setting a vision on what our data platform should do to best empower our Analytics Engineers, and drafting standards, policies and processes to reach it
Fluent in SQL, have working experience with git, and master at least one of the mainstream programming languages, e.g. Python, Java, Scala
A great communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Can translate functional requirements into tech requirements and vice versa and you can sketch a rough outline of a technical architecture that meets our needs (but not necessarily in-depth)
Extensive experience with cloud environments (GCP would be a bonus)
Experience with the Modern Data Stack incl. dbt/DataForm/similar (streaming would be a bonus)
Experience with data access control and privileges (GDPR experience is a bonus)
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 6,800–8,400 € (gross) per month.
