Title: Data engineer
Description:
About the job
We are happy to share that we are creating new unit called Data Analytics Hub in Telia Global Services Lithuania which will consist of data engineers, software engineers, data analysts and marketing developers. Team members of this Hub will learn together, support each other, and will be strongly integrated into Pricing and Analytics unit to build awesome data and analytical products for customers across all countries of Telia Company.

I’m Daina Rutkauskienė, Head of Data Analytics Hub, and looking for first-team members who are eager to create a new unit together.

Your next challenge?

You will work closely with Data services team in Sweden who are on a big journey to implement a new hybrid cloud target architecture as well as a new operating model with more business focus and DevOps ways of working. At Telia Company, you will have a key role in our Data Services team and help us to create true business value through data and analytics and make Telia Company a more data-driven organization. To succeed, we need to shorten time to insight and build even more reliable analytical data products.

The role includes, but is not limited to:
Data analysis and design
Building data pipeline architectures
Maintenance of data warehouse and day to day operations
Who are you?

To succeed, you need to master technology and be a team player. You want to constantly learn and you're not afraid to challenge how things are done today. We are a team and we reach success together, which means we don't have any room for solo players. You enjoy coding, but also set high software engineering standards. You are also able to think long-term and design sustainable data pipeline architectures.

Your personality:
Self-leading, innovative and forward leaning
Willing to support others in the journey of self-development
Business minded - solution and outcome oriented
Team player
Your Experience:
Implementation of one or more Enterprise Datawarehouse using AWS cloud
Hand-on experience using Glue, Step functions, python and redshift.
Good Understanding of Data modeling techniques
Strong SQL skills and PL-SQL/T-SQL
Experience with CI/CD process, agile set up
Fluent in English
Good to have- Scala, Spark , Spark streaming and NO SQL Databases e.g. DynamoDB,Hbase
Experience of cloud watch or similar monitoring tool is a merit
What will you find at our home?

We believe that people thrive in a purpose driven and values-oriented culture. Welcome to Telia the home to your next big opportunity. You will be part of an exciting journey to shape the New Generation Telco and we promise to help you grow, both professionally and personally. We believe in self-leadership where you take responsibility for expressing yourself and achieving great results. IT & telecommunications is not just our business, it’s our passion. You will join a winning team, to work with talented people and help create ideas and solutions for efficient business and better lives.

Working in this position you will receive a base salary from 2844 Eur (gross) to 4479 Eur (gross) plus annual bonuses which vary, depending on your competencies and your and Telia results. Besides for each employee Telia has additional employee benefits package which includes:
Health insurance and pension plan;
Various Telia and partners discounts and offers;
Additional vacation days;
Workation;
Flexibility that enables work-life balance;
Chance to grow both personally and professionally with our internal programs;
Open, relaxed and fun working environment;
19 000 awesome colleagues across Nordic & Baltics.
New ways of working. We really care about people, so in response to the current situations in the country we will invite selected candidates to virtual interviews. We are also ready to fulfill all the necessary conditions to ensure successful work from home, including a technical gear delivery, onboarding process, trainings and more.

Interested?

If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact me at daina.rutkauskiene@teliacompany.com

We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. And also required controls will be performed.

The application deadline is 2022-09-30

WELCOME TO TELIA – HOME TO YOUR NEXT BIG OPPORTUNITY!

Title: Data Engineer/Associate
Description:
About the job
Description

As Data Engineer, you will be part of the ambitious effort in building next generation products at Euromonitor International. You will be a part of the team which creates and manages a large fleet of web crawling robots that collects data from hundreds of websites. You will learn the intricacies of modern web infrastructure, how dynamic websites work and become an expert in web crawling and scraping.

We expect you to have some experience in computer programming and to be familiar with HTML, Javascript, jQuery and CSS selectors.

We would also welcome those interested or with some experience in FMCG market research.

The key responsibilities:
Build automated web crawling robot scripts;
Analyze websites for best crawling methods and strategies;
Maintain a fleet of web scraping robots, tune scripts for performance, troubleshoot them;
Work together with data scientists to determine the best data structures and features for extraction;
Work with our research and industry experts in defining product content strategies;
Working closely with Technology team and stakeholders to make sure the project meets business requirements

Requirements
Understanding of HTML for web crawling purposes;
Computer programming aptitude – enjoy writing code;
Familiarity with Javascript, jQuery, CSS selectors, JSON data structures;
Analytical thinking, fast learning, good attention to details, curiosity how things work;
Good communication skills and English fluency (both oral & writing);
Interest in market research would be an advantage.

Benefits

We offer an international, growing and challenging working environment with genuine global career development opportunities. Monthly salary gross starts from 1650-2000 EUR plus additional medical insurance, flexible working hours, longer holidays and other perks.

Why work for Euromonitor?

Our values

We act with integrity

We are curious about the world

We are stronger together

We seek to empower

We find strength in diversity

International: not only do we have a very multinational workforce in each office but we are all dealing with our 15 offices worldwide on a daily basis. With 15 offices globally there are regular opportunities for international transfer.

Hardworking but sociable: our staff know how to work hard but also how to enjoy themselves! We pride ourselves on creating an appropriate work-life balance, with flexible hours and regular socialising including frequent after work meet ups, summer and Christmas parties and a whole range of sports and other groups to be involved with.

Committed to making a difference: We think that people are looking for something worthwhile in a company beyond the workplace. Our extensive Corporate Social Responsibility Programme gives each member of staff two volunteering days a year in addition to holidays. It sees us reaching out into the local community with our mentoring, group volunteering, and fundraising initiatives as well as supporting international charities through our website sales, matching staff sponsorship fundraising, and carbon offsetting all our flights, amongst many other activities.

Excellent benefits: we offer highly competitive salaries, enhanced healthcare and pensions, plus generous holiday allowances and in many offices a Core Hours policy allowing flexible start and finish times to each day.

Opportunities to grow: we offer extensive training and development opportunities at all levels. The vast majority of our managers and directors have been promoted from within and many have moved across departments as well as upwards. We pride ourselves on identifying and rewarding talent.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: Euromonitor International does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability and genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, or other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
TransferGo is a fast-growing fintech start-up that offers online money transfers to over 160 countries with high speeds, low fees and no hassle. We’re striving to make the world a fairer place for migrants by providing tailored, more affordable financial services that makes their hard-earned money go further. Over 300 employees in offices across Europe are building a brilliant, relevant product supported by outstanding customer service.
We’ve come this far by building a talented, diverse workforce on a fair culture of trust, empowerment, and fun. And because our people understand the challenges our customers face, they’re better placed to make life easier for our customers around the world — 4 million of them, and counting.
Data team plays a critical role in shaping the way we are making decisions based on data and, to make sure we’re doing that in the best way possible, we’re now looking for a talented Data Engineer to work in our data team.
Here’s what you’ll be doing as Data Engineer:
Develop and support existing data pipelines from our key business systems to our data lake on AWS by using Glue, Lambda, S3, Python.
Develop new and support existing data transformation processes to populate our DWH on Redshift by using dbt
Build data validation rules and data quality monitors for data quality assurance
Spend time improving the performance of our data platform, and help us stay up to date on all best practices
Help us to implement and maintain data governance across the company
Here’s what we’d love from our new Data Engineer:
Very good SQL knowledge
Experience with AWS technologies, S3, Glue, DMS, Lambda, Redshift, CloudFormation, Git, dbt, CI/CD
Familiar with data integration patterns and tooling including ELT/ETL, Replication, Event Streaming to support batch and near real-time data needs
Knowledge of data lake design and implementation, columnar storage formats (Parquet) and partitioning
Good skills in Python language
Familiar with database performance tuning and data modelling g techniques
And if you can also do this stuff, even better:
You are a good communicator and are able to use English effectively at work
You can champion engineering innovation and best practices
You enjoy sharing your experience with other engineers and helping others to succeed
Salary: starting from 3200 EUR - 6000 EUR (gross), depending on the level of experience.
What We Believe
At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way. We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!
Some Of Our Best Benefits
Being part of an exciting and growing fintech startup community;
A competitive salary package;
Unlimited paid holiday;
Being eligible for company's stock options;
Private health insurance for Lithuanian and UK employees, other employees get wellbeing packages;
Flexible working hours, with the opportunity to work from home;
The opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing, along with a guaranteed training budget of €1,000;
A friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment – a pet-friendly office (where we have them), team events, tasty snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, a fun budget and events.
As an equal opportunities employer, TransferGo is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join TransferGo.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 20+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We have 200 people within the Data Team at Revolut. They're a mix of Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Machine Learning Engineers & Computer Vision Engineers - working across a wide variety of problems in the business. Our Data function does have centralised leadership, but you will be spending the majority of your time embedded into multidisciplinary product teams, comprised of: Product Owners, Software Engineers, Data Analysts & Operations Managers - working together to solve problems that impact millions of Revolut customers.

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We are looking for talented Data Scientists to join our team and help us create the future of financial services apps. You will be working together with the strongest professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering on the projects which have direct customer impact and drive our company forward.

What You’ll Be Doing
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems

What You'll Need
Experience building and leading a significant data science team within a scaling organisation
Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools.
Deep understanding of fundamentals of probability and statistics.
Big picture thinking - correctly diagnosing problems and productionising research.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
Previous experience in anti fraud departments
Worked at a large tech company worth >$15B
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Title: Data Scientist for Decision Modeling
Description:
About the job
Job Description

Would you like to develop your data modelling skills further and use your competencies in an area with a large impact on our business? Join the Decision Modeling team and become a Nordic frontrunner to automate credit decisions.

Decision Modeling has a mission to disrupt traditional credit granting processes and put customers first through fast and transparent credit decisions. Our focal point is to engage gratification and higher customer satisfaction from what we do. Some of the key aspects that will take us there are automated decisions in the customer journey by working from a perspective of contributing to a standardized process and minimizing resources.

Our team has a flat structure and informal atmosphere. Our focus is to have a good collaboration and enable the best in each other. We work in a high-paced environment with many stakeholders, so for us to achieve goals, we all need to have high integrity for the team.

In this role, you will be working in a self-organized agile squad, which brings together the best expert knowledge and data analysis to secure a solid decision on retail customers. The role will be a mix of Data Scientist and Data Engineer. We wash out the boundaries between the two areas to decrease handover and increase end-to-end ownership. With your eye for detail, sense of innovation and quality, you will challenge the requests and bring better solutions.
Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority in the role.
You will:
Doing credit data analysis and profiling, ensuring the right data quality is in place
Handling and manipulating data, contributing to the automation of the customer journey
Fact-finding through data investigation
Working in close collaboration with key stakeholders across customers, risk, credit, IT and business to capture the necessary business understanding and securing the practical applicability of the final models
Preparing, testing and implementing the production set-up
Automating the customer journey and getting influence future processes
Developing and maintaining end-to-end flow for automatic credit decisions
Integrating to the application process by interconnecting IT and the customer journey
Working with probability modelling, reject inference, multivariate analysis etc
About you:
Higher education in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Programming, Statistics, or other relevant fields
Good analytical mindset from experience with quantitative modelling and working with large datasets
Experience working with data (SQL)
Statistical knowledge and experience with Python
Stakeholder management and collaboration with many different types of people
Ability to communicate technical results in a non-technical and concise manner
Proactive approach, creative problem-solving skills and your ability to be self-organizing. You will work autonomously with the mandate to move fast and do things differently – and dare to fail and learn from it
Upper-Intermediate English language skills
We offer:

Monthly salary range from 2240 EUR to 3360 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities;
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; health insurance from the first day of employment; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms;
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience;
Additional paid days off: 2 to recharge, 2 sick days, 1 for volunteering, for round birthdays, for seniority in Danske Bank, up to 5 days to prepare and hold exams in higher education institutions;
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution after 3 months of working;
See All The Benefits HERE

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist.

Please contact if you have any questions.

Thomas Vicenci Witt

+45 50 54 82 70

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Marketing
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

At Vinted, marketing is one of the most impactful channels to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. As a Marketing Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. In this team we develop statistical and business models, create new methods to measure marketing success, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure that marketing data is reliable. You will report directly to the Director of Data Science & Analytics, Marketing, and will have plenty of independence to show your talent but at the same time all the support from the team, the DSA guild, and your lead that you may need. You will be crucial in moving millions of people to the path of sustainable consumption.

Description

To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
In This Position, You’ll
Develop new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure marketing performance
Investigate revenue streams that marketing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation, engagement on both sides of a two-sided market
Analyse how a multitude of marketing channels drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and revenue
Pitch your findings to your team and marketing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success
Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation
Occasionally help with ad-hoc requests (data questions and consultations, data bugs, analyses, etc.)
About You
4+ years of data science / analytical / BI or similar work experience
Highly business-results oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem solving
A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Keen on collecting and sharing business insights with your team/company
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python/Scala
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 3,750-4,600 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

The Proton Data team is responsible for everything that enables the company to make data-driven decisions, with our on-premise, custom data platform at the center. We are looking for Data Engineers at various levels to join us in our office in Vilnius or remotely from Spain, to help maintain, improve and consolidate the data pipelines in our data platform, and help it take our data analysis to the next level.

What You Will Do

Contribute to data lake and data pipeline design
Prepare the necessary components to populate the data lake from Apache Kafka
Design, integrate and document technical components for data extraction and analysis on our big data platform
Prepare all of the necessary data transformations to populate data into a warehouse optimized for reporting
Contribute to innovations and data insights for data-driven decisions within Proton Technologies
(For the more senior positions) Mentor and guide junior team members
MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline
Two years (five years in the case of senior positions) of relevant work experience
Understanding of data warehouse best practices in Big Data space
Experience with the relevant programming languages: Scala, Python
Experience with Apache Spark
Excellent SQL knowledge, experience with ClickHouse is a plus
(For the more senior positions) Mentoring experience

Why you should join Proton

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and supporting organizations that advance the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit, with people coming from all walks of life. Many members of our team spent time at the world’s top academic institutions, including MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Princeton, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service – Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events, and team-building activities.

Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate.

By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst in Trade Surveillance Operations
Description:
About the job
Why Nasdaq

When you work at Nasdaq, you’re working for more open and transparent markets so that more people can access opportunities. Connections can be made, jobs can be created, and communities can thrive. We want all our employees to have access to opportunities, too. That means planning for career growth, ensuring you have the tools you need, and promoting an inclusive culture where we’re all valued for our unique perspectives.

Here, you will work for a global tech leader committed to breaking down barriers to inclusive prosperity. We see technology as a means to free people up to work together more productively and effectively by centralizing data, analytics, and market intelligence.

Here, we’re committed to building a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Not only is it our responsibility to do better, but we also need representative voices to power the fresh thinking that is vital for our business and our clients.

What we offer

Nasdaq is currently seeking a motivated and passionate individual to join our Trade Surveillance Team in Vilnius.

Nasdaq’s Trade Surveillance service powers surveillance and compliance for over 150 market participants across 65 markets globally. Scalable to millions of transactions and flexible to manage several outstanding data sources, NTS Surveillance holistically examines scenarios across multiple venues and asset classes.

As Senior Data Analyst you will be conducting an analysis of existing data flows used by the NTS application. You will then collaborate with other colleagues and a variety of global cross-functional teams to implement changes to said data flows that would address client issues and ensure the client receives the quality service Nasdaq strives to deliver through incident management, accountability, and professional communication.

You can expect an autonomous but fast-paced work environment where you are recognized for your results and ability to drive things forward. Every day brings many opportunities to learn & grow and rewards with a global impact we build.

What you will do
Prioritize and manage all reported stock exchange/trading activity data issues via an internal ticketing system (JIRA)
Investigate and resolve reported data issues using Linux and other servers/data management tools
Coordinate with global teams to schedule releases and implement various bug fixes
Work on continual service improvement to reduce the number of reported issues and improve our client experience

What We Expect
Previously worked within a Linux environment, especially with data extraction
Experience in troubleshooting data issues, data conversion, and manipulation
Previous experience in a similar position, preferably from a trading/financial services industry
Excellent English verbal and written skills

What Would Be Helpful
Knowledge of market data, trading data, and protocols (i.e. FIX) would be considered an advantage
Previous experience working in a globally distributed team

Benefits
Annual Monetary Bonus
Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
Restricted Stock Units annually assigned stock bonus
Additional paid leave days after 2 years of working at Nasdaq
Internal Mentorship programs - learn from an employee you look up to
Wide selection of online learning resources: Udemy, O’Reilly, etc.
Flexible Health Insurance program from the first day
III pillar pension plan with additional contribution from Nasdaq
Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)

Does this sound like you?

This is a full-time permanent position located in Vilnius. As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible.

Monthly salary (Gross): from 2500 eur (gross), depending on your level of experience. Other bonuses apply.

A valid working permit for the EU is mandatory.

Come as You Are

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Tableau Developer, Business Analytics Team
Description:
About the job
About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Do you enjoy crafting visually stunning dashboards and visualizations in Tableau? Do you thrive when you can build reports that influence crucial business decisions by getting the right information into the hands of the right people, at the right time? Our team needs Business Intelligence Report Developers who are self-starters that can prioritize their time, priorities, and multiple projects simultaneously as well as explain complex issues in a simple and intuitive way. We are not looking for an order taker! We need those who love to undertake problems, think critically and build an independent view on data so that the best possible business outcomes are achieved.

Toptal prides itself on being an organization that focuses on the data. Our BI Report Developers build, support, and maintain reports and dashboards both in a push model and in response to specific requests. This role requires expertise in all aspects of report development, including data sourcing, SQL, report design, data visualization, metric calculation, and intuitive user interface creation.

While this role sits within our Business Analytics Center of Excellence, it will support Marketing. Together with Data Analysts and Business Analysts, this role will act as an important gatekeeper to drive quality and consistency at Toptal, while building positive relationships and being responsive to functional needs.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Develop both standardized and ad-hoc reports supporting all business disciplines using SQL and Tableau.
Visually represent data in a consumable and actionable way.
Pull insights from and formulate use cases around reports and dashboards.
Drive consistency across outputs by standardizing report design, metric definitions, and standard methodologies.
Solve problems that arise in data, ETL processes, business processes, definitions, and report development.
Establish relationships within Business Analytics and with company-wide partners.
Instill trust and confidence in produced reports across the organization.
Train end-users on how to view/use reports and dashboards and effectively communicate data requirements.
Collaborate to build data dictionaries and document definitions, sources, logic, reports, and usage of all metrics and dimensions.
In The First Week, Expect To
Onboard and integrate into Toptal while also learning about Toptal’s history, culture, and vision.
Shadow Report Developers and Business Analysts to learn the core of Toptal’s operations across the different functions like Marketing, Revenue, Talent Operations, and others.
In The First Month, Expect To
Understand the data generated through company operations and activities, and where/how that data is stored.
Review and understand our existing reporting environments, major dashboards, and report development processes.
Understand our current and future data models, key data sets, and key data relationships.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Develop proficiency in data elements.
Integrate with the team and start developing visually appealing dashboards that follow Toptal’s reporting standards.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Contribute to the alignment and standardization of metric definitions across the company.
Contribute to reviewing and building standardized reporting packages for each business function.
In The First Year, Expect To
Play a critical part in setting the team up for success.
Contribute to improving report development and certification processes.
Promote and educate stakeholders on the use of a centralized, certified, official reporting repository as a single source of truth for all key company reports.
Requirements
2+ years of experience in report development, business intelligence, data analysis, or analytics.
Remarkably proficient in all areas of report development, including Tableau, SQL, UI design and development, access management, platform management, and strong visualization skills.
Outstanding presentation skills.
Master at incorporating sometimes complex calculations/logic into simple report outputs.
Track record of linking reporting, data, and analytics to business strategy and operations to drive real impact.
Proven technical background in math, science, engineering, or statistics; Working knowledge of business processes and concepts.
A standout colleague that builds strong relationships and establishes trust with business leaders, Engineers, and Business Analytics colleagues.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Strong professional skepticism, including the ability to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations, and flag blind spots.
Work multi-functionally and independently; take ownership of quality, accuracy, and timeliness of work.
You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
For Toptal Use Only: #northamerica #southamerica #individualcontributoreurope

Title: Opportunity for Analysts
Description:
About the job
JR0104436

Opportunity for Analysts

Ready to play your part in a global business that is committed to moving money for better? Do you want to unleash your potential in a global Fintech company? Join Western Union as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst.

Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful

We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 8,000 employees serving 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.

Better requires process discipline and simplification

Western Union is looking for Data Analyst and Business Analyst in couple of teams.

Data Analyst in Payments Product team, which drives new digital countries (WU.com) and new payment option launches, leads issue resolution to improve WU digital traffic performance and oversees Issuer Outreach to maintain good relationships with main banks across the globe. The team leads Payments Product Optimizations to meet customer and market needs. Senior Analyst is responsible for analysing the performance of various products to improve the functionality of bank transfers and card-not-present methods of payments, analyse complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers. The ideal candidate should have experience in Data Analysis, ideally within the financial industry and be confident in producing datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools like SQL, Hadoop, and Power BI.

Business Analyst acts an important role in the Product Management team, which handles one of the key tools used by the WU Customer support team. The in-house app has more than 5000 users globally and is crucial in assisting customers calling WU with status inquiries for transactions that they’ve sent and requests to make changes to the transaction/request refunds etc. This is a high-performing global team that works closely with stakeholders in different time zones as well as IT teams to work on enhancements involving the system. The team also provides support for prod issues reported by the end-users. The team doesn’t interact directly with the WU Customers, but any system issues will have a direct impact on WU customers, as the customer support will be disrupted. The team is responsible for minimizing issues and disruptions in the system - and for driving the enhancement projects from start to finish. Business Analyst will be responsible for typical BA activities like requirement gathering, user story writing, doing business Demos, performing testing, etc. The ideal candidate should have BA experience and some exposure to agile methodology.

Here are some skills, attributes, and qualifications you should have:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field, i.e. IT
Minimum of two years’ experience Analyst role
Solid English language skills, written and verbal
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, databases
Attention to details and great problem-solving skills
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, highly structured, deadline-driven environment
A confident communicator, you’ll have high standards and a strong work ethic
Join us, and let's connect the world

Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.

We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.

We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams, while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran (U.S.) status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws.

The monthly gross base salary range is 1331 – 2880 EUR. This range represents the anticipated low and high end of the salary for this position. Actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. Salary is one component of the Western Union total compensation package, which includes short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few! The Recruiter will share other benefits specific to your location and role during the interview process.

Title: Experienced Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
583829BR

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Data Engineers in this role will have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data using database products, technologies, and methods. Typical examples of the deliverables are database designs, information models (logical, physical, dimensional, etc.), data migration plans, and data warehouses. Data Engineers who primarily apply their Analytics technical skills in internal or external customer services and implementation environment.

Key Responsibilities

Designing and developing code, scripts, and data pipelines that leverage structured and unstructured data integration from multiple sources
Participating in requirements and design workshops with our clients
Developing project deliverable documentation

Benefits

Personalized professional growth, mentoring, training, and clear career progression
Flexible work & life balance
Remote work opportunities
Compensation according to the market top rates
Private health insurance, life insurance, critical illness insurance
Salary range: 4000-6400 EUR gross (dependent on experience and knowledge).

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Education in Computer Science or equivalent.
The background includes data engineering, business intelligence, and advanced analytics development.
Experience in SQL, NoSQL, and RDBMS Databases.
Experience building complex distributed batch and real-time systems.
Agile mindset.
Experience with any of these Programming languages – Python, Java, Spark, Scala or equivalent.

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Unix experience.
Data Migration experience.
Data Modelling experience.
Impala and/or Hive experience.
Data Warehousing experience.
Big Data technologies experience.
Cloud technologies (IBM Cloud, AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform).

About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Behavioural modelling
Description:
About the job
Job Description

The Group Finance function is overall responsible for managing the bank’s liquidity and mitigating its risks. By joining Group Finance you will get very good insights into how a bank is run because Group Finance sits within the heart of the bank with a significant focus on this area both from senior management and from regulators.

You will join the Behavioural Modelling team to build predictive models utilizing data science techniques to predict the development of the bank’s balance sheet. These models are research-type models, where quality comes over speed. The team has already built more than 10 models and data-driven products that are running in production and are used by senior managers in the bank.

The team consists of 4 data scientists and has a close collaboration with business stakeholders in Denmark. Your main workplace will be located in Vilnius office.
Depending on your skills, knowledge and experience, you may be offered different seniority in the role .
You will:
Develop Behavioural models, including data preparation, methodology design and technical implementation
Collaborate with product owners, end users, developers and other stakeholders to implement data discoveries and processes into already existing infrastructure
Drive improvements of the processes within the modelling area
Develop subject matter expertise in a wide range of domains in payments and liquidity
Mentor and support less experienced colleagues
About you:
2+ years of work experience in data science and modelling
Master’s degree or equivalent (in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Programming, Statistics or other relevant fields)
Thorough knowledge of Python & SQL programming languages
Team-oriented personality with a willingness to share knowledge with team members
Curious, eager to learn and have good collaboration skills
Experience in Finance area (will be considered as an advantage)
Upper-intermediate English language skills
We offer:

Monthly salary range from 2960 EUR to 4440 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; health insurance from the first day of employment; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.
See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Please contact if you have any questions.

Monika Lapenaite-Gedvile

+370 696 59330

@LinkedIn: Monika Lapenaite-Gedvile.

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Tax Data Analyst / Digital Tax Transformation
Description:
About the job
Tax data analyst / Digital Tax Transformation

Our Tax Technology and Transformation (TTT) team is taking a fundamentally different look at what it takes to operate in this hyper-connected global economy. Digital Tax Transformation and Digital Tax Administration are new tax realities locally and globally. TTT is solving problems from data migration, tax computation engines, data analytics and big data applications, to robotics and artificial intelligence. Currently, our Tax Technology and Transformation team is looking for a team member who will work with the Digital Tax Transformation and Digital Tax Administration compliance services.

The opportunity

Your work will be challenging and stimulating with missions widely spread across companies and industries. You will have a possibility (an opportunity/chance) to work with (import, validate, analyze) data of our key clients and projects which will develop your accounting and tax knowledge.

Your Key Responsibilities

As one of our TTT tax professionals, you will provide pragmatic commercial help, so clients improve their digital tax transformation and digital tax administration compliance.
You will work in team improving data quality, data analytics, reducing errors, reducing costs and ensuring taxes are handled correctly in the disruptive compliance environment and increasing digitalization of the Tax authorities, with a focus on SAF-T;
You will advise how clients should get ready for digital tax transformation and review their compliance status using new tax applications available at EY;
You will also assist to maintain and improve EY tax applications by performing system monitoring and analysis, troubleshooting, escalating application problems to vendor, also by developing database queries;
You will also support clients using EY tax applications.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Genuine interest in local and international taxes
Data analytics and programming mindset
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Analytical mindset and social intelligence in order to work in a multicultural environment
Teamwork & communication skills
Strong drive to excel professionally
Dedicated, innovative, resourceful
Innovative working methods, ambition for challenges and ability to adapt to changes

To qualify for the role, you must have

A bachelor’s degree or student in economics, accounting, computer science, information systems or a related field.
Advanced MS Excel skills
Advanced skills in data analytics and big data management
Fluent English and Lithuanian
Good business understanding (commercial awareness, business intelligence?)
Ability to prioritize and work under tight deadlines

Ideally, you’ll also have

SQL knowledge
Python knowledge
VBA knowledge

What We Look For

We are most interested in people who are naturally curious and love to learn. You are social and outgoing and like to work with others and build relationships with both colleagues and clients. You are goal-oriented and implement business thinking with the ambition to develop and strive for providing good service. Furthermore, you are structured, have good analytical skills and of course a genuine interest in tax. In return, you can expect the support of great colleagues, as well the industry-recognized training you’ll need to grow in your career. If you’re a fast learner with great data analytics skills and a genuine interest in tax, this role is for you.

What Working At EY Offers

As a consultant in EY you get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. At EY we value our employees and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments. Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Moreover, we offer excellent conditions, in a stimulating, inclusive and enjoyable working environment. We offer:

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business.
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
Developed system of performance management and career development that enables you to have the freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
Opportunity to work in international and collaborative environment

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now!

Salary: 1400 – 1900 EUR gross

Title: Master Data Expert
Description:
About the job
Job description:

About the Position


We are looking for an SAP S4/HANA Master data expert to join our Data management group within LG Digital, our IT center. The Data management group is at the core of JSC „Lithuanian Railways“ digital transformation journey. You will be given a responsibility to shape and drive the design and development of our data management platform and processes. You’ll be at the front of truly complex projects, which will impact and add value to multiple parts of our business while utilizing the newest technologies and best practices. We are in the process of modernizing our data management and analytics capabilities (cloud architecture, big data and IoT capabilities, advanced analytics, SAP) and most of the project work will be in these areas. If you join early – you’ll have a big say in the design and delivery of the new solutions. If you have experience in SAP S4/Hana Master data management, are interested in business intelligence and feel comfortable with designing and building new solutions – we want to hear from you!

Job Description


Lead Data management solution sessions supporting business goals, the evaluation of the tool and delivery of MDM technology and strategic initiatives
Facilitate, guide, and influence colleagues, business partners and other teams towards right Enterprise Master Data architecture and data governance, acting as interface between Business teams and Technology teams
Responsible for analysing requirements, design, develop and implement Enterprise Master Data process solutions
This role will participate in ERP global projects responsible for oversight of data preparation and supporting data migration activities.
Organise and coordinate data preparation activities, data preparation for migration activities and data preparation trainings
Requirements


Implementation experience of SAP S4HANA MDM in key domains such as Finance & Controlling, Supply Chain, Operations & Asset Management, Sales & Marketing, Master Data Management, HR Management
Ability to conduct and facilitate workshops with business representatives, management and executive, team member resources, and external 3rd party groups
Experience in SAP Master Data Governance with at least 1 full cycle implementations would be considered as a strong advantage
Knowledge in Data replication framework (Data transfer, ALE/IDOC, Key & value mapping, MDG Export & import master data, Convert master data)
Understanding of Data Migration concepts and strategies
Experience in data migration using SAP and non-SAP solutions would be a strong advantage
Additional beneficial skills: knowledge’s DMBOK, EA frameworks such as TOGAF
Benefits in LTG


Join an inspiring and competent team in one of the biggest companies in Lithuania
Exciting and challenging work that leads to further professional and career development
A dynamic work environment during a period of big organizational change
An opportunity to contribute to improvement of corporate activities within dynamic work environment during the period of changes
Daily professional challenges and an opportunity for self-realization
Professional development for ambitious and motivated
An opportunity to travel with company’s trains free of charge in the territory of Lithuania
An opportunity to work remotely
Additional health insurance

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
As part of the Data Engineering team, you will be working alongside the Technology, Analytics and Commercial Teams. You will design and create cutting edge data solutions to our clients across various domains.

Main responsibilities:
· Contributing to building new automated, re-usable, scalable and secure data processes
· Maintaining existing data processing pipelines, troubleshooting issues and implementing fixes
· Monitoring data processing efficiency and proposing solutions for improvements

· Basic knowledge of Python (other languages might be equivalent)
· Interest in data manipulation and transfer operations
· Know your way around Unix based operating system
· Basic knowledge of git workflow
· Interest or experience in working with any major cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure)
· Strong interest in data processing technologies and desire to master the best practices in this field
· Fluent in English


Preferred skills and Experience:
· Basic experience of using Apache Airflow or other ETL tool
· Basic knowledge of database maintenance operations


We offer:
Modern office in Vilnius, Old town
Private gym next door to the office
Modern job equipment
Snacks in the office
Certificates of your choice
Team building events
Work from office, work from home, hybrid work - choose what suits you best

Salary from 1700 eur/month (gross) dependent on skill level and experience

Title: Offer Developer
Description:
About the job
Are you passionate about offer automatization and data processing?

In Swedbank You Have The Opportunity To
Develop and execute automated offers in HCL Software and Pega
Analyse data requirements and solve offer development related questions
Manage your offers portfolio performance and ensure needed improvements

At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. We support the continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. "Join our team and...

be a part of a dynamic team with broad diversity that takes on challenges with a great passion. In our team we have an open and positive atmosphere. I give freedom to my team to execute and find their own approaches and directions to reach agreed goals, of course that comes with great responsibility and trust. I appreciate pro-activeness and structured way of working, which leads to satisfied colleagues inside and outside Development team." Sigita Lankaronska, your future leader

We look forward to receiving your application by 30.09.2022.

Description:

SQL

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Title: ETL Developer / Analytics Engineer, Growth
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.
A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.
Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.
As our new ETL Analyst in the Growth domain, you will focus on making sure that we have the necessary high-quality data in our data warehouse for the business and analytical needs of the Growth domain. Growth domain at Vinted is focused on expanding our user base by optimizing the user funnel, ensuring sellers are as successful as they can be, and taking care of efficient geographical expansion and marketing tools.
You will be part of a small Growth Intelligence team alongside a few Decision Scientists. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics, Growth and you will be part of the Vinted Data Science & Analytics Guild with fellow data roles from other domains (i.e. being part of the same guild, you will collaborate and learn alongside other Analytics Engineers from other domains).
Description
To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department
Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles.
> ETL Analysts are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
> Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
> Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
In This Position, You’ll
Architect, build, and maintain efficient & reliable new data models and pipelines in partnership with Data Engineering
Continuously consult stakeholders within the company to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data models
Ensure end-users are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimization, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practices
Perform root cause analysis in case of issues in production processe
About You
2+ years working experience in a field related to Analytics Engineering/ETL Development or Data Engineering
A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or a similar field
Proficient in SQL - able to write SQL code which is easy to understand, simple to troubleshoot and is highly performant
Familiar with data modeling, data access and data storage techniques
Working experience in another programming language e.g. Python, Java, Scala
Familiar with Git
Strong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutions
Exceptionally attentive to details
Excellent written and spoken English
Advantage: working experience with distributed databases
Advantage: Apache Spark knowledge
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Private health insurance
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.
Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.
The salary range for this position is 2500 - 4600 € (gross) per month.
If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need.

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Consultant
Description:
About the job
The Economies and Consumers Data team in Vilnius office is currently looking for an enthusiastic and creative Data Consultant to join the team.
The main activities of the team include micro and macro-economic data analysis of global markets, modelling of data at country and city level, a high frequency macro-economic data forecasting, building indices and data science projects.
In this role Data Consultant will be working independently and as a part of the wider team. She/he will be a proactive problem-solver with a high level of attention to details, able to work on multiple projects at once, and have a desire and ability to communicate data-science, statistical concepts, and results to various audiences. In addition, she/he is expected to constantly contribute to improvement of existing modelling methods, as well as seeking for and implementing new techniques to ensure a high quality of data output.

Key Responsibilities
Maintain and develop existing statistical analyses pipelines using R.
Learn and incorporate new and more appropriate methods from statistical and economic literature into the pipelines of used analyses.
Consult and ensure that the analyses undertaken by the team are statistically and economically robust.
Maintain version-controlled, fully annotated scripts following used style guides.
Write guides/explainers for statistical analyses suitable for different audiences.
Work collaboratively with the Business Development and Technology teams.
Attend regular update meetings and work with wider Research team.
Update wider company, management, or board on progress as required.

Requirements
A master degree or PhD in scientific discipline that has helped you to build strong quantitative and coding skills.
Advanced knowledge of macroeconomic theory and econometrics.
Interest in fields and techniques like Bayesian methods, Agent-based modelling, time series forecasting, Data Science.
Strong R coding is essential, SQL is an advantage.
Experience with R Shiny App and package development would be an advantage.
Basic knowledge of Git version control to maintain code.
Good organization and effective communication skills.
Ability to explain statistical concepts and results to non-specialists.

Benefits
Salary range for this position starts with 3050 - 3550 EUR monthly gross. Plus additional health insurance, longer holidays, flexible working hours, work from home, other perks.

Why work for Euromonitor?
Our values
We act with integrity
We are curious about the world
We are stronger together
We seek to empower
We find strength in diversity

International: not only do we have a very multinational workforce in each office but we are all dealing with our 15 offices worldwide on a daily basis. With 15 offices globally there are regular opportunities for international transfer.
Hardworking but sociable: our staff know how to work hard but also how to enjoy themselves! We pride ourselves on creating an appropriate work-life balance, with flexible hours and regular socialising including frequent after work meet ups, summer and Christmas parties and a whole range of sports and other groups to be involved with.
Committed to making a difference: We think that people are looking for something worthwhile in a company beyond the workplace. Our extensive Corporate Social Responsibility Programme gives each member of staff two volunteering days a year in addition to holidays. It sees us reaching out into the local community with our mentoring, group volunteering, and fundraising initiatives as well as supporting international charities through our website sales, matching staff sponsorship fundraising, and carbon offsetting all our flights, amongst many other activities.
Excellent benefits: we offer highly competitive salaries, enhanced healthcare and pensions, plus generous holiday allowances and in many offices a Core Hours policy allowing flexible start and finish times to each day.
