Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Title: Data Science Platform Engineer
Description:
About the job
TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice

What We'll Bring

Do you enjoy being surrounded and collaborating with like-minded and talented people who have a passion to innovate? TransUnion provides innovative solutions that help ordinary people and businesses create economic opportunity and personal empowerment for hundreds of millions of people in more than 30 countries. So if you want to join a growing, inspiring and forward thinking business, come, join your new team here at TransUnion Lithuania!

What You'll Bring

Experience using and configuring Data Science tools in Linux HPC environments. Knowledge ofNix is a plus.
Programming skills and experience with HPC environments big data platforms (Hive, Spark, Hadoop).
Demonstrate skills with statistical programs such as R and Python; Knowledge in other programming languages (C/C++, Scala, Java) would be a plus.
Project and time management skills to collaborate in multiple projects simultaneously with limited supervision in a fast-paced environment.
Evidence of strong analytical, critical, and creative thinking and willingness to take initiative in problem-solving.
Versatile interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels within and outside the organization
3+ years of relevant professional experience
Fluency in English

Impact You'll Make

You will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams to drive the setup and ongoing success of new data science environments in multiple markets. Tasks will include – among others – the development of effective data science workflows, the localization of global tools, and liaising with global SMEs in data science and technology.

Lead new HPC environment setup on behalf of data science teams. As a project leader, you will take ownership of all aspects of the project from environment design to tool development, to training.
Assist Global Technology with maintenance of the tools and frameworks used by analysts on the high-performance computing (HPC) cluster and participate in projects led by Global Technology as a subject matter expert on machine learning and scientific computing.
Provide oversight and hands-on support for the development of analytic solutions using languages such as R, Python, SQL, Hive and Spark, formalizing some of these efforts into repeatable process improvements.
Be the trusted technical partner for TransUnion’s colleagues and provide an analytic perspective and general support as needed.
Identify strategies and opportunities to test and adopt TransUnion’s analytic products and services.
Contribute to research and innovation initiatives in collaboration with other DSA peers and may lead small analytic research teams or manage research interns on a project basis, as needed.
Participate in interviewing and evaluation of new talent, mentoring and training of junior colleagues.
Foster a high-performance culture and cultivate an environment that promotes excellence and reflects the TransUnion brand.

What You'll Get

Flexible work: hybrid, remote or on-site, which ever is more suitable to you
Additional Global Well-ness days off, volunteering time off and birthday celebration day off
Experienced and highly motivated team with big focus on project delivery quality
Health insurance package, free access to Headspace app and online BOXHIT yoga class
Business/Individual performance-based annual bonuses
Financial rewards for Azure/AWS certifications
Well defined career growth path using a matrix of skills needed to move on to the next level
Dedicated training budget for professional improvement (training courses of your choice, books, global conferences, business trips, etc.);
Linux Academy, Ministry of Testing, LinkedIn learning zone memberships
Modern 2500 square meter office in Zalgiris arena with free parking
Free of charge entry to Zalgiris LKL and Euroleague basketball games in VIP Zalgiris box
Regular team events such as team buildings, summer/winter parties, sports & retreats
Opportunity to participate in TransUnion Share purchase plan
The salary range for this position is €3900 – 5000/mon. gross, depending upon experience.

About TransUnion

TransUnion is a global information and insights company which provides solutions that help create economic opportunity, great experiences and personal empowerment for hundreds of millions of people in more than 30 countries. We call this Information for Good®.

TransUnion is a leading credit reference agency and we offer specialist services in fraud, identity and risk management, automated decisioning and demographics. We support organisations across a wide variety of sectors including finance, retail, telecommunications, utilities, gaming, government and insurance.

Find Out More About Our Office Life

https://www.facebook.com/TransUnionLithuania/

https://www.instagram.com/transunion.lithuania/

https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/transunion-lithuania/

Wellbeing

At TransUnion we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work for our dedication to creating a culture where associates are included, valued and embraced for who they are. We’re also committed to supporting physical, mental and financial fitness with a series of events and activities.

Remote Interview & Hiring Process

Our recruitment experience for this role is fully virtual for the time being. You will be based either from our office in Kaunas or working remotely as part of our ‘flex together’ approach.

TransUnion Job Title

Consultant, Data Science and Analytics

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
About The Job

Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business, and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career, enhance your skill set, and build connections around the globe, Toptal is right for you.

About Toptal

Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers, designers, finance experts, product managers, and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers. Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries, from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network, our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions. About the role We are looking for a Data Engineer (independent contractor) whose main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have a significant impact on the client’s velocity. Requirements
3+ years of professional experience in software development.
Working experience with Python required.
Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling.
Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns, including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures.
Working experience with Tibco is a big plus.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus.
Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Full-time availability is a strong advantage
If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients, take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.

#GlobalOpportunities #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: Senior Data Engineer (SAP BW)
Description:
About the job
Job description:

Pozicijos aprašymas


We are looking for the Data Engineer within LTG Digital, our IT centre. LTG Digital is at the core of JSC „Lithuanian Railways“ digital transformation journey. You’ll be given an early responsibility to shape and drive the design and development of our Enterprise Data Warehouse solutions. You’ll be at the front of truly complex projects, which will impact and add value to multiple parts of our business while utilising the newest technologies and best practices.



We are in the process of modernizing our data management and analytics capabilities (cloud architecture, big data and IoT capabilities, advanced analytics, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW/4HANA) and most of the project work will be in these areas.





Establishment of Enterprise Data Warehouse solutions on the basis of SAP BW/4HANA
Managing and improving the ETL processing, modelling and building new data flows to meet business information needs
Participating in all phases of business intelligence projects and supporting the existing business as usual activities
Ensuring that business intelligence best practices and methodologies are being used across projects and processes
Depending on expertise, act as an advisor for business intelligence, analytics tools, data pipeline and data warehousing questions
Ensuring quality assurance and data security best practices across business intelligence systems




Jūsų kompetencijos ir patirtis


You have experience with SAP BW (on HANA) and/or SAP BW/4HANA (Preferably possess related certifications)
Solid data warehousing and ETL development experience
Exposure to both SAP and non-SAP source system landscapes
Advantage if you have experience modelling Calculation views / CDS views on SAP HANA
Preferred exposure to SAP BO Data Services and / or MS SQL Server and SSIS
SQL proficiency and solid understanding of data structures, relations, data flows and database modelling and design
SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP BO and / or MS Power BI functionality awareness is an advantage
Solid understanding of SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics functionality and positioning
Solid understanding of current data warehousing best practices and trends. Good awareness of data reporting, visualisation and dashboarding. Advantage, if you have awareness of Service Oriented Architecture, Master Data Management and automated data management solutions
Experience in working and contributing to project work and tasks. Ability to work independently and in a complex change environment while meeting pre-agreed timelines.
Professional approach to using project management and issue tracking tools
Solid understanding of dev/test/prod lifecycle, testing and data quality assurance practices
A big plus, if you have experience or solid understanding of data engineering practices in Big Data/Data Science space
LTG savo darbuotojams siūlo


Join an inspiring and competent team in one of the biggest companies in Lithuania
Exciting and challenging work that leads to further professional and career development
A dynamic work environment during a period of big organizational change
An opportunity to contribute to improvement of corporate activities within dynamic work environment during the period of changes
Daily professional challenges and an opportunity for self-realization
Professional development for ambitious and motivated
An opportunity to travel with company’s trains free of charge in the territory of Lithuania
An opportunity to work remotely
Additional health insurance

Title: Data Analytics Manager – Customer Experience Group Based in Bangkok
Description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Overview

We are looking for analysts to join the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia based in Bangkok, Thailand. Agoda is a strongly data driven organization: as a Data Analyst Manager, you will have the opportunity to analyze billions of actions of millions of travelers choosing from over a million hotels.

The Customer Experience Group handles many thousands of customer and property interactions every day through different channels such as phone, email and chat. Our ability to provide an excellent customer and partner experience with the highest possible efficiency has a major impact on the overall success of Agoda. You will help grow our business by using the data to identify opportunities to drive efficiency, reduce customer friction and increase customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Your Responsibilities

You will manage a Data Analytics team that produces analyses and insights, offers recommendations and drives decision making for various stakeholders across the business. To achieve this, you will work with a global operational team consisting of more than 50 different nationalities.

You will get the opportunity to own analytical projects end to end, starting from understanding stakeholder needs to the analysis and interpretation of results as well as the communication of conclusions to management, the operational teams and other groups in Agoda (Product, IT, Partner Services, Marketing, and Finance).

Specifically your responsibilities will include:

Recruit, train, develop and supervise analyst-level employees
Lead the delivery of analytical projects end to end
Define the business problem and analytical approach
Ensure the appropriate usage of statistical and data analytical techniques to perform the analysis
Communicate findings to stakeholders using the right data visualizations
This will require you to balance priorities and appropriately update stakeholders throughout the whole process

Conceptualize and oversee the delivery and quality control of regular reports

Your Qualifications And Experience

The ideal candidate will fulfill the following requirements:

5+ years of experience working as a data analyst, preferably working with large data volumes and 2+ years of experience managing analytical teams
Master’s degree or higher in computer sciences, engineering, mathematics, statistics, data science or a related degree program with excellent academic results
Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques and experience in applying these in practice
Strong SQL skills: ability to efficiently extract data from large and complex databases. Additional proficiency in Python, R or VBA and / or visualization software such as Tableau would be a plus, while not necessarily required
Excellent problem solving and comprehension skills as well as strong business sense
Excellent communication skills: ability to communicate with people of differing levels of seniority and analytical understanding
High level of organization: ability to manage multiple, competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines and pressure
Fluent in English both spoken and written – additional languages are a plus

Your Attitude

You are curious, flexible and solution-oriented. You strive for excellence and are attentive to detail, but you also “get things done”!
You are interested in telling an impactful story using analysis and smart data visualization rather than just applying methodologies and crunching the numbers
You are a team player with a willingness to share your opinion and pro-actively propose ideas and you enjoy being part of a dynamic and fast moving multinational team

What We Offer

A clearly defined career path will help you to continuously develop your skills
Benefits:
Annual performance bonus
Relocation package for employees joining from abroad
International health insurance
Discount for Agoda employee booking on Agoda.com
Reimbursement of parking fees

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Consulting Analytics
Machine Learning Operations Engineer
Description:
About the job
At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. Storytel is one of the world’s leading audiobook and ebook streaming services and we offer unlimited listening to consumers in 25+ markets. Our vision is to make the world a more empathetic place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed by anyone, anywhere, anytime. We are now looking for an MLOps Engineer to join the Machine Learning team.
About The Role
Storytel is hiring an MLOps Engineer to join the Machine Learning team, within the Data & Engineering Foundation domain. We are working on a range of exciting problems centered on automated content curation, recommendations, and customer engagement. In this role you will be part of a team that is creating solutions that connect our users to stories from all over the world.
As an MLOps Engineer at Storytel, you will primarily be working with:
Creating an ML development ecosystem that will enable experimentation, quick deployment and serving of ML products
Improving our current ML products with state-of-the-art engineering and MLOps practices
Collaborating with product managers, engineers, and others in a truly cross functional fashion to deliver end-user value
Innovating and prototyping new ideas and solutions for all of our book-loving users
Engaging with the ML community at Storytel and helping it grow
About The Team
The Machine Learning team is responsible for designing and implementing state-of-the-art models for content recommendation and automated content curation as well as a broad range of applications dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience.
We work with Google Cloud Platform and our production models are built in Python. Our goal is to implement an end-to-end scalable MLOps platform that will enable us to easily and safely deploy and monitor models of increasing complexity.
You will be our first MLOps Engineer, joining a team of 5 data scientists with various levels of seniority. As we are currently developing the area, you will have the opportunity to become part of shaping how we work and collaborate with our data engineering and infrastructure teams.
About You
The ideal candidate has several of the following qualifications:
+4 years of experience working as a Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer or MLOps Engineer
Hands-on experience with Python and SQL
Experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
Experience in automated training pipeline and orchestration workflows (CI/CD, Vertex AI, Azure ML, Airflow. etc)
Hands-on experience in developing scalable machine learning infrastructure
Knowledge of model lifecycle management
Ability to articulate MLOps best practices and interest in staying on the cutting edge of developments in the MLOps domain
Eagerness to minimise technical debt while building suitable, robust and flexible solutions for our maturing ML ecosystem
Passion and drive for continuous learning and pride in establishing software engineering processes and best practices
Moreover, collaboration is key in everything we do, therefore humility and strong verbal and written communication skills are of utmost importance.
Bonus Points
Experience with Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of common ML performance metrics and relevant ML monitoring tools
Distributed training and GPU-based training
Knowledge of Responsible AI principles
What We Offer
Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy, we like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterised by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it.
We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in. And of course – you get unlimited access to audio and ebooks from our service!
This candidate will ideally be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Stockholm, Sweden. We also welcome fully remote positions in the EU region for the right candidate. Does this sound like an opportunity for you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, let us know and we will contact you as soon as possible.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
About the job
Join our team as a Software Engineer!

Yes, you can! That's our attitude towards our work, ambitious, ideas and relationships. We, at Luminor, believe that anyone has the potential to achieve big things and we encourage everyone to achieve them – professionally and personally.

Whoever you are, and whatever your role is, with Luminor you will get a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to literally build a local banking champion.

Luminor is offering employment for people displaced by the invasion of Ukraine. We are a dynamic, Pan-Baltic bank with a diverse team and have a number of great professional opportunities available both in business and support functions.

What You Will Do:

Implement code/unit/programs/systems independently or as a part of an implementation team
Develop solution aligned with relevant IT standards and requirements
Test own developed components and programs as units and participate in system test
Ensure reusability, understand the decided architecture and design
Document own work – primarily code and design
Participate in hand over of documentation and relevant knowledge to the maintenance organization
Plan, estimate effort and report possible consequences of own work
Know current System Development Process and act accordingly
Contribute to the testing and the release process
Proactively plan, deliver and follow-up of your personal tasks timely and according to the set quality standards and budget
Contribute to team and company performance through effective collaboration and acting with energy, enthusiasm and commitment

What We Expect:

3+ years in Software development
OpenEdge ABL experience
Basic knowledge HTML, JS
System Development Life Cycle
Software Development methodologies
Release management
Fluent English is required in spoken and written communication
Higher education in Computer Science or other exact science specialization

What We Offer:

Flexibility. Flexible working hours, remote work and possibility to work from anywhere in EU, Iceland, Switzerland and UK (in total 90 days per year)
International teams. Teams that go outside Pan-Baltic boarders where people value challenging work together with good humour and having fun
More vacation. Additional week of vacation available to all employees who have been in the company for 1 year or more
Volunteer time off. We care about giving back to society, therefore, you will get additional days off for volunteering purposes
Health benefits. A competitive benefits package in addition to your salary that includes health insurance in Lithuania and Latvia, and Wellness package in Estonia. As well as, Health days in case of your absence due to sickness
Wellbeing. Access to tools and resources that help to feel good and be productive at work and in life
Professional growth. Internal and external training programs, workshops, conferences, online training etc.
Gross salary. 2570 - 3800EUR/month, which is to be determined depending on your level of experience and competencies

Application deadline is 25th of September

Luminor is the leading independent bank in the Baltics and the third-largest provider of financial services in our region. We serve the financial needs of individuals, families, and companies. Just like our home markets of Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania we are young, dynamic, and forward looking.

Luminor has a strong and capable team that is committed to achieving our strategic objectives. We are dedicated to supporting sustainable growth in the Baltic region by providing a long-term commitment to businesses and individuals.

Title: ETL Developer / Analytics Engineer, Monetisation
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.
A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.
Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.
Monetisation domain at Vinted is focused on strengthening and diversifying our non- transactional revenue streams by creating and optimizing value added services to our members and partnering with external parties to make second hand fashion more accessible worldwide.
As our new Analytics Engineer in the Monetisation domain, you will focus on making sure that we have the necessary high-quality data readily available for various business and analytical needs.
You will be part of a small Monetisation Intelligence team alongside a few Decision Scientists. At the same time you will be part of the Data Science & Analytics (DSA) Guild with fellow data roles from other domains (i.e. being part of the same guild, you will collaborate and learn alongside other Analytics Engineers from other domains).
Description
To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department
Within Data Science & Analytics we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
In This Position, You’ll
Architect, build, and maintain efficient & reliable data models and pipelines for both external and internal data in partnership with data engineering
Continuously consult data and business stakeholders within the company to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data models
Ensure end-users are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimisation, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practices
Perform root cause analysis in case of issues in production processes
About You
2+ years of experience as Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst/Scientist, Data Engineer or a similar Data role
Proficient in SQL - able to write SQL code which is easy to understand, simple to troubleshoot and is highly performant
Working experience in another programming language e.g. Python, Java, Scala
Familiar with data modelling, data access and data storage techniques
Strong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutions
Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Attentive to detail
Advantage: working experience in cloud environment, for example Google Cloud Platform
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.
Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.
The salary range for this position is 2,500 – 4,600 € (gross) per month.
If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Junior Data Engineer in Information Platform at SEB in Vilnius
Description:
About the job
SEB is a leading financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?

SEB is the best place to become a Data Engineer in Lithuania

Best track record in the market for becoming a Data Engineer
Learn “on the job” from the best and biggest data engineering team in Lithuania
We are the SEB Data Engineering Center of Excellence
The best technologies and stack (GCP, Kafka, Ansible, Qlik replicate, and many more)

What You Will Be Doing

As Data Engineer, you will work in an environment with multiple Agile teams located in both Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data technologies.

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Ensure that real-time processing services have reliability and uptime appropriate to users' needs and a fast rate of improvement while keeping an ever-watchful eye on capacity and performance.
Continuously engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
Seek to run better production systems—we build our own creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.
Discovering new solutions to build new services to our clients.
Who we are looking for:

Knowledge of distributed event streaming systems like Kafka
Working knowledge of ITIL, or other formal incident, problem, and change management process experience
Creativity to solve complex problems
Understanding of logging, monitoring and observability platforms (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Grafana, etc.)
Java, Python and/or Scala knowledge

It will be an advantage if you have:

Enjoy doing explorations and learnings in different stages of the development process
Public Cloud platform skills (GCP, AWS or Azure)
Experience with automation and configuration management systems (Ansible/Chef)
What we offer:

Best place to be a Data Engineer in Lithuania
Extensive training and learning opportunities (Pluralsight, Coursera, Innovation days and more)
Diversity of data engineering work and technologies to choose from
Work-life balance
SEB Remuneration package (health insurance, learning budget, contribution to your pension 3% of a monthly salary, profit-sharing program, additional paid vacation days each year)
Possibility to work remotely 3 days per week

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

We are looking forward to your application.

Monthly salary range for this position: 1900 - 4200 EUR (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today.

Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers

Title: Mendix Developer
Description:
About the job
Come work at the heart of change
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

You will take lead role for Development and Architecture
You will be part of SCRUM team for one or more projects
Advocate LowCode Mendix development approach and develop best practices


WHAT WE EXPECT

3+ years of experience with Mendix Mobile or Web
Knowledge of design patterns commonly used with Mendix
Hands on experience with Widgets, Connectors, Modules, CSS custom development


WHY ACCENTURE?
Our 537,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.
Accenture Baltics is a part of a global enterprise and in Latvia Accenture is the largest company providing end-to-end technology and business services, with more than 1800 talents on board since 2002.
Working at Accenture allows you to continue to grow and learn as you are exposed to new technologies and business strategies on an on-going basis. Here, you’ll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to make incredible things.
Innovation, a constant at Accenture, enables us to find new ways to stay ahead of our clients’ challenges. Our inclusive, diverse and strong culture of equality helps us constantly drive innovation in the workplace.
Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Offered salary for this role 2600 - 5000 EUR gross.

Title: FinCrime Analyst (Crypto Analyst)
Description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 20+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The Financial Crime Operations department is at the forefront of Revolut’s efforts to keep customers and their money safe 🥷 Those ninjas work directly with customers to resolve issues and flag potential concerns. Using cutting edge technology, we aim to prevent financial crime in a way the banking world hasn’t seen so far 💫

Crypto Analysts is the key person to ensure we’ve got it under control, working with the Revolut Compliance team. It’s only for the most responsible, conscientious, brave individuals. The ones who aren’t afraid of challenges of the complex financial world 🕶

👉 We’re a global financial super app, so we have to be available 24/7. That sometimes means working nights and weekends. We’ll compensate you for night shifts but we understand this still isn’t for everyone so please bear that in mind before applying.

What You’ll Be Doing
Providing KYC/CDD analysis of individual customers
Undertaking research, documents checks, and financial crime risk assessment via internal and external sources
Developing understanding of cybercrime and criminal use-cases for cryptocurrencies and undertaking research via open source and darknet
Perform screening
Use blockchain investigation tools to perform forensic analyses of crypto-transactions as well as wallets
Detecting and report suspicious activity including the predicate offenses to money laundering and terrorist financing
Ensuring all documents submitted for CDD are in line with internal policies
Analysing alerts generated by the monitoring system in order to identify potentially suspicious activity
Escalating any red flags and potential risks to the relevant escalation teams
Handling sensitive or confidential information

What You'll Need
Fluency in English
Experience in the crypto industry, ideally within an Virtual Asset Services Provider (VASP) such as crypto exchanges
Experience in working with the blockchains investigation tools
Experience in handling suspicious AML/Screening cases that involve both fiat and crypto transactions
Ability to work together with multiple compliance teams
Ability to multitask and prioritise
Ability to work well under pressure and tight time frames
Willingness to work different shifts
Excellent communication skills

Nice to have
Fluency in any other language
Prior experience in banking in risk or AML/KYC function
Experience in threat intelligence, or cybersecurity
Strong technical knowledge of blockchains and cryptocurrencies

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries.

We have 130+ great people in Tietoevry Lithuania providing solutions for the largest companies in Lithuania, mostly focusing on the main areas of expertise in telecommunications and financial services, also we are experienced in a number of Tietoevry projects in the Nordic countries.

Looking for a highly motivated Data Engineer!

As the leading supplier of integrated solutions for healthcare providers in the Nordics, Tietoevry has years of experience in digitalizing the industry. Our mission is to support healthcare professionals in providing better care, help healthcare organizations improve their efficiency and empower citizens to actively participate in their care.

Healthcare Cloud Data and Analytics team is a team consisting of recognized professionals in the fields of data science, data engineering and architecture, data transformation advisory, security and software development. We are a team of 50 talented, forward-looking and self-driven experts. With us you get to work with Big Data, Machine Learning, Databricks, Apache Spark and Kubernetes all running in modern Azure Cloud. Apart from nice technologies in Tietoevry you get opportunity to work in multinational environment and truly have an impact on society.

More about the role:

Tietoevry is establishing new Big Data team as a part of Healthcare unit in Vilnius. Currently we are looking for Data Engineer for development of cloud data platform solutions. Your main tasks will involve design and development of customer data pipelines and advanced analytics solutions.

If you have skills in the latest data platform technologies and passion to continuously learn new things and aim higher, this will be the perfect place for you!

We expect you have:
Experience with public cloud environments: Azure, AWS, GCP
Experience working with data integrations, data processing and data modelling
Experience in data centric projects.
Experience working in technical roles in complex software development projects.
Basic Knowledge of the major big data solutions like Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Databricks, Spark and Kafka is an advantage.
Passion to continuously learn new things and aim higher.
Good English language skills.

We offer:
A stimulating environment where we every day strive to build the best possible IT solution there is, for future healthcare
Possibility to work in team of healthcare professionals and build, deliver and support world leading solution
The highest development standards (code reviews, knowledge sharing meetings)
Good career development possibilities in an international company
Motivating, creative and flexible working environment
Salary range from 3000 Eur to 7000 Eur gross per month. Exact offer will be based on your knowledge and experience
Additional benefit package (health insurance, teambuildings, games, food treats, etc)

Sounds interesting? Let’s talk! ;)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the job
Role Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Europe - Remote

We are looking for a seasoned Machine Learning Engineer who has real world machine learning experience. You feel equally comfortable performing data mining and machine learning tasks on your laptop as you are in large compute environments. You take pride in owning and maintaining the technical work environment. You enjoy telling the data story and are capable of communicating deep analytical insights to less experienced members of the R&D team and our customers. Lastly, you have been looking for an opportunity where you can use your passion and skills for a greater good against financial crime.

Example Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the R&D team to build a distributed cloud-based SaaS solution for Identity Document Classification and Data Extraction.
Build scalable machine learning models, algorithms, and analytics on large financial datasets (both fiat currency and cryptocurrency) to detect suspicious activity.
Maintain and improve the data pipelines which support our complex data sets.
Research new techniques, algorithms, and best practices within the industry.
Explore, evaluate, and integrate new data pipelines.
Participate in client interactions.

Skills and Experience:
Advanced degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field.
Proven and relevant industry experience
Business driven and result-oriented individual.
In-depth knowledge of Statistics, Probability, and Machine learning.
Supervised and unsupervised statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, dimensionality reduction.
Machine learning algorithms and concepts such as Random Forest, Boosting, SVMs, neural networks.
Experience developing computer vision based solutions.
Exposure to NLP models and techniques such as sentiment analysis, word embeddings, Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is a plus.
Fluent in Python, including data science tools such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, Pytorch, PIL, Pandas etc.
Passionate about writing reusable quality code.
Effective communication & collaboration skills.

Extra Credit:
Experience with big data technologies such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, and Spark is a big plus.
Built backend systems using Java and Python.
Experience using cloud based solutions: AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with ML Ops tools and practices: Docker, CI/CD etc.

Key Characteristics and Attitudes:

In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.
Friendly and supportive
Adaptable and flexible
Articulate and persuasive
High IQ and EQ
Curious and coachable
Commercially Aware
Resilient and tenacious
Big picture and the detail

Jumio is the leading provider of online identity verification, eKYC and AML solutions. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.

Jumio Values:

IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountable, Leading Innovation

Equal Opportunities:

Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from all backgrounds and of all statuses.

About Jumio:

Jumio is a B2B technology company dedicated to eradicating online identity fraud, money laundering and other financial crimes to help make the internet safer. We leverage AI, biometrics, machine learning, liveness detection and automation to create solutions that are trusted by leading brands worldwide and respected by industry thought leaders.

Jumio is the leading provider of online identity verification, eKYC and AML solutions. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.

Applicant Data Privacy

We will only use your personal information in connection with Jumio’s application, recruitment, and hiring processes, as described in Jumio’s Applicant Privacy Notice. If you have any questions or comments, please send an email to privacy@jumio.com.
