Title: Engineering Manager for Cloud Data Platform at SEB
Description:
About the job
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?

What You Will Be Doing

Information Platform department consists of 60 professionals located in Stockholm and Vilnius. We develop SEB Cloud Data Platform to enable access to trusted and timely data to drive business. Separate delivery teams focus on development of the technical capabilities of the platform and delivering strategic data initiatives.

We are looking for an Engineering manager in Vilnius to lead two Agile teams for

data governance and management solutions
business intelligence solutions

Technologies include but are not limited to Collibra, Tableau and Google Data Platform covering Big Query, Data Studio, Looker and more.

You will be responsible for:

Personal development of up to 12 data engineers.
Developing high-performing teams with outstanding commitment to common goals, mutual trust and respect, clarity around individual roles and responsibilities, and great collaboration.
High quality, timely delivery, and maintenance of technical solutions.
Understanding of business needs, close cooperation with product managers and removing impediments.
IT asset management and operations.
Risk management and security.
Vendor, contract, and licence management.
Continuous improvements in all aspects of our business.
We expect that you:

Get a great deal of personal satisfaction from growing other people.
Are skillful in understanding and building great team dynamics.
Have solid background in IT infrastructure, software development and operations.
Have experience in Agile way of working with self-organizing cross functional teams.
Have good understanding the product management function and excel in communication and expectation management.
Have preferably worked with vendor and contract management.
Are deeply passionate about technology and strive to learn.
Are fluent in verbal and written English.
What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
Ambitious, highly professional, and truly awesome team.
Friendly and welcoming culture.
Work-life balance.
SEB Remuneration package (health insurance, learning budget, contribution to your pension 3% of a monthly salary, profit-sharing program, additional paid vacation days each year).
Possibility to work remotely 3 days per week.

Monthly salary range for this position: 3700 - 6000 EUR (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate.Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Learn more about benefits at SEB and why you´ll love working with us here: https://www.seb.lt/en/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Ready to join?

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of September 2022. If you have questions about the position please contact Rita Paškevičiūtė, Head of Information platform department at phone no +370 685 41882 or by e-mail rita.paskeviciute@seb.se .

Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today.

Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers

Title: Internship
Description:
About the job
Invest Lithuania is the ﬁrst point of contact for global companies looking to establish operations in Lithuania. We are focused on building the perfect product for global business, in order to attract foreign direct investment that leads to new jobs and capital investment. You could be part of smart, sharp and progressive team. Currently we are looking for ambitious, energetic and professional Intern to join Invest Lithuania team!

We invite you to:
Prepare drafts of various presentations, summaries, consultations, etc.
Analysis of various industries and trends.
Conduct research on foreign markets and key industries.
Take part in social initiatives that aim to improve Lithuania’s investment climate.
Provide day-to-day support in various tasks.
We expect you to have:
Fluent in English.
Competitive and proactive attitude.
Excellent written communication skills.
Basic knowledge of foreign and Lithuanian businesses, investment environment and industry trends.
Strong diplomatic, inter-personal and inter-cultural communication and presentation skills.
Willingness to learn and proactive personality.

Title: Dev Ops Engineer (Data Platform)
Description:
About the job
Revel Systems powers the ambitions of restaurants and retailers with a robust cloud based point of sale (POS) and business management system. Improving day-to-day operations and fuelling merchant growth, Revel’s streamlined ecosystem helps customers seize their future by pairing an intuitive POS with powerful management tools on a single platform. Founded in 2010 with major offices in Atlanta, Vilnius, and San Francisco, Revel is a leading member of the Apple Enterprise Mobility Program.

Join the Analytics and BI teams at Revel! We help Revel customers make data driven decisions. We are an autonomous team not only building high quality products but doing so while investing in ourselves, our processes and tooling. As a DevOps engineer for data platform you will have direct influence on how we go about fulfilling this mission.

As a DevOps Engineer (Data Platform), You Will
Work as part of a team to design intuitive data products and dashboard visualizations
Refine our data engineering platform and tooling including our CI/CD processes
Review and implement data transformations to ensure high performance and reliability
Work with the team to help decide which customer questions/use cases we will focus on
Design data marts to serve our customer facing dashboards
We Expect That You
Have at least 3 years of experience crafting solutions in professional environments
Have experience optimizing Redshift performance
Have worked with a data lake / warehouse / lakehouse
Have worked with real time data streaming solutions
Have worked with terabyte scale products
Have worked with layered architectures and APIs
Are fluent in English as we have colleagues from around the world
Our Project

As a DevOps engineer you will have worked with a variety of technologies. We don’t expect you to know our entire stack. Of course, the greater the overlap the better :)

Our data engineering platform is currently a data warehouse and related data pipelines which support customer facing dashboards. We use `dbt` (SQL) to manage our transformations and a collection of AWS services all managed through Terraform and GitLab pipelines (Redshift, Batch, DMS, Step Functions, Lambda, API Gateway, EventBridge, Dynamo, RDS).

Our Values
Quality in everything we do. Clean code, pair programming, infrastructure as code, CI pipelines and tests. We write robust automated tests for every piece of code. We release often using automated pipelines that support continuous delivery.
Be the change you want to see. As part of one of the most innovative squads in Revel, you will constantly get a chance to evolve the way we work.
Continuous personal growth. Be challenged and motivated by Revel’s talented, yet friendly ;) engineers. Regular feedback comes from peers informally and through 360 reviews. Technical and leadership career opportunities exist across Revel’s expansive suite of products. You’ll also enjoy an education and conference travel budget allowance.
Communicate boldly. We enter conversations with clearly and strongly stated opinions, but eagerly listen and learn from our teammates. Our code reviews are full of productive discussions. Your voice will be heard in our self organizing, team led structure.
Scrum puts teams first. We are a very proactive, passionate and autonomous team. Young but mature professionals who bring joy to each other’s day. And we spend much of those days pair programming together. Agile is our default mindset. We believe in T-shaped skill sets. We each have our strengths but are willing to pull tasks from any domain.
Salary

Salary ranges from 2900 to 6300 € gross

By applying for a job position and submitting your personal data, you confirm that you have read and accept Revel Systems’ Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
Are you independent and passionate about IT? A warm colleague who cares about others?

If so, we might be a great match!

About KOMPONENT:
Project-based work in the areas of software development, IoT and IT security, mainly with Norwegian Customers, across a broad range of domains: fin-tech, media, robotics, oil, and SoMe to name a few...

Title: Sourcery for Developers Klaipėda 2022 Fall
Description:
About the job
Description

Start your career in software development with the intense program at Sourcery for Developers. Complete the admission and enter our free of charge three-month academy, available in the Fall of each year. Students are invited to e-learning course and create custom projects with the help of software development professionals from Devbridge/Cognizant Softvision.

Students will learn the latest technologies and how to create software using the best tools on the market. Furthermore, Devbridge/Cognizant Softvision assigns a mentor to each student to serve as a resource for their custom development projects.

At the end of the academy all students will receive recognition for completing the course and top graduates will be invited for an interview to become a Junior Software Engineers.

Important dates

Admission: Sep 29th

Academy: Oct 13th – Dec 22nd

Main responsibilities
Attend e-learning course and learn React, Spring Boot
Complete group project
Dedicate 15-20 hours per week

Requirements
Basic OOP, JavaScript and JAVA knowledge
Basic relational databases and SQL knowledge
Problem solving skills
Passion for self-development
Motivation to start or make a career change

Title: Cloud Data Solution Architect
Description:
About the job
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries.

We have 130+ great people in Tietoevry Lithuania providing solutions for the largest companies in Lithuania, mostly focusing on the main areas of expertise in telecommunications and financial services, also we are experienced in a number of Tietoevry projects in the Nordic countries.

Looking for a Cloud Data Solution Architect!

As the leading supplier of integrated solutions for healthcare providers in the Nordics, Tietoevry has years of experience in digitalizing the industry. Our mission is to support healthcare professionals in providing better care, help healthcare organizations improve their efficiency and empower citizens to actively participate in their care.

Healthcare Cloud Data and Analytics team is a team consisting of recognized professionals in the fields of data science, data engineering and architecture, data transformation advisory, security and software development. We are a team of 50 talented, forward-looking and self-driven experts. With us you get to work with Big Data, Machine Learning, Databricks, Apache Spark and Kubernetes all running in modern Azure Cloud. Apart from nice technologies in Tietoevry you get opportunity to work in multinational environment and truly have an impact on society.

Your tasks and responsibilities:
You will have the key role in designing and developing new cloud based advanced analytics solutions together with our customers and contribute to our product development of healthcare cloud data platform and intelligent wellbeing applications
You will work a lot at the customer interface: creating and analysing requirements, designing concepts and turning them into solutions that create value for customers and business success for the company
Internally you will work in a lead role with our expert teams and sales team

We expect you have:
Experience in the area of cloud and data-driven solutions and hands-on experience in implementing and using cloud and big data related technologies
Passion to innovate and design new products and help customers to find best possible solutions to their needs
Demonstrated ability to lead development teams and deliver results
Experience with public cloud environments: Azure, AWS, GCP
Experience working in technical roles in complex software development projects
Experience with big data solutions like Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Databricks, Spark and Kafka
Passion to continuously learn new things and aim higher
Good English language skills

We offer:
A stimulating environment where we every day strive to build the best possible IT solution there is, for future healthcare
Possibility to work in team of healthcare professionals and build, deliver and support world leading solution
The highest development standards (code reviews, knowledge sharing meetings)
Good career development possibilities in an international company
Motivating, creative and flexible working environment
Additional benefit package (health insurance, teambuildings, games, food treats, etc)
Salary range from 5000 Eur to 7000 Eur gross per month. Exact offer will be based on your knowledge and experience

Sounds interesting? Let’s talk! ;)

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Who We Are

Unify Square, Inc. is a Bellevue, WA USA-based rapidly growing hi-tech company with multiple subsidiaries in the European and Asia-Pacific regions. Unify Square’s software and services optimize and enhance the world’s largest collaboration and communication deployments, helping businesses manage and secure their meetings, chats, and calls. Founded by Microsoft product visionaries Unify Square has become a global elite partner for Microsoft Teams, Slack, Zoom, Skype for Business, Workplace by Facebook, and Office 365. Unify Square solutions have delivered value to more than 5 million collaboration seats, in over 300 enterprises across more than 50 countries, and in most major industry verticals.

Why Join Unify Square

Unify Square solutions are game-changers in the Collaboration and Communication world – that’s why we’re on a mission to hire those who share our passion. You will be interacting on a daily basis with your colleagues around the world who are some of the brightest people in the industry. Our Vilnius team is a friendly group of energetic men and women who enjoy each other’s company and often engage in group activities outside of work hours, be it a BBQ lunch in the inner yard of the office building, a company-sponsored half-marathon run, or a friendly game of foosball in the office lounge area. The office is located in the center of the Old Town with easy access to many lunch options. Snacks and beverages are also provided in the office.

Job Summary

Are you passionate about transforming the way in which people communicate and connect around the world? Are you motivated by the challenges of providing enterprises with global solutions that deliver on the promise of unified communications? Are you interested in working with a small, but vibrant team with subsidiaries located in every major continent?

The UnifySquare PowerSuite product team is looking for a strong Software Engineer to drive key solutions in our products enabled IT teams around the world. Under minimal supervision, and working collaboratively with other members of the Unify² Product Development team, you will help to shape our product offering for our customer base (large global enterprise customers). As a member of our product development team, you will drive cloud-based services focused on enterprise solutions, working in partnership with and contributing to departments such as sales, marketing, business development, or leading and growing teams.

As a Part Of Our Team You Will
Design, implement, and deploy high availability solutions in Azure using the latest technologies: .NET Core, C#, Docker, etc.
Participate in product design decisions and code reviews
Have customer focus and the ability to communicate directly with customers
Trace performance and infrastructure bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions
Build, maintain, and enhance our continuous integration and continuous deployment infrastructure.
Write unit and integration tests on a combined engineering team
Core Skills

Ideal candidates for the position will have:
Have the ability to quickly ramp-up on new technology and features
Expertise and passion working with enterprise customers and internal partners to understand their scenarios and business drivers
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Work effectively, independently, as well as part of a team.
Excellent technical and functional design skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (English is UnifySquare’s official language)
Demonstrated success in building strong relationships and delivering results in cross-group projects
Experience both in development and production support
Have strong troubleshooting skills
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s Degree from a 4-year college or university in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent work experience in the industry
2-3 years of relevant experience creating products for the global enterprise market
Proficiency in C# and .NET technologies
Knowledge of database and data storage technologies
Knowledge and experience building client/server, multi-tier architectures
Familiarity with design, development, and testing of enterprise applications and cloud services required
The breadth of experience across the entire product cycle preferred
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience working with Azure’s stack of technologies.
Experience in designing REST APIs
Knowledge of Microsoft Unified Communications solutions, such as Teams
Knowledge of OAUTH 2.0
Experience with full-stack development a plus
If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you. Please go to the Unify Square careers page at https://www.unifysquare.com/careers/#main and apply today!
Please note: this job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the general nature of work employees can expect within this role. It is not intended to be a comprehensive list of qualifications, skills, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with the position.
Powered by JazzHR

Title: Frontend Software Engineer (Payments Domain)
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

Our Payments domain is currently looking for a frontend engineer who would be working with internal tools for Fraud monitoring, visualisation, filtering and sorting of a large amount of data. You will be working within a cross-functional agile team consisting of backend engineers, quality assurance engineers, product manager, engineering manager and yourself.

Take a look at engineering.vinted.com to see what we’re up to.

In This Position, You’ll
Work as part of a team to shape features that are used by our internal teams
Apply Agile and Lean principles in your work
Collaborate with other developers through GitHub pull requests and code reviews
Write ES6+ TypeScript code with sprinkles of SCSS-style code and HTML5-conformant mark-up
Work with the latest versions of React, Redux, JSX, Jest/Enzyme, and other React ecosystem friendly libraries. To explore our tech stack further, head over here
About You
Have experience with React, TypeScript and Next.js
Willing to learn and master new technologies and concepts
Familiar with most and have deep knowledge in some of the following disciplines: Software Engineering, Functional Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Systems Programming, Systems Architecture, Computer Science
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 3400–4200 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need.

Title: React Developer with German - Pharma & Healthcare
Description:
About the job
Als Senior Frontend Developer weißt Du genau, wie man Web & Mobile Anwendungen und Systeme im Frontend programmiert . Deshalb liegt Dir das Programmieren hinsichtlich intelligenter Nutzerführung besonders am Herzen? Großartig, denn unsere vielseitigen Digital Commerce Projekte warten auf einen Entwickler , der nicht nur Designs umsetzt , sondern auch als interner Ideengeber unsere Kunden aufs nächste digitale Level hebt.

Ihre Aufgaben:
Umsetzung / Programmierung von Design Konzepten im Bereich Web/Mobile intern und für Kunden
Erweiterung von eigenentwickelten CRM und Redaktionssystemen
Konzeption und Umsetzung von usabilitiy freundlichen Kunden Websites und conversion optimierten Kampagnen
Landingpages und Newsletter
Entwicklung von Anwendungen mit Kompatibilität zum marktführenden Omni Channel Tool
Konzeption und Umsetzung von interaktiven Salesfoldern, e detailings und Schulungsunterlagen mittels moderner Web
Technologien
Neuentwicklung und Erweiterung unserer vielseitigen Kunden Lösungen aus der Pharmabranche (z.B. Apps, Websites)
Ihr Profil:
Einschlägige Berufserfahrung als Frontend Entwickler oder Web Developer
Abschluss in (Wirtschafts --)Informatik oder eine Ausbildung in Fachinformatik/Anwendungsentwicklung von Vorteil
Teamfähigkeit
Gute Fach und Programmierkenntnisse in der modernen Webentwicklung
Gute Kenntnisse in HTML / HTML5, CSS3 und JavaScript
React Entwickler
Geübter Umgang mit den Programmen der Adobe Creative Suite (vor allem Photoshop, XD); Kenntnisse in 3D Visualisierung und Animation von Vorteil
Erstellung von Backend Designs
Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständige Bewerbung mit Angabe des möglichen

Eintrittstermins und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung bitte vorzugsweise online.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
Zenitech is a dynamic, experienced, multinational team of technology and advisory professionals, a proud partner with today’s blue-chip brands and tomorrow’s leaders. Our goal is to help companies find the best and most efficient solutions, create new and develop existing products.

Our offices are in Vilnius and Kaunas, but we provide a flexible working environment.

Currently, we are on the lookout for Mid DevOps Engineer who will join one of our projects in the Sports & Gaming industry. The goal of this project is to automatise as many products as they have and present betting opportunities for this industry 24/7. Very wide range of products: dogs and horses racing, virtual racing, esports, lottery games. It allows to find different betting fields and try various and cool technologies around those projects.

Teams are working on creation of new products (competitive gaming, automation of manual work of operators), implementing live streaming platform, improving existing systems. Zenitech closely collaborates with the client and suggests architectural decisions - the client allows wide autonomy for ideas and new technologies in order to get more efficient solutions.

What you’ll do:
Using, writing and updating reusable IaC in Bicep (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/bicep/)
Administration and optimisation of Kubernetes clusters
Using, writing and updating the Azure DevOps pipelines (both build and release)
Monitoring of running environments in Azure and doing adjustments when needed
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from design through deployment, operation, and refinement
Be a key contributor in the DevOps Chapter, taking part in various initiatives, presenting your ideas and democratically voting on the implementation of new changes

Skills and qualities we appreciate:
Knowledge about Kubernetes
Working with Azure Cloud experience
1-3 years of work experience as a DevOps Engineer
Configuration Management Bicep
Bonus if you're familiar with Helm Charts and Terraform.

What you will find at Zenitech:
😎 Hybrid working model, flexible schedule and workspace.
🧘‍♂️ Private Health Insurance and Pension Plan.
💻 Technical equipment you can choose.
🌊 An opportunity to work abroad for up to 180 days.
🌼 A culture of continuous growth: training budget, People lead system, training days, Mentorship, ZeniGrow, various external courses.
🥤Stable working environment and a community-first mindset: health-related initiatives, community events, teambuilding budget.
🏅Agile mindset, flat organizational structure.
🧡 Work with talented people across technology products and consulting.
Monthly salary - €2,500 - €4,000

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Zenitech: 🎗
Zenitech is proud to have a widely diverse team. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves and each person is valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. The same goes for our recruitment. We want our team to reflect the world around us and that starts with you hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all of the boxes!

We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.If you have accessibility needs that you would like us to know about, please let us know and we’ll make sure to design an interview format that works for you.If you like the sound of all this we’d love to hear from you.

Get in touch to find out more about how you can become part of the Zenitech community and growth journey and supercharge your career with us!

Title: Senior Back-End Engineer - Marketing Technology
Description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

Growth Engineering is a rapidly growing team within Proton that's responsible for our web storefronts, marketing automation, and affiliate tools. Your engineering excellence will help drive the acquisition, onboarding, and activation of the Proton community and spur engagement. The Marketing Technology team within Growth Engineering builds and maintains an architecture based on Kafka and API connections for external providers, which we use to track revenue attribution, reporting, and statistics for our advertising, affiliates, and partners.

What You Will Do

Be part of the new Marketing Technology team within Growth Engineering.
Work closely with teammates to design, build, test, and operate Proton tooling for advertising, affiliates, and partner marketing.
Develop tools for marketing automation.
Integrate third-party APIs and tools.
Write readable, maintainable, tested, and well-documented code.
Ensure that acceptance criteria and all parts of the technical design are correctly incorporated.
Follow and promote engineering best practices.
Take part in team activities such as sprint ceremonies, code reviews, and pair programming.
Mentor new joiners and less experienced team members while sharing your knowledge and skills with the wider team.
4+ years of experience in a back-end or full-stack software engineering role (e.g., building scalable APIs and back-end systems or web development).
Strong proficiency in Python 3.
You are used to testing your own code using unit tests and integration tests at a minimum.
Experience using and implementing DevOps principles and practices (including CI/CD).
Proficiency with SQL.
Experience working on Digital Marketing projects.

Bonus points for:

Proficiency in PHP 7+.
Experience with Google and Bing Ads APIs.
Experience with or knowledge of affiliate marketing platforms such as Tune, Awin, or similar.
Experience with Kafka.
Experience with Kubernetes.
Experience implementing marketing analytics tools and frameworks.
Experience with mobile measurement tools and mobile measurement partners (MMPs).

Why you should join Proton

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us.

Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.

Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - ProtonMail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. Keep in mind that you will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Title: AWS Cloud Engineer
Software Engineer (.NET)
Description:
About the job
About The Role And Team

We are looking for a Regular or talented Junior Software Engineer in IAM BE team, which is responsible for building the back end layer of new Identity and Access Management (aka IAM) system, as well as owning Authorization scope and API gateway in Adform.

Our team owns critical part of Adform Flow – user and permissions management, data access, integration with crucial Adform’s services, and data migration. You, as a Software Engineer will be able to work on building this new system, develop the scaling solution, new features, as well as maintaining and monitoring existing ones that are under the team's ownership. You will be able to learn interesting technologies (like graph databases), have the opportunity to use best tech stack and contribute to one of the most important objectives of the year.

Your future colleagues are real security geeks – always looking for that extra layer of security over identity management. Team is located in 3 different locations – developers in Kaunas, Vilnius and Warsaw – so be ready to smile for the camera.

Your Responsibilities

Design, build, test, deploy, monitor, and maintain products and services
Focus on top-notch value delivery for customer
Collaborate with team and have an ownership attitude
Work closely with other teams to determine interdependencies
Work closely with and incorporating feedback from product management, IT Engineers, enterprise architects, and security analysts
Apply best practice defined by different functional areas (Architecture, Quality, Security, Product Management, Project Management)

We expect you

Have at least 2 years professional experience in .NET
Have experience in the development and maintenance of RESTful API, building applications and Back-End services using C#
Have experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases
Have experience with Continuous Integration, GIT, Unit testing, integration testing, monitoring and logging
Have experience in building solutions according to microservices architecture principles
Have experience with any messaging infrastructure (RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.)
Have knowledge of software design patterns
Have knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, other)
Have an agile & ownership mindset, easily adapt to changes
Be good at written and verbal English (upper-intermediate level)

It would be an advantage if you

Have experience working with GraphQL
Have knowledge of OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect (OIDC), Identity Access Management domain
Have knowledge of VM provisioning (Puppet, Terraform, Ansible, other)
Understand concepts of high availability, high performance, and high security
Have knowledge of Agile software development

Our promise

Experienced and professional team
Challenging and exciting work environment with collaborative team mates sharing local and global objectives
Dynamic, inspiring and international team-oriented „learning “environment
Informal style of leadership and communication – but with the highest expectations of performance and professionalism
Possibilities to learn and work with experts from different countries (offices around the world)
Monthly salary starting from 2800 EUR gross. The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies

If you wonder about these things – we have something to offer you

Worry about health and accident insurance? Chill – we got this!
Eager to enjoy your vacay a bit longer? We offer additional vacation days!
Enjoy having work-fun balance? Good news! Fun office activities, team buildings and a friendly team will cheer you up! Explore our offices by going on a virtual tour!
Enjoy having lunch out? Grab your colleagues and enjoy delicious lunch at a friendly price in our canteen or outside on Adform terrace!
Wanna stay in shape? Join Adform sports team and exercise together!
Worry about your lonely left-at-home pet? Bring it to the office! We are very pet-friendly and happy to get to know your companion!
Having a headache or a sneezing morning? Adform offers 2 trust days for you to get better by staying at home! Use them and get back to work when feeling fresh again!
Not enough? Join us and find out more!

About us Adform is the only global, independent and fully integrated advertising platform built for modern marketing. Its unique enterprise technology – Adform FLOW – harnesses superior user experience and a scalable, modular and open architecture, to enable seamless management of the whole campaign lifecycle. It provides clients with enhanced control and transparency across their advertising operations, including ownership of all data from their campaigns. Since 2002, Adform has developed technology to enhance human/machine collaboration and deliver augmented intelligence, thereby amplifying business results for its clients around the world.

Title: Kernel Resilience Engineer - Canonical Ubuntu
Description:
About the job
Canonical is building a Kernel Resilience team to harden the Ubuntu kernel. This team will drive proactive efforts to exercise and stretch the stability, reliability, and security of the kernel. Kernel Resilience takes responsibility for the overall quality of the Linux kernel, through aggressive test frameworks and regimens, hardening the kernel against exploits and vulnerabilities, as well as building and maintaining a highly automated kernel build and test infrastructure. We have access to a very large array of hardware, and we would like to keep it busy!

This is not a role for button pushers to monitor results! We will select candidates who make it their mission to crash or penetrate the kernel, and then drive the eventual resolution of discovered issues. You will be expected to raise the bar on industry best practices, to push the limits of possibility on proactive, gloves-off stress testing.

The successful candidate will have experience covering some combination of Linux kernel development, quality assurance, security exploits, and back-end development. You may be a seasoned kernel developer looking for a new challenge in back-end automation. You may always have wanted to 'go deeper' into the kernel? Curiosity and a desire to 'poke it and see what happens' will be essential for this role.

What you'll do
Work with bleeding edge and early access systems and hardware
Ensure an ongoing commitment to industry-leading quality, reliability and security standards
Proactively identify security and stability issues by devising ingenious new ways to break the Linux kernel
Contribute to the development of an advanced Linux kernel build service
Engage with other teams at Canonical, the open source community and commercial partners
Work from home with global travel up to 20% for internal and external events

Who you are
Innovative out-of-the-box style thinker not afraid to break things
Significant programming experience in Python, with strong C skills highly regarded
Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral
Someone with high standards for overall quality, and not afraid to ensure they are met
At ease working in several different technical domains concurrently
Substantial experience in Linux system configuration, customization, and deployment
Solid understanding Linux kernel internals and development principles
Deep knowledge of security as it relates to the Linux kernel
Productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation, delivering on time
Contributed to an open source project in the past
Understanding of agile software development methodologies
Earned a bachelor's (or equivalent university level) degree, preferably in a technology field

What Canonical Offers:
Learning and development
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority Pass for travel

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Data Informatics Analyst
Description:
About the job
About Dexcom

Dexcom empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology.

We invite you to become a part of a fast growing, purpose driven team in our newly established business centre in Vilnius!

Summary

Our department is looking for a Data Informatics Analyst II who can work alongside a team to query and compile post-market product information to support ad-hoc data requests and periodically generate custom-formatted metrics to support business needs. The ideal candidate for this position is also able to present this data professionally and effectively to various departments within the organization.

About The Role
Work in various databases and with Business Intelligence to pull information from verified and validated sources to track and trend post-market product complaint data.
Create charts, graphs, and other visualizations for inter-departmental communication of Post-Market Product Surveillance data.
Must be able to present information in a way that is understandable for those not familiar with the data.
Work with various departments to provide data relevant to their business processes and data needs.
Assists in monitoring post-market product complaint data to identify potential product performance issues for elevation.
Supports the execution of daily/weekly/monthly metrics to Management team to monitor department performance.
In all actions, demonstrates a primary commitment to patient safety and product quality by maintaining compliance to the Quality Policy and all other documented quality processes and procedures.
Ability to work in an environment with multiple short-term deadlines, frequent interruptions and changing priorities.
Perform due diligence information gathering.
Assist in Identifying product issues and escalate them as appropriate.
Support the data team to ensure that communicated goals and objectives are achieved or exceeded.
Assist in executing projects that further the improvement and efficiency of the department.
Required Qualifications
Strong SQL programming skills.
Experience working with relational databases and/or distributed computing platforms, and their query interfaces, such as SQL, Snowflake, and GCP BigQuery
Data mining experience with Python, pandas, or SQL databases.
Data visualization experience with Python visualization libraries, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Experience with GitHub or similar version control software.
Excellent troubleshooting abilities and skills to analyze data problems and propose solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with a proven ability to translate complex methodologies and analytical results to business insights.
Experience in requirements gathering, writing functional specifications, process and use case modeling, and data mapping.
Ability to interface well with cross-functional teammates.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred degrees: CIS, MIS, IT or other technical related major.
2+ years of experience with Tableau.
Experience working with GCP BigQuery
Experience in the field of diabetes.
Experience with system integrations.
We Offer
Opportunity to work in global, innovative, fast-growing company with 7,000+ awesome colleagues.
Flexible work.
5 additional vacation days.
Health, Life and Accident insurance.
Health and Wellness programs.
Private Pension plan.
Access to the best-in-class training and development programmes.
Team buildings and events.
Competitive salary and additional bonuses.
Monthly base salary for this position is from 2,570 EUR gross.
The final offer will depend on your qualifications, competencies, and professional experience.
Sound like you? Apply!

Title: EIS is looking for Software Testing Engineers
Description:
About the job
We are an insurance software company that enables leading insurers to innovate and operate like a tech company: fast, simple, agile.

Founded in 2008, EIS provides an open, flexible platform of core systems and digital solutions allowing insurers to accelerate and scale innovation, launch products faster, deliver new revenue channels and create experiences the world will love. With thousands of APIs, the platform gives insurers the freedom to connect to a vast ecosystem of insurtech and emerging technologies. EIS powers premium growth for insurers in all lines of business worldwide. For more information visit EISGroup.com

If you want to work on complex projects with a world-class team and make an immediate impact, please apply today to speak with a member of our Talent Acquisition team.

We are growing our Test Automation and Manual Testing teams for our Services and Product and Technology Teams.
Product & Technology is responsible for building our suite of platforms and products.
Services is the client facing team that takes what Product & Technology built and customize to the individual client's needs and wants. As a member of Services you will be deeply involved in complex, enterprise software implementations. If you like problem solving, working with customers to create an optimized solution, the Services team is for you.

Our Test Automation team work with:
Java 1.8 Software Development
Selenium WebDriver and test automation frameworks domains like TestNG
Continuous Integration
REST/SOAP services, XML, JSON
SQL, Maven, Jenkins
Establishing automation process on the project according to common company test automation strategy and guidelines

Our Manual Testing Specialists work with:
Manual functional testing of Insurance Platform (including new features testing and regression testing)
Requirements analysis
Test cases creation based on requirements
Test cases execution
Bug reports creation (JIRA)
Communication with developers, QAs, automation testers, business analysts, and product owners
Working with REST services, XML, and JSON syntax
Databases : MSSQL/Oracle

Why people choose to work for EIS:
We are a global and modern IT product company and are working on the world level Enterprise InsurTech Product powered by leading edge technologies (microservices, reactive, cloud, continuous delivery)
We can offer ownership to our employees- from being able to make decisions and impact the growth of the company, to giving stock options
Opportunity to work with top talent - have great colleagues which are industry and technology experts, work in a Scaled Agile environment with a low level of bureaucracy, diverse, multi-cultural and cross-functional teams
We offer freedom - from building your career to organising your work from any place in the world
We offer good compensation based on the regular performance review
We offer flexible working hours, remote or hybrid work options
Variety of new knowledge sharing and training opportunities - EIS University, external training, conferences, and certification programs
Opportunity to participate in employee referral program
Possibility to work abroad for 3 months each year
Pool table, tennis table, PS4, Ice creams, and more in the office
Health insurance and gym cover as well as personal gifts on different occasions, team buildings
We work with the newest Apple Macbooks
EIS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE), M/F/Disability/Veterans, and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

*Please note that we will be proceeding only with those applications that have valid working permits in the location stated in the vacancy description.
By applying for this job vacancy, the candidate affirms the processing of his/her personal data according to the Personal Data Protection Law and their storage in the HR unit of EIS Lithuania. Without the candidate's consent his/her personal data will not be disclosed to the third parties.

Title: Engineering Manager, Developer Experience
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

As Engineering Manager, you’ll become a part of the Infrastructure domain, Developer Experience Engineering team in Vilnius. The Developer Experience team works to continuously improve the backend development experience and provide tools for building, maintaining, monitoring, and improving the application ecosystem for our backend developers.

In This Role You Will
Build and maintain a team that trusts each other, are not afraid of conflict, commits to decisions, is accountable, and cares about results
Focus on the professional and personal growth of your team, conduct 1-1 meetings, performance and compensation reviews
Represent the team and its function inside and outside the company
Collaborate closely with other Engineering leads to bring continuous improvements and take our Engineering organization to a new level
Empower backend developers to innovate and ship code without fear
About You
Proven experience leading a software engineering team and delivering the outcomes
Know how to make teams effective, manage scopes and deliverables
You possess strong people management skills - have experience ensuring the development of team members
Solid proficiency in communicating on both technical and management levels
Able to adapt to changing priorities and requirements
Excellent at communicating in spoken and written English
You care about improving developer experience and productivity
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 4917 - 6883 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Software Engineer (GO/.NET) in Buying and Owning Real Estate DK Tribe
Description:
About the job
Job Description

Buying and Owning Real Estate Denmark (BOREDK) Tribe aims to build solutions which make mortgage processes understandable and enjoyable for all homeowners in Denmark as well as bank employees supporting them.

We’re looking for new members to join our squad who are trusted with a full-on responsibility for motivating our solutions forward.

We stick to the “you build it, you own it” attitude here and believe in you being the best person to decide how things should be done.
Depending on your experience you could be offered a different role
You will:

You would be joining a cross-functional team which is responsible for building the bank employee-facing part of the solution for automated real estate buying and remortgage processes – you would be the one making everyday life easier for hundreds of Danske Bank employees.

Your casual day at work :
Building GO, JAVA, and .NET Core based layer for efficient integration with Core APIs
Pushing your code through the door (we’re talking GitHub, Docker, Jenkins, Drone, Openshift, and Azure DevOps here)
Thinking of cool ways to improve your product, or automating boring tasks
About you:
Be enthusiastic about all activities of software development and delivery – you will be involved in pretty much all of them
Be enthusiastic about quality code, with a healthy sprinkle of pragmatism
Have a high level of personal responsibility and commitment to the team goals
Be excited to share things you learn every day
Be open-minded when it comes to discussing solutions
We would very happy to see you have skills in any of these languages:
C# with .NET Core
GO
Java
An advantage is being experienced working with:
Git
Docker & Openshift
Azure DevOps
Knowledge of RESTful API design principles
MS SQL Server
We offer:

Monthly salary range from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities;
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; health insurance from the first day of employment; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms;
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience;
Additional paid days off: 2 to recharge, 2 sick days, 1 for volunteering, for round birthdays, for seniority in Danske Bank;
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution after 1 year of working;
Your title in job contract will be IT Software Engineer (Cloud Specialist).

See all the benefits HERE

Please contact if you have any questions.

Ramunas Zigmantas

+370601 89742

Title: Java Developer
Description:
About the job
595773BR

Introduction

As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM CIC Baltic Custom Development department is looking for a Full Stack developer. In this role, you will use the latest tools and technologies available to deliver state-of-the-art software. You'll be responsible for ensuring that software components are expertly designed, tested, debugged, verified, and ready for integration into IBM's best-of-breed solutions that help our clients improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace

Responsibilities

Work in an agile, project-centric, team-focused environment
Travel to clients outside the country to gather and define requirements
Develop high-quality, scalable, and maintainable solutions
Perform unit and integration testing
Continuously learn new methodologies and technologies
Share your knowledge within the organization

Benefits

Personalized professional growth, mentoring, training, and clear career progression
Flexible work & life balance
Remote work opportunities
Compensation according to the market top rates
Private health insurance, life insurance, critical illness insurance
Salary range: 4000-5500 EUR gross (dependent on experience and knowledge).

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Solid work experience with Java 8 or higher
Hands-on experience with SQL
Hands-on experience with GitHub
Feeling comfortable in Agile / DevOps environment

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Hands-on experience with Derby database

About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Java Software Engineer @ Hotels team
Description:
About the job
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other’s strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.

We are looking for Java backend developers to help improve and maintain KAYAK’s world leading search and booking technology! We integrate with over 200 travel partners and link to over 500,000 hotels, 550 airlines and 1000 rental cars companies. You will be an essential part of a high powered team that keeps all of this running efficiently – helping millions of people find the best hotels and rental cars and the best ways to fly from A to B every day!

In this role, you will:

Implement new backend search and booking features for hotels
Improve existing features with an eye towards speed and user experience
Build and maintain existing integrations with third-party APIs

Please apply if you are/have:

A proven software engineer with backend experience
Comfortable in a fast paced startup environment
Hands on and self-motivated
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
3+ years experience or equivalent in projects
Experience with Java (multi-threaded experience)
Comfortable with SQL, HTTP, XML, JSON
Working knowledge on APIs
Bonus Points - Spring, MySQL, Git, Tomcat, Apache

Benefits And Perks

Flexible working hours;
Remote work option;
Opportunities to work in any KAYAK office around the globe;
Budget for development of skills;
Day off on your birthday;
Additionally paid paternity/maternity leave;
Generous healthcare insurance;
Free lunch twice a week;
Free Yoga classes twice a week;
Headspace subscription - to relax after work;
No stupid meetings;
The greatest team events and excursions;
Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc.

Compensation

Engineer’s salary consists of three parts:

Base part: when joining us early in your career your salary may start from 1679 EUR Gross. Being more experienced, your base salary may be up to 3992 EUR Gross for this position.

In addition:

significant yearly bonuses approx 10 percent annual salary;
Booking Holdings RSU (Restricted Stock Units) package, worth 20.000 USD (before taxes) with possibility to get it every year.

Salary range provided is not final and will be discussed during the process based on your skills and experience.

About KAYAK

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.

Diversity and Inclusion at OpenTable/ KAYAK

We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more innovative ideas, products, services, and better business outcomes for our stakeholders. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Frontend Software Engineer in Channels – Individual Customers, Meeting Journey Experience
Description:
About the job
Job Description

Are you willing to work in one most important Danske Bank focus areas which concentrate on business-facing solutions? Work in a squad with end-to-end business responsibility? Then join Meeting Squad! Each day our advisers and customers are booking and conduct online meetings to provide the best financial services advice. An excellent user journey, high quality, and high availability are of the essence.

Join our squad that owns meeting booking solutions on the web and mobile. As an experienced software engineer, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing the solution’s future front-end architecture and ensuring a great developer experience and best-in-class engineering practices. Nevertheless, you will have Extensive learning opportunities to ensure that your skills are maintained and updated on an ongoing basis.

You will:
Be at the forefront of technological development to ensure the highest possible efficiency and software quality
Write high-quality frontend code for both web and mobile
Collaborate closely with architects, software engineers, UX/Design and business analysts
Work closely and support Customer Journey squads with an agile mindset
Try out new technologies, and raise the bar for technical excellence
Work in a self-organizing squad and have an agile mind-set
About you:
Experience with JavaScript (ECMA 6), HTML5, CSS, React JS, React-Native and Redux
Strong focus on code quality
Ability to suggest technical solutions and openly share them with a team
Knowledge of best practices and their application
Team player with an agile mind-set
Strong sense of ownership and responsibility
Intermediate English skills
Have at least 2 years of experience with Front-end technologies
Nice to have:
Experience with unit tests
Preferably you hold a BSc in Computer Science or similar
We offer:

Monthly salary range from 2880 EUR to 4320 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities;
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; health insurance from the first day of employment; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms;
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience;
Additional paid days off: 2 to recharge, 2 sick days, 1 for volunteering, for round birthdays, for seniority in Danske Bank, up to 5 days to prepare and hold exams in higher education institutions;
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution after 3 months of working
See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Software Engineer (Front-end Specialist).

If you have any questions, find me @Linkedin: Saulius Kisunas .

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Software Engineer, Application UX
Description:
About the job
Postman is the world’s leading collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API and streamline collaboration to help create better APIs—faster. More than 15 million developers and 500,000 organizations worldwide use Postman today.
Our customers are doing more and more astounding things with the Postman product every day, and as a result, we are growing rapidly.
About The Team
The Application UX team’s mission is to deliver a seamless user experience for all universal functionality within the Postman application; think e.g. application shell and navigation. We build & maintain functionality and establish & advocate best practices in term of UX and frontend development.
Our team is part of the larger UX Foundation organisation which aims to help feature teams across Postman to execute on their roadmap and build great user experiences & interfaces quickly & reliably for our users through tooling, support, feedback and education. We are open to hiring in India and Europe for this role.

What You'll Be Doing
Work with your team to improve the end user experience of the universal functionality within the Postman platform.
Help your team provide a framework and guardrails to product teams so that they can independently add features.
Work with a hybrid team of engineers and designers spread across remote locations.
Collaborate and brainstorm with developers and designers to improve the UX patterns of Postman application.
About You
2+ years of experience building web frontend architecture with a modern tech stack.
Great understanding of fundamentals in Javascript (React), HTML, and modern CSS.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills for problems discovery.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You’re an experienced front-end technologist.
You have an innate curiosity about how things work.
You have great empathy for our end users.
Nice To Have
Experience in remote-first environments and global teams.
Experience in UX design workflows and tools such as Figma etc.
Experience in building for multiple platforms - such as web, desktop, mobile.
What Else? (Remote Benefits)
We offer competitive salary and benefits, and a flexible schedule working with a fun, collaborative team. Enjoy full medical coverage, unlimited PTO, and a monthly lunch stipend. (Yes, seriously. We want you to eat well wherever you’re at.) Plus, our wellness program will help you stay healthy from your location with fitness-related reimbursements. Our frequent and fascinating virtual team-building events will keep you connected, while our donation-matching program can support the causes you care about. We’re building a long-term company with an inclusive culture where everyone can be the best version of themselves, and we want you to be part of it. Join us, why dontcha?

Title: Software Engineer - Game Tools
Description:
About the job
Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Traffic Cop 3D and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope and Die by the Blade.

With a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, we have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee games have been downloaded in every country on earth! If you think you’re a good fit for one of our remote vacancies, we want to hear from you wherever you are based.

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit?

What’s the job?
As a Software Engineer - Game Tools within the Tools and Tech Department, you will be writing Core code which is the foundation to all our games plus writing tools and software to optimise and automate our processes.

What you tell your friends you do
“I create tools and infrastructure for our games and software projects”

What you will really be doing
Using C# and Unity as the main technologies in your day to day work.
Designing and writing high quality and reliable code
Writing Core Systems used by all games
Working with scripting languages
Working closely with third party SDKs
Solving any challenges that might appear on the way.
Contributing towards ideas for tools and helping to grow the department.

How you will be doing this
You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results.
You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best.
You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot!

Team
Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games.

Skills and Requirements
At least 1 years of experience in development with C# or C++.
Experience with Unity.
Unity Editor Tools experience would be a plus.
Experience with scripting languages
Android / iOS experience would be a plus.
Excellent communication skills.
An avid interest in either console or mobile games, preferably both.

We offer
We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday)
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Monthly employee awards

Our philosophy
We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible.

Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference.

Title: Pega Developer
Description:
About the job
Are you passionate about Pega technology and IT development?

With Us You Have The Opportunity To
Develop high quality business processes using Pega Platform development tools and studios
Gain good business knowledge in Lending area
Find and implement solutions for incidents and problems
Contribute in all areas: analyzing, designing, developing, testing and maintaining of services delivered by the team
Act and contribute as a team player in a cross functional Agile team
What Is Needed In This Role
