Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Write TDD and clean code.
Contribute to the engineering culture and methodologies of Wix.

We Offer
Competitive compensation packages
Equity (RSUs) and discount stock purchasing plans (ESPP)
Health and personal accident insurance
Daily breakfast and snacks
Lunch at the office twice per week
Commuting allowance
Free phone operator services and compensation for a new phone
Free exercise classes and wellness activities
Online courses and professional development
Fun activities and team events

Salary range is 3500 - 8000 Eur GROSS / month (Total package, including Equity)

Title: Front-end Developer in Screening and Monitoring Tribe
Description:
About the job
Job Description

We are looking for a Frontend developer with a innovative agile mind-set interested in developing financial crime prevention systems in one of Denmark’s largest companies.

In Monitoring & Screening Tribe, we are accountable for enabling real-time screening and retrospective monitoring of transactions and trade flows. We support the entire Group and play a central role in Danske Banks’ financial crime prevention within Anti Money Laundering, Counterterrorist financing, Sanctions risk mitigation, and Fraud prevention.

Transaction screening is a focus area for Danske Bank and the squad focuses on implementing big strategic solutions for our operation officers with significant end-to-end experiences.

We are an agile team of highly skilled IT professionals working closely together in an informal atmosphere across Lithuania, Denmark, and India. We are currently scaling our team to support our API journey and looking for a skilled software engineer to join our Vilnius team.

You will:
Take responsibility for solutions (from design to deployment)
Ensuring that architectural choices are based on best practice and lives up to the agility required to continue being best in class
Inspire colleagues by setting an example of professionalism and proper work ethics
Representing the project/area in internal forums
Contribute to evolution of technology and software development practice stack
Test our thinking based on your experience with new technologies
About you:
2+ years’ experience in developing Web applications using Modern Web technologies
Proficiency with JavaScript language and understanding of its libraries (jQuery)
Experience with Vue.js framework, its core principles and ecosystem
Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
Enthusiasm about delivering well-designed, optimized, and scalable solutions as well as ability to write efficient, secure, well-documented, and clean code
Knowledge of automated JavaScript testing
Experience with both consuming and designing RESTful APIs
Solid communication and interpersonal skills and upper-intermediate level of English
We offer:

Monthly salary range from 2880 EUR to 4320 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; health insurance from the first day of employment; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.
See All The Benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Software Engineer (Front-end Specialist).

Please contact if you have any questions.

Tomas Januskaitis

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: .NET Engineer
Description:
About the job
About Railsr

Railsr is the world’s leading global embedded finance experience platform that gives customers the ability to prototype, build and scale financial products. Railsr is in growth mode with hundreds of clients globally, end-users in the multi millions, Venture Capital funding from top firms like Clocktower Ventures and Visa and the most globally-enabled, digitally-native product in the FinTech platform space.

Railsr is continuing to grow its product capabilities and international expansion. It’s an extremely exciting time and the potential for companies to use Railsr to power and deliver their customer’s financial experiences is enormous.



The Opportunity

Do you have a passion for building the next wave of embedded finance products? Would you be up for a challenge to build on a modern .NET tech stack on a greenfield project to implement new KYC services? Railsr - a category leader in embedded finance is looking for .NET developers to join our team. As a successful candidate you will take on a .NET developer role and help us build the entire KYC platform.

Railsr is growing very rapidly, but remains a small company in which staff are required to contribute to many aspects of their departments’ roles in the wider business. The rate of change is very fast, and the role may also require project work being undertaken, sometimes at short notice.


Responsibilities:
Engineering awesome, well-designed, testable and efficient code.
Ensuring functionality have sufficient automated test coverage.
You build it, you run it model which means work in a cross-functional team with responsibility to design, create infrastructure, implement, deploy, maintain and monitor applications.
Take ownership and driving some of the squad deliverables.



Your Profile

Attitude & Behaviours

Agile Mindset: delivering value in small increments.
Team player: helping others is your key skill.
Getting things done: you take responsibility and accountability to get results delivered.
Proven ability to adapt and learn new tech quickly.
Communication: you know how to translate complex technical situations into understandable language.

Skills & Experience

2+ years of commercial back-end coding / software development experience .
Strong back-end application development experience - ideally C#, and the desire to learn new skills. Proven record of excellent delivery.
Experience with Cloud Technologies - AWS.
Experience with Infrastructure As Code tools- Terraform .
Familiarity with microservice architecture



What we can offer you:

Purpose, Vision & Journey
At Railsr, our vision is to make finance an amazing experience everywhere and accessible to everyone in the world.
We are truly customer obsessed and adventurous in designing the world’s best embedded finance experience platform to power our customers creating magic finance moments for their consumers.
Join us and be a part of a team who are challenging and changing the global financial services industry.
Career
We’re a lean, fast-growing, ambitious and agile global FinTech company. It's the perfect environment for you, if you enjoy a challenge, variety, thrive in ambiguity and most importantly, want to deliver real impact.
We’re committed to innovation and development and this starts with our people. You are empowered to drive your own professional development and grow your skills.

Reward
Beyond a competitive remuneration package, every Railsbank employee gets equity. You will be part of an inclusive ownership model which offers accountability and significant reward potential.
We look after your well-being with locally competitive benefits which can include enhanced parental leave, private medical, pension and more.

People
Our teams work from different places to create amazing embedded finance solutions for our customers. We embrace flexible and hybrid working, but always putting our teams and customers needs first. This is part of our high-trust and mutual respect approach; with the expectation that we treat people as individuals and with respect.
You will join and work with an international team with incredible passion and expertise in the FinTech industry.



Our Values

Being an integral part of the Railsr team and sharing our values is important to us. The environment at Railsr is fast-paced, exciting, and dynamic. It suits people who love to collaborate and support one-another. We are all driven by the same values and are looking to welcome new people to the team who share these values.
Our values are: ambition for our company, colleagues and ourselves and the freedom and expectation to own it, trust which we give freely and expect in return, treating each other as adults, curiosity with our minds open to fresh thinking in the constant pursuit of improvement and customer obsession ensuring that everything we do is with the customer in mind, we succeed when they succeed.
If you are eager to join a thriving, fast-paced, high growth company and contribute to shaping its future, this is the role for you to make a difference.


Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

Our global team is amazing – they bring great ideas, drive new plans and help make Railsr a fantastic place to work. In the last year, we’ve doubled in size, with over 500 colleagues spread over 10 countries and 39 languages spoken. As we grow, we’re committed to making diversity, equity, and inclusion part of everything we do. Ensuring that we are recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of colleagues who are representative of our customers and communities is critical. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and actively encourage all applications, particularly those from under-represented groups. Thank you for joining us on this journey.

Please let us know if there is any support we can provide to ensure Railsr’s recruitment process is fully accessible to you. You can contact us on jobs@railsr.com to discuss specific requirements.

Title: Software Engineer (Backend)
Description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 20+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎

We’re looking for Backend Engineers that want to change the world. If you like to work at a steady pace with no surprises, keep scrolling. If you want your work to change the global financial landscape, you might be just who we’re looking for. We have a minimalist approach to using external frameworks, with emphasis on maintainability and fast turnaround with TDD, DDD and Continuous Integration & Delivery. Sound like your speed? Let’s chat 👇

Our technology stack:
Java 11
GCP
Kubernetes
Docker
PostgreSQL
Redis
Spock
SparkJava
JOOQ and TDD approach

What You’ll Be Doing
Building mobile APIs
Developing micro services to evolve our architecture
Perfecting a number of systems that our business depend on, like risk management, fraud detection, payment processing for example
Focusing mostly on greenfield development and improvement of existing systems

What You'll Need
Fluency with Java
3+ years of experience in back-end development
At least a bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Maths/Physics/similar
Quick learner attitude with an ambitious and results driven personality
Ability to work well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Fluent English

Nice to have
Experience with Kotlin and Scala
Experience within Finance
Experience within a start-up or scale-up
Experience within a product focussed environment

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
About the job
Based in Vilnius, as part of the Data Engineering and Development team you will maintain and create scalable software solutions with responsibilities for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.

Key Responsibilities
Ensure Product value to the business with the design and build of Repeatable products with Product usage at the heart of the solution, which is:
Documented
Performant
Tested via automated means
Has user manuals produced
Respects software release cycle management
Secure (OWASP 10)
Uses best software development practices (12FA)
Ensure Client satisfaction with creation of user-first solutions
Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
Use a range of different technologies and languages (such as Python, Java, NodeJS, ReactJS, AngularJS, JavaScript, HTML and similar) to develop server side, web and mobile applications:
Design client-side and server-side architecture
Participate in the design and creation of scalable software
Write clean, functional code on the front- and back-end
Identify and fix bugs or other coding issues
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
Write effective APIs
Troubleshoot and upgrade software
Mobile-first approach
Create security and data protection settings
Work with data scientists and analysts to improve software
Participating in the team activities, like:
Code reviews
Incident resolution

Skills and Experience:
Strong organisation skills; with the ability to split assigned tasks into smaller work packages and deliverables
2+ years of work experience using Python
3+ years of work experience using Linux systems and their administration
2+ years of work experience using various databases (PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Etc)
Ability to maintain high attention to detail
Ability to estimate and deliver on-time
Higher education degree
Personal Attributes:
communication skills, with the confidence to challenge decisions when appropriate
Team player – working closely with colleagues to deliver for clients and to develop yourself and those around you
Self-starter, who is not afraid to ask questions to learn and get results
Have the ability to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment
Open minded – does not afraid to go through code reviews and code roasting sessions
Competent – simple reasoning for the given problem is not an option, desires to know more details
Culture & Values:
In line with BA Values

Title: Middle / Senior Solidity (Blockchain) Engineer
Description:
About the job

Description

At EPAM, we are thrilled to bring Web 3.0 from hype to real-world implementation. Our Blockchain competence with over 300+ engineers working on next-gen solutions for crypto-startups and enterprises who dared to accelerate the world’s transition to a new, secure and transparent form of digital reality.

You’ll join a global, diverse team of experts working with promising and emerging start-ups. As a Smart Contract Engineer in Solidity, you will design, create, test, and deploy rich variety and complexity smart contracts on Ethereum (including mainnet) and other EVM compatible networks.

Develop your skills within our 1300+ members Blockchain Professionals community or create your own initiative – and we’ll provide you with all the possibilities for skyrocketing your career.

What You’ll Do

Design and implement smart contracts, APIs and integrations based on predefined business specifications
Create technical specifications and in-code documentation
Deploy smart contracts on public/private testnet and mainnet
Work closely with infrastructure and security teams on best deployment architecture
Maintain high code quality and ensure security standards

What You Have

3+ years of experience in software development
1+ years background in Solidity
Deep understanding of the Ethereum Virtual Machine
Deployed smart contracts on mainnet that are currently in public use
Experience with smart contract developer tooling and libraries, such as: Hardhat, Brownie, Truffle, OpenZeppelin, Dappsys, Tenderly
Knowledge of typical smart contract vulnerabilities and attack vectors, gas optimizations, contract upgrade patterns, multi-sig setup

Nice to have

Assembly, React & Typescript web frameworks experience
Semantic Web Stack knowledge
Practical experience of working with Zero Security Layer
Working with Smart Contract security audits
Deep understanding of NFT related protocols (ERC-721, ERC1155)
Experience with deploying Solidity contracts onto L2 networks, like Polygon
Knowledge of security testing tools, such as Slither, Echidna and Mythril

We offer

Competitive salary plus annual bonuses for showing outstanding results
Flexible working schedule and opportunity to work remotely from any place in Lithuania
Community of 58,800+ industry’s top professionals united for exchanging knowledge with experts from anywhere in the world
Outstanding career development opportunities with a transparent career path and a roadmap to accelerate your journey
Travel and relocation opportunities within our offices in 40+ countries and relocation support for you and your family
Wide range of professional training, workshops, and mentoring programs plus unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning
Corporate health insurance and the possibility of buying private health insurance for the family at a corporate price
3 additional vacation days as a benefit from the company and 4 trust days a year (sick leave without a medical certificate)
Learning resources and financial support for completing certification programs

Title: Full-Stack Engineer (Analytics Apps Team)
Description:
About the job
Join the Analytics Apps team at Revel! We help Revel customers make data driven decisions. We are an autonomous team not only building high quality products but doing so while investing in ourselves, our processes and tooling. As a full-stack engineer you will have direct influence on how we go about fulfilling this mission.

As a full-stack engineer, you will

Design and write clean, high performance and high-quality code
Be a technical and organizational expert to peers as well as management
Participate in the design and implementation of solutions within your team
Develop and implement new tools for yourself, the team and your department.
Demonstrate knowledge of code refactoring practices and improve code quality proactively
Mentor teammates

We expect that you

Have 1-4 years of experience crafting solutions in professional environments
Have built enterprise grade apps using modern frontend Javascript frameworks
Have data visualization experience
Have PWA or hybrid app experience
Have experience building cloud infrastructure (we use AWS)
Are fluent in English as we have colleagues from around the world

Our project

As a full-stack engineer you will have worked with a variety of technologies. We don’t expect you to know our entire stack. Of course, the greater the overlap the better :)

We are currently refreshing our POS back office application’s landing page with a suite of new analytics components. This is the first page our clients interact with when managing their restaurant. This page helps make smart decisions and provides quick access to powerful tools. Analytics components will be backed by our data engineering platform consisting of a data warehouse and related data pipelines.

We are now leveraging this platform both in our customer facing back office application and mobile analytics platforms. We are looking for full-stack talent to help architect and implement our solutions.

Our Primary Stack Of Technologies Include

Typescript (NodeJS/React/Redux/Cypress)
Python (Django/Flask)
AWS (ECS, Lambda, etc.)

As the project evolves, so will the technologies we are using. We believe in T-shaped skillsets. We all have our individual strengths but are willing to pull tasks from any domain.

Why Revel

We are a technology product company: we can influence product development decisions and create tools for driving foodservice businesses to success
We have a unique cultural environment: supportive leadership, Agile values, feedback culture, recognition of professional accomplishments, team buildings and a very helpful and fun loving team
We care about technology and quality: our tech initiatives are bottom-up, teams organize guilds and cross-site meetups and have a voice in shaping the company
We care about our employees: health insurance is provided for every member of our team
We invest in personal development: annual conference budget, 10% of working time dedicated to learning, Udemy license, Professional books at your desire
We share our success: Profit Sharing Plan for employees
We work flexible hours: you are in control of your working schedule

Salary

Salary ranges from 2900.00 to 6300.00 € gross

Our values

Quality in everything we do. We ensure quality with a range of tools and techniques. These include code reviews, pair programming, CI pipelines and tests. We write robust automated tests for every piece of code we craft using appropriate combinations of unit, integration, performance tests, etc. We release code using automated pipelines that support continuous delivery. We are always working to evolve these processes.
Be the change you want to see. As part of the teams leading the change in Revel, you will continuously get a chance to innovate on the codebase and make a difference in the engineering department by evolving the way we work.
Continuous personal growth. Be challenged and motivated by Revel’s talented, yet friendly engineers who will push you to new levels of professionalism. You’ll have access to both technical and leadership career opportunities across Revel’s expansive suite of products. The next challenge is always just around the corner.
Communicate boldly. We enter conversations with clearly and strongly stated opinions, but eagerly listen and learn from our teammates. Your voice will be heard in our self organizing, team led structure.
Agile as a mindset. Scrum as a framework. We promote an agile mindset by using the scrum framework to let teams self organize and own their work. We always adapt each to our team and project.
Work as a team. We foster and develop new hires at all levels of experience, thereby accelerating their onboarding and helping launch their careers at Revel.

About The Company

Revel Systems powers the ambitions of thousands of restaurants and retailers across the US and Europe with a robust cloud-based point of sale (POS) and enterprise management system. Engineers at Revel’s Online Ordering team are building a customer facing platform that allows our merchants to list their inventory online. Founded in 2010 with major offices in Atlanta, Vilnius, and San Francisco, Revel is a leading member of the Apple Enterprise Mobility Program.

Privacy Notice

By Applying For a Job Position And Submitting Your Personal Data, You Confirm That You Have Read And Accept Revel Systems’ Applicant Privacy Notice

https://cdn.revelsystems.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/13162216/Applicant-Privacy-Notice-Revel-Systems.pdf

Title: VMware DevOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
Telia IT is on a transformation journey where Cloud and Infrastructure organization plays an important role to provide cloud capabilities to support our stakeholders transforming towards cloud native workloads. We need to strengthen and increase our execution in Virtual Compute and Container capability with a Cloud Engineer that can secure our cloud offering going forward.

I am Daniel Göthberg, Head of Virtual Compute and Container capability and I am looking for a new star with solid technical background in VMware Software Defined Data Center (SDDC) and Container area to support in building and operate on premises IT cloud in the Nordics and Baltics.

Is this your next opportunity?

As Cloud Engineer in Virtual Compute and Container capability you will work in a team that consists of Product Owner, Scrum Master and Cloud Engineers having the responsibility to deliver and operate SDDC and Container services. We are in the beginning of our journey to implement the NSX-T securing whole SDDC stack, at the same time taking the next step in container area to offer cloud native capabilities to our internal stakeholders. And here you will have a key role.
Work is performed by agile principals and accordingly to SAFe framework
Securing delivery and operations in one of the largest on-premises IT cloud footprints in the Nordics
Together with team and vendors make sure we are in the forefront
Securing documentation, guidance, and knowledge sharing
On-call outside office hours
Is this you?

Forward leaning mindset and passion for technology in combination of being a team player. Feeling confident in working in an enterprise environment where operational excellence and robustness is very important.

To succeed in this role, you must have an open mindset, excellent knowledge sharing and strong collaboration skills.

Your personality:
Detail-oriented, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Communicative and collaborative with others
Your experience and skills?

Must have:
Experience in VMware “Software Defined Data Center” - vSphere, NSX-T
Good knowledge in Kubernetes (k8s)
Knowledge in Security and Compliance
Great communication skills plus well spoken and written English
Structured and skilled in documentation
Knowledge in ITIL framework and confident in working in operations that can be stressful
Nice to have:
Knowledge in HCI (vXRail) and UCS (Cisco)
No problem being in on-call
Experience in one or all container platforms VMware Tanzu, SUSE Rancher
Experience with vSAN, vRA, vROps
Experience in networking
Worked in JIRA
Knowledge in SAFe framework
CI/CD pipeline concept
GitHub
Ansible
Terraform
Vault
What will you find at our home?

We believe that people thrive in a purpose driven and value-oriented culture. You will be part of an exciting journey to shape the New Generation Telco and we promise to help you grow, both professionally and personally. We believe in self-leadership where you take responsibility for expressing yourself and achieving great results. IT & telecommunications are not just our business, it's our passion. You will join a winning team, to work with talented people and help create ideas and solutions for efficient business and better lives.

We offer a monthly base salary from 3 636 – 5 455 Euro (gross) depending on your experience. Besides, for each employee Telia has an additional employee benefit package which includes:
Health insurance and pension plans
Various Telia and partners discounts and offers
Additional vacation days
Workstation
Flexibility that enables work-life balance
Chance to grow both personally and professionally with our internal programs
Open, relaxed, and fun working environment
20 000+ awesome colleagues across Nordic & Baltics
Interested?

If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job, you are welcome to contact me at daniel.gothberg@teliacompany.com

Really looking forward to your application!

Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

Title: DevOps Engineer (AWS Cloud)
Description:
About the job
Zenitech is a dynamic, experienced, multinational team of technology and advisory professionals, a proud partner with today’s blue-chip brands and tomorrow’s leaders. Our goal is to help companies find the best and most efficient solutions, create new and develop existing products.

Our offices are in Vilnius and Kaunas, but we provide a flexible and hybrid working environment.
Currently we are on the lookout for DevOps Engineer who will join one of our projects in the Educational industry. In this project we are helping teachers to reduce manual work for assessing students' work. Developed platforms are used not only in the UK but across the world, even some one the schools in Lithuania are involved and might be using the products. The other project is from the Entertainment industry. This team is working on maintaining the Sales, Finances and Operations services of a well-known video game catalogue, creating new and improving current functionalities.

What you’ll do:
You will maintain existing systems in development, test and production environments, as well as developing new systems to support our business applications.
You will optimize systems for performance and scalability, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from design through deployment, operation, and refinement.
Support your team members by sharing quality-led best practices.
Be a key player in the DevOps Chapter, taking part in various initiatives and innovations, presenting your ideas and democratically voting on the implementation of processes.

Skills and qualities we appreciate:
AWS Cloud experience, CI/CD tooling.
Managing AWS more services like VPC, IAM, Route53, Certificate Manager, Lambda.
Infrastructure as code such as IaaC (Terraform).
Containerization with Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
Linux knowledge, Bash or Python scripting.

What you will find at Zenitech:
😎 Hybrid working model, flexible schedule and workspace.
🧘‍♂️ Private Health Insurance and Pension Plan.
💻 Technical equipment you can choose.
🌊 An opportunity to work abroad for up to 180 days.
🌼 A culture of continuous growth: training budget, People lead system, training days, Mentorship, ZeniGrow, various external courses.
🥤Stable working environment and a community-first mindset: health-related initiatives, community events, teambuilding budget.
🏅Agile mindset, flat organizational structure.
🧡 Work with talented people across technology products and consulting.
Monthly salary - €2,500 - €5,600

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Zenitech: 🎗
Zenitech is proud to have a widely diverse team. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves and each person is valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives.

The same goes for our recruitment. We want our team to reflect the world around us and that starts with you hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all of the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.

If you have accessibility needs that you would like us to know about, please let us know and we’ll make sure to design an interview format that works for you.

If you like the sound of all this we’d love to hear from you. Get in touch to find out more about how you can become part of the Zenitech community and growth journey and supercharge your career with us!

Title: Full-stack Java Developer in Financing and Loans area at SEB in Vilnius
Description:
About the job
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?

What you will be doing

Become part of a highly skilled team with aspiration to provide world class service for our customers

Would you like to work in a product area that provide Financing and Loans services for Corporate & Large Corporate customers in Nordic countries as well as for internal SEB employees? Do you want to be part of Loans solutions modernization journey and leave your footprint with future proof solutions in the bank? Join our curious and energetic teams of Financing and Loans solutions at SEB Global Service Centre in Vilnius!

As a Solution Developer you will be responsible for:

Support business needs and provide world class services
Transform Credits solutions using modern techniques and frameworks
Writing unit and integration tests
Setting up and keeping up to date CI/CD pipelines
Take part in test automation journey and testing
You build it and you own it! (Incident and problem solving)
Who we are looking for:

A team player who enjoys taking ownership
Professional experience with Spring (Springboot), JPA, Junit, IntelliJ, Docker, OpenShift, Rest Services and Oracle.
A team player, willing to learn, share knowledge and ready to accept help
Proactive and eager to take ownership colleague
Excellent English language skills.
It would be considered as an advantage if you have:

Practical experience with DevOps related tools and technologies (Jenkins, Google Cloud Platform)
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Experience working with Microservices
What we offer:

Friendly and welcoming culture
International opportunities and working environment
Challenging, cutting-edge work
Opportunities to help transform the bank
Extensive training
Flexible work-life
Wellness benefits
Comprehensive health insurance and more

Learn more about working at SEB here .

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

We are looking forward to your application by 30th of September, 2022.

Monthly salary range for this position: 2300 - 4700 EUR (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today.

Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers

Title: MID BACK-END Programmer
Senior Software Engineer - Go
Description:
About the job
Design, develop and contribute to a mature distributed systems Go code base. We're looking for experienced Go developers who can show strong technical leadership and engineering rigour. Own the design, delivery and support of features in a highly concurrent, highly distributed system that drives cloud automation and software operations at scale.

As a software engineer on the Juju team, you'll be working on a large open source Go project that powers complex distributed software systems across the world. Juju is the engine behind model-driven operations, providing a means to operate complex software on public cloud, private cloud, Kubernetes and bare-metal. Combined with the Charmed Operator framework, Juju provides a complete solution for applications and infrastructure management.

If you love solving interesting technical challenges in elegant, high-performance ways, come join our globally-distributed team of software engineers in building the future of the software-defined datacenter on the Ubuntu platform.

Many internal and external teams depend on Juju to deliver their products and services - from Canonical Infrastructure Services, our Openstack and cloud delivery teams, to Fortune 500 companies

Who You Are
Proven track record of professional software delivery using Go, C, C++ or similar.
Hands-on experience developing highly concurrent distributed systems
Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
Solid networking background and experience
Degree level education in a technology field
Experience with agile software development methodologies
Experience of the Linux and free software world
Working knowledge of cloud computing and experience with highly-concurrent distributed systems
Excellent communications skills in the English language, both verbal and written, especially in online environments
Ability to effectively interact with a diverse group of people (both technical and non-technical)
Ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation, delivering according to a schedule, and to motivate and mentor others to do the same

Desirable Traits And Experience
Passionate about software quality and testing
Experience with packaging (debian, snappy)
Programming with and operating MongoDB
Experience working on a distributed team on an open source project -- even if that is outside work open source contributions.
Demonstrated track record of Open Source contributions

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

#stack

Title: Cloud Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for prestigious companies and help them become more flexible, innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story as a Cloud Data Engineer. Join our Cognizant Data & Analytics Team in Vilnius.
About The Team
Cognizant is engineering for modern business. Find out how software is reshaping nearly every aspect of our personal and professional lives to change how people interact with the world now and in the future.
We support Cognizant engagements across all client industry verticals. Our unique team engages with customer partners, to translate strategy and vision into digital journeys, across groundbreaking technology estates, specializing in data engagements.
About The Role
We are looking for hardworking Data Engineers with eagerness to learn and deliver large complex Digital Transformation programmers across Europe. As a Data Engineer, you will have to work on Data Integration into Cloud Data Warehouses or Data Lakes, APIs, data migrations.
Key Responsibilities
Identify and analyze user requirements.
Prioritize, assign and execute tasks throughout the software development process.
Develop applications and keep project documentation updated
Write well-designed, efficient code.
Review, test and debug team members’ code
Ideal Candidate
Advanced working experience with SQL and databases
Shell scripting languages experience
Experience with data integration tools and techniques
More than 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer or equivalent
Good understanding of software development lifecycle
Experience with large data volumes, SQL performance tuning and data migration is considered as advantage
Experience working with Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud) is considered as advantage
A degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience in any of the below technology stack will be useful:
AWS: AWS Data Services
Microsoft: MSBI & Azure Data Services
GCP: GCP Data Services
Cloud Data warehouse & other cloud native technologies: Snowflake, Teradata, Databricks, Confluent, StreamSets, Elastic Search, Qubole, CloudPack4Data
Data Pipeline: Hadoop, Spark, Python, Scala, Informatica, Talend, Ab Initio, Data Stage, Syncsort, Matillion, Snaplogic, ODI, dbt, Airbyte
DataOps: Cucumber, Jenkins, Data Kitchen, Trifacta, Platfora, Podium Data, Paxata, Splunk
Database Technologies: MarkLogic, Cassandra, MongoDB, Neo4J, Oracle, Sybase, DB2, Netezza, Greenplum, HP Vertica, couchbase
What You Can Expect
Become part of the flag ship’s success story - We go through enormous growth!
An organization driven by technology - We have a tremendous technology backbone
Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
An environment where you can make your own ideas a reality
Drive your own career
Attractive salary (2500-5700 eur/month gross) depending on competency level
Competitive benefits package
Scandinavian ways of working
Opportunity to grow both professionally and personally (incl. Udemy)
Cognizant as a digital company, makes employee health and safety its top priority. With that in mind, we are implementing virtual hiring and work practices which means interviews will be conducted online.
We will be looking forward to receiving Your CV.
Only suitable candidates will be contacted.
Stay up to date with our website careers.cognizant.com/global/en!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Employee Status : Full Time Employee
Shift : Day Job
Travel : No
Job Posting : Jul 18 2022
About Cognizant
Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Senior Back-End Engineer
Description:
About the job
TransferGo is a fast-growing fintech start-up that offers online money transfers to over 160 countries with high speeds, low fees and no hassle. We’re striving to make the world a fairer place for migrants by providing tailored, more affordable financial services that makes their hard-earned money go further. Over 300 employees in offices across Europe are building a brilliant, relevant product supported by outstanding customer service.

We’ve come this far by building a talented, diverse workforce on a fair culture of trust, empowerment, and fun. And because our people understand the challenges our customers face, they’re better placed to make life easier for our customers around the world — 4 million of them, and counting.

We are looking for an ambitious and bright engineer who is eager to build and run services for moving money across the globe. If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast both professionally and personally, you might have just found one!

As Senior Back-End Engineer you will:
Design, build and operate services in a cloud-native, service-oriented environment, which will be used by multi-platform applications and hundreds of thousands of users
Enjoy a great level of end-to-end autonomy, owning system design, implementation approach and production operations of your services. We truly believe in the “Builders mindset”
Work closely with product managers and UX designers to shape product strategy, its roadmap and backlog. Your work will directly impact the business in tangible and visible ways
Contribute to engineering strategy, roadmap and the overall way how we build and run things, with your experience, skills and knowledge

Here are some of our core tools helping us to get the job done:
Runtime: PHP 7/8, Symfony
Infrastructure: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
CI/CD: Github, Jenkins
Data: MySQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, S3
Test: phpspec, Behat, PHPUnit

Please take a look at our tech stack in detail on stackshare.io.

It would be awesome if:
You have experience building distributed services and APIs, and you know what that means to run those in a heavy-load production
You enjoy building products used by people
You are a good communicator and are able to use English effectively at work
You can champion engineering innovation and best practices
You enjoy sharing your experience with other engineers and helping others to succeed

Monthly salary starting from 5000 € (gross) depending on the level of experience.

What We Believe

At TransferGo, we do the work that matters, prioritising our customers above all else. But special treatment isn’t reserved just for customers – we go above and beyond to help our colleagues and our company succeed, too, building trust and being transparent all the way. We take risks, learn from our mistakes and own what we do – and, by aspiring to be our best, we challenge ourselves to grow. This comes from knowledge-sharing and collaboration – and, of course, a hefty amount of fun!

Some Of Our Best Benefits
Being part of an exciting and growing fintech startup community;
A competitive salary package;
Unlimited paid holiday;
Being eligible for company's stock options;
Private health insurance for Lithuanian and UK employees, other employees get wellbeing packages;
Flexible working hours, with the opportunity to work from home;
The opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing, along with a guaranteed training budget of €1,000;
A friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment – a pet-friendly office (where we have them), team events, tasty snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, a fun budget and events.

As an equal opportunities employer, TransferGo is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join TransferGo.

Title: Senior C++ Developer (Gameplay)
Software Engineer - Payments
Description:
About the job
In the last 10 years, Mambu has been revolutionising banking - making it more accessible, more straightforward and more inclusive for everyone. With fresh funding secured and a near €5 billion valuation we have huge ambitions for ourselves and the whole banking sector.

We bring this same sense of innovation and aspiration to how we support our people. We pioneered the 4 day summer work week, have announced the provision of equity for all and launched Our Mambu Deal to capture how we work with each other and what we offer all Mambuvians.

These are just the beginning. We’ll continue to look for ways to make Mambu an even better place to work.

We’re not here to play it safe.

We’re here to change the world.

What You’ll Do
Work with microservices and the associated architectural patterns (serverless computing, configuration as code, containers, CQRS, CDC, SAGA, etc.
Build resilient distributed systems at scale, with strong operational and performance KPIs
Cloud computing ( AWS & GCP - we are working on becoming cloud agnostic)
Be part of self managed cross functional agile teams
Be involved in all the aspects of the SDLC
Contribute to development of CI and CD pipelines
Work with an established payments schema ( SEPA EPC, Swift MX )
What You’ll Bring

Your experience includes:
Experience working in Java or .NET (willing to switch to Java)
Microservices / Event-Driven / Asynchronous APIs
Docker / Kubernetes
Nice to have: frontend experience JavaScript/HTML/CSS
Your Colleagues Would Say
Coding isn’t your only language and you love working in a team and can communicate in English as clear as day!
You’re not satisfied with what’s already available and have the ambition to revise and improve things in the name of progress
Mambu’s future

We are a diverse group of Mambuvians, and we are growing fast. Our eyes are on the future, and we believe we can use our technology and our talent to deliver banking experiences for billions that are also sustainable and inclusive and accessible.

Your future

We’re also focused on delivering a fantastic working experience for all Mambuvians. We pioneered the 4 day working week between June - August many years ago, and continue to innovate around how work should feel and how it should get done. Our Mambu Deal is how we articulate this relationship of support and dedication which drives us all forward.

To stay on top of the latest Fintech trends and our success stories, please follow us on LinkedIn.

To experience more of the Mambu culture in action, you can follow us on Facebook or Instagram or YouTube.

For more details regarding our global career opportunities, please visit our Career Site.

As part of the recruitment (or HR onboarding) process, you will be required to obtain authorized criminal background and credit screening results, as well as be queried against a sanctions/anti-money-laundering/counter terrorism financing/politically exposed persons screening service and your employment is conditional upon approval of these results.

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many job seekers (including women, people of colour and people from diverse backgrounds) are reluctant to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.

Here at Mambu we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Software Engineer, Quality
Description:
About the job
The opportunity

Our mission in the Platform Systems quality team is to make Unity the best engine choice for developers on mobile, consoles, and all other platforms. Verifying new features, ensuring our customers can rely on the stability of any platform, and making certain Unity games run fast is what gets us up in the morning!

We’re looking for a Test Engineer to join our skillful team in Vilnius. You’ll be a trusted part of the group, working closely with the Platform Systems development team on significant improvements and cutting edge features specifically for our wide range of platform targets.

Unity is used in a huge and diverse range of games and other verticals such as film or automotive. You will have the opportunity to develop and influence technology used by developers in studios all over the world. With your help, titles built with Unity will continue to be some of the best around.

What you’ll be doing
Provide feedback about the state of the Unity product in order to support the development and inform development decisions
Work closely with developers and other quality engineers to provide early feedback to new features and functionality
Develop and maintain the test approach for your designated areas of the product
Build positive relationships and collaborate with other testers and developers in an agile environment
Work with customers to reproduce their bug reports in-house, provide assistance and advice

What we’re looking for
Experience with an object oriented programming language such as C# or C++
Experience using Unity or equivalent game engine
An observant and analytical approach to problem solving backed up with a high level of personal motivation
Confident communicating with colleagues and customers and have an excellent level of English

You might also have
Experience as a QA Engineer
Interest in platform development, such as mobile
Prior experience developing or testing games

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#MID

Title: Junior Java Developer
Description:
About the job
INSOFT – tai ilgametę patirtį IT sektoriuje sukaupusi įmonė, kurianti individualizuotą programinę įrangą organizacijoms visame pasaulyje. Tikime, kad išskirtinius rezultatus pasiekia išskirtinės komandos, todėl kompetencija ir profesionalumas yra pagrindinės vertybės, kurias puoselėjame bei kurių tikimės iš kiekvieno komandos nario. Ieškome – tiek patirties turinčių specialistų, tiek šios srities naujokų! Turime biurus tiek Vilniuje, tiek Kaune.

DARBO POBŪDIS:
WEB aplikacijų kūrimas naudojant JAVA backend ir Angular 2+ frontend;
Kodo rašymas remiantis gerosiomis rinkos praktikomis;
Sistemų kūrimas nuo kodo rašymo iki diegimo naudojant CI/CD įrankius.

MES TIKIMĖS, KAD:
Esate kruopštus, atsakingas ir motyvuotas;
Gebate dirbti tiek savarankiškai, tiek komandoje;
Turite patirties su Angular, Spring boot, REST API, SQL.

INSOFT SIŪLO:
Galimybę prisidėti prie įvairių skaitmeninės transformacijos projektų.
Palaikymą ir mokymąsi iš kolegų, vadovų bei tarptautinių klientų.
Sveikatos paslaugų paketą - rūpinamės darbuotojais ne tik žodžiais.
Lankstumą derinant darbą iš ofiso ar namų.
Lankstų darbo laiką, planuojant rezultatus, o ne valandas.
Laisvę ir pasitikėjimą over micromanagement.
Konkurencingą rinkoje atlygį.
Maistas, vaisiai ir užkandžiai virtuvėlėje, kai sotūs, tuomet ir smagiau dirbasi.

INSOFT KULTŪRA:
2 kartus per savaitę team’ui dovanojame bendrus pietus.
Horizontalus įmonės valdymas reiškia, kad tikrai visi esame lygūs.
Nejaukūs gimtadieniai? Švenčiame kartą per mėnesį visi kartu.
Bendraujame vasaros spartakiadoje ir baidarėse.
Į INSOFT GALA metų pabaigoje kviečiame ir antras puses.
Mūsų vaikai susitinka kartu atšvęsti Kalėdų.
Mylime šunis, keturkojai ofise nestebina.
Gera pailsėti tarp darbų žaidimų kambary ar laisvalaikio zonoje.
Kiekvieną skatiname įsitraukti į socialinės atsakomybės projektus.

Mėnesinė alga (bruto): 1225 EUR (pradedantysis) - 3110 EUR.

Title: Software Engineer (Scala)
Description:
About the job
We're now looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Offer Team. The main deliverable of our team is a stream of betting opportunities. Whilst we are currently consuming pre-processed sports and betting data from third-party data sources, the mid-term goal of the team is to gradually shift to a model where we have less reliance on third-party data sources, meaning that the full life-cycle of the betting opportunities will be managed in-house. We primarily use Akka Cluster with Cats and Monix, but we already have a couple of services written in ZIO and are looking towards using it more in the future.

Responsibilities
Write scalable backend services with strict requirements for low latency
Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and designers in an autonomous, supportive team environment
Solve problems in a highly technical platform that is onboarding tens of thousands of new players every month
Take part in our on-call rotation every few weeks — we build it, we run it
Improve our planning, development, and deployment processes to help you and your fellow team members

However, that's not all! At BlueLabs, we encourage you to contribute wherever your interests take you — and shape your role and our product accordingly.


Compensation
The compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €80,000 annually, depending on your skills and experience. We encourage you to read our Recruitment FAQs for further details. In addition to the monetary compensation, we provide several perks, including a shiny new MacBook 16" M1 Pro or Linux laptop.

Job requirements
BS degree in Computer Science or similar technical field
2+ years of professional software development experience. Either JVM or a purely functional programming language experience is required. Scala experience is not mandatory, but you will have to implement our recruitment coding challenge in Scala and we expect idiomatic solutions from every candidate
Deep interest in functional programming
Good knowledge of concurrent programming, as well as distributed systems
Good knowledge of microservice architecture, message-based communication, and stream processing

At BlueLabs we're combining the buzzing world of sports betting with modern tech and a great engineering culture. We own our multi-tenant sports betting platform end-to-end. It consists of tens of microservices in a handful of decoupled domains, orchestrated by a terraform-provisioned Kubernetes cluster, achieving high scalability thanks to an event-driven architecture based on Apache Pulsar. We follow modern CI/CD and agile methodologies to deploy into production multiple times per day and use Datadog to monitor our infrastructure and applications.

Title: .NET Developer
Description:
About the job
Coherent Solutions is a software product engineering and consulting company with 2200+ professionals. Headquartered in Minneapolis, USA, the company’s core competencies across multiple locations worldwide include product software development, IT consulting, data and analytics, machine learning, mobile app development, DevOps, Salesforce, and more.

A team of more than 100 skilled and ambitious Coherent Solutions Lithuania employees work on high-performing distributed teams in a high-paced environment and add value to the client’s businesses and products.

If you want to grow your core competencies and share your passion, we are on the same page.

About Client

Our client is one of the market leaders with its innovative products for healthcare industry.

This project offers a multi-tenant SaaS system used to manage consumer directed health savings accounts in the U.S. Individuals use these accounts to save money for medical expenses on a tax free basis. The accounts are integrated with debit cards that can be used to pay for various medical expenses such as doctor visits or prescriptions in a convenient and efficient manner.

About Project

The goal of the project is to implement customer-specific and general product roadmap features for the core system. This includes implementation of new business use cases, improvement of the existing web portal functionality to use the latest Web technologies, implementation of claim/payment integration with various debit card vendors and financial systems, developing web services for integration with external APIs, implementation of ETL services and creation of web and desktop clients to support certain administrative and business processes. The system user base is over 9 million consumers.

Our team works on the complete product lifecycle for the client from requirements definition to production support. The candidate should expect to work on a variety of system components, to meet challenging performance goals and to be well-integrated with other team-members.

As a Developer you will be responsible for:
Implementation design and development of new portal pages, services and supporting business logic
Developing sql code for data manipulation
Configuring application environment
Maintenance: unit tests, bug fixing, refactoring, code and performance optimization

Work will involve designing, coding, and unit testing new applications based on the user stories provided by the client. In addition, some effort will be required for bug fixing, support, and maintenance of the existing apps.

We expect you:
Have 4+ years IT experience; at least 3 years of ASP.NET development experience.
Have good knowledge of T-SQL and understanding of how relational databases work.
Have a desire and ability to work as member of a large but close team.
Have appropriate knowledge of software development patterns and practices.
Have desire and ability to understand business domain into details required to create fully-functional code.
Are attentive to details, willing to create support high-quality code with good performance metrics.
Are fluent in English

We offer

You will be rewarded with the competetive salary starting from 3000 EUR gross and the final offer would depend on your experience and aligned responsibilities. Our employee benefits are oriented to the wellbeing and security of our employees. The success of our company – is our people, therefore it is of the utmost importance that they feel good, so to support that additionally we offer Private Health Insurance, Life and accident investment insurance, additional leave days, opportunity to work from anywhere, workations, free lunches, language courses, company events and team building activities and much more!

Title: Python Software Developer (with relocation in Romania)
Description:
About the job
Project Description:

As a Staff Software Engineer in the DevProd team, you will be part of the Juniper Apstra team to help scale and facilitate our product development and testing process. In this role, you will develop, extend and maintain automated system test infrastructure and work closely with developers to improve their productivity and deliver superior feature velocity and quality.


Minimum Qualifications:

- MS/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
- 5+years of experience with software development (Python preferred) and frameworks for unit/integration or system testings like pytest or nosetests
- Experience developing with SQL and NoSQL databases, such as MySQL and MongoDB
- Experience in writing infrastructure software used internally by organizations for development productivity
- Understanding of build/test systems and experience with CI/CD process and tools, such as Jenkins
- Solid experience administrating Linux-based systems
- Good understanding of virtualization and containers technologies (KVM/VMware, Docker)

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience in building software for system test automation for enterprise products
- Experience with using and configuring Jenkins or equivalent Continuous Integration tools
- Exposure to Kubernetes management (on-premises)

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain our automated system test infrastructure by writing code in Python
Design and develop analytics and indexes to characterize release quality, or help identify flaky tests or misbehaving infrastructure component using Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana
Be part of the Engineering team to identify new requirements, and add new features into the test infrastructure that accommodate for new features' development into the product
Monitoring the systems composing the infrastructure for regressions or failures and react to them promptly to unblock engineering team.
Identify and proactively tackle issues that impact developer productivity. Identify bottlenecks and plan for growth.

Skills:

Must have:
Python, GEvent, Celery, MongoDB, CI/CD, MySQL, Linux, Docker, KVM/VMware

Nice to have:
ELK Stack, MariaDB, Celery, Jenkins Pipeline, Docker, PyTest, Jenkins, Nose, Kubernetes exposure.

Languages:
English: C1 Advanced

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
Would you like to join the #1 marketing data pipeline company and one of Europe's fastest-growing tech companies?

We're looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join the Engineering team!

🧩 You'll make an impact by

Helping us manage and grow our infrastructure from both a development and systems perspective and solving intriguing challenges such as big-scale caching of data across multiple clouds and regions.

We're searching for someone who wants to think and breathe in the Linux command line and is interested in container management and scaling large amounts of data. In this role, you'll have a great opportunity to take ownership of all the infrastructure you build and manage for Supermetrics!

Ideally, you'll be located in Helsinki, Vilnius, Singapore, or Canada, but you can also work 100% remotely from Poland, Spain, Portugal, Ireland, the UK, or the US. Nevertheless, we work tightly together online by having daily catch-ups with the team!

📝 Your Day-to-day Work And Responsibilities Will Include

Consult engineering team with various decisions & choices related to infra
Developing and maintaining monitoring dashboards to help different stakeholders understand the applications and systems
Plan, document, research (do case studies) on new tools, services, systems, etc
Create, maintain & improve automation
Ensure reliability and availability for all services
Manage and maintain existing infrastructure, improve and develop it further
Develop monitoring to ensure applications and systems availability

🔧 Technologies You'll Be Working With

Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Ansible, Packer, Docker
Programing languages: PHP, Python, Bash
Cloud: AWS, GCP, Azure, Cloudflare
Database: MySQL, Redis
CICD: Jenkins, Github Actions
Logging: OpenSearch stacks (Logstash, OpenSearch, OpenSearch Dashboard), Stackdriver
Application servers: Nginx, Fargate, Cloud Run, Kubernetes

💪 This Position Is For You If You Have

5+ years of experience in DevOps and systems administration
Strong Linux skills
Strong experience in one or more cloud technology: Google Cloud, AWS
Database management and tuning skills in SQL and NoSQL environments (MySQL, Postgres, Redis, etc.)
Good programming experience (PHP or Java)
Ability to operate big & streaming data
Understanding of / Having experience in building scalable and resilience system
Experience in creating and maintaining infrastructure in Cloud with IaC tools
Problem-solving & automation mindset
Excellent English skills (written and spoken)

💪 Nice To Have Skills

Security (DevSecOps side)
Multi-cloud knowledge & strategies
Ansible, scripting languages (python, go, ..)
Experience with business intelligence/data warehousing / ETL

👀 Why work as a DevOps Engineer in Supermetrics?

You'll get hands-on experience in building resilience, fault-tolerant, and scalable infrastructure for Supermetrics services
You get to work closely with different stakeholders when developing any new services
Manage and maintain big scale infrastructures across the clouds (AWS, GCP) and multi-region (EU, US, ASIA)
Work on things that directly/indirectly impacts the business
Create & manage systems used by different products at Supermetrics

At Supermetrics, we have invaluable team spirit and shared excitement for continuous learning and knowledge sharing. We take our work seriously — not so much ourselves. We recognize our team as the greatest perk and take good care of our people.

And in case we haven't met before, here's Supermetrics in a nutshell:

It all started from a Google t-shirt...

Supermetrics was founded in 2013 as a result of one data geek's will to win a Google t-shirt, and we have been profitable and growing ever since!

We build products that are used by 500k people worldwide in small and big companies alike (BBC, Dyson, and WarnerBros, to name a few). Marketers, data analysts, and engineers use Supermetrics to move data from popular marketing platforms (such as Facebook, Google Ads, and HubSpot) to destinations like Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel, and various BI tools, and data warehouses.

We're a diverse community of curious minds excited to build the best business data solutions. Kindness, humility, openness, and dedication to our respective crafts are our most prevalent traits.

Does this sound like your next adventure? Apply now! We'll fill the role as soon as we find the right person.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
About the job
Would you like to join a team of motivated professionals integrating bank with external partners?

In This Team You Have The Opportunity To
Be Software engineer with main responsibility to enable and continue implementation of partner integration tools such as Sterling Integrator, API Gateway, Connect: Direct, batch management platform and etc.
Belong to the team working with integration solutions for external partners.
Influence and implement vision of integration domain for bank.
What Is Needed In This Role
Proven record of previous experience of system development/ administration (2+ years of practical experience).
Good technical knowledge in network, firewalls, encryption/decryption, Linux administration, ftp/sftp, http/https, access rights.
Working knowledge of relational databases and networking protocols (TCP, HTTP).
Good understanding or previous experience in systems integration area.
Good understanding of information security practices.
Interested in building automation and automating regular maintenance tasks, knowledge in working with public Cloud is a plus.
Interested in programming and scripting in bash shell script, MS power shell, Python, Ansible, Java.
Willingness and ambition to learn new things and contribute in all areas: service management, analyze, design, development, building, testing and maintaining services.
‘Can do’ attitude.
Agile mindset.
Ability and the professionalism to understand business needs and develop them into technical solutions.
University Degree, preferably in Computer Science other sciences and/or previous relevant working experience within FinTech sector.
Proficient communication skills in English.
The ability to work in an international team.
At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. We support continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. We take care of your wellbeing by providing a sustainable and flexible working environment. As an employee you will be part of the Group performance program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. It’s all about delivering a positive and unique experience for our customers through collaboration and team-work – together we make a difference.

"Join our team and...

be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage." Mindaugas, your future leader.
For this position we do not offer relocation
We look forward to your application at 18.09.2022 the latest.

If you are to be employed in Latvia, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 2850-4250 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

If you are to be employed in Lithuania, please note that the salary offered for this position ranges from 3500-5200 EUR gross i.e. before taxes. Read more here.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Dotnet Developer
Software Engineer
Description:
About the job
Our mission is to empower eCommerce stores to unlock their full potential. Want to join?

Wayflyer is revolutionising the eCommerce space by levelling the playing field for eCommerce founders across the world. Unlocking and fuelling their growth through solving their two biggest pain-points: funding and insights.

We use data to solve both of these challenges, empowering store owners with insights on how best to acquire customers online and providing them with short-term financing to scale and unlock their store's full potential.

Why Wayflyer?

Wayflyer is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup that serves a critical need for eCommerce entrepreneurs. You'll be joining a hyper-growth, ambitious, collaborative team that's working on a huge opportunity.

We have countless opportunities as we launch new markets and game-changing products and need teammates that love having high impact in a fast-moving and ambitious company.

Since launching in April 2020, we’ve deployed over $550m in funding across 8 countries to 1000+ eCommerce founders. In 2021 alone, the amount of funding we deployed to customers grew by 900%. We recently announced our Series B, raising $150m in funding at $ 1.6bn valuation; backed by world-leading VCs including Left Lane Capital and DST Global. There are 250+ of us globally, split between our offices in Atlanta, Dublin, London and Sydney.

Here’s more info from our founder and you can learn more about our culture here.

What you will do?
Work within our current technical stack (Python Django React Typescript & AWS).
Enhance our practice in continuous integration, test automation and continuous deployment.
Mentor other members of the team to grow our skill base.
Take an active role in product development and push new product directions.

What skills do you need?
You have the capacity to work autonomously in a rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous environment.
You have significant previous experience developing server-side solutions at considerable scale.
You've worked with distributed systems and have plenty of experience in server side development with a high level language, e.g. Python, Java, etc. It doesn't have to be something we use. We're confident that great engineers can quickly get up to speed, and we'll provide the support and time you need to do that.

Why now?
2022 is set to be our most ambitious year: entering multiple geographies and launching new game-changing products to further revolutionise eCommerce.
You'll be contributing hugely to the company's ultimate growth and success.
You'll be working with different disciplines and on a multitude of projects to bring your ideas through to fruition.
You'll be defining the culture of Wayflyer. 'The early team you build is the company you build' - you'll leave a lasting impact.

Engineering at Wayflyer is remote-first. The heart of Wayflyer is in Dublin, but our team is based all over Europe. We have offices in Dublin and London should you wish to work there, some or all of the time. As you are in a highly collaborative role, you will need to be able to work in an EU timezone.

Title: Backend Developer
Description:
About the job
We are looking for a Back-End Engineer to join our early-stage FinTech!

At Paytrix, our mission is to redefine global payments for online businesses, helping them to thrive in the digital economy. Based remotely in the UK or Europe, this will be one of our first Engineering hires and the Back-End Engineer will be central to helping shape the technical platform and building a resilient, high-performing and diverse team.


WHO WE ARE

We are building the world’s first regulated payments curation layer. By consolidating best in class payments infrastructure under our ecosystem, we will enable marketplaces and eCommerce brands to scale their payments operations smoothly around the world.

We’ve just raised one of the largest pre-seed rounds in UK history from some of the world's leading FinTech focused Venture Capital firms (including the backers of Flywire, Pipe, GoCardless, Tide, Pave, and Stitch), and are supported by several well-known industry angel investors that have built multi-billion dollar businesses globally.

We are building a workplace that encourages growth, development, and fun. Working in a startup can be both rewarding and challenging, we’ll be with you throughout the highs and lows as one team.

Our goal is to make the complex - simple, messy - clean, and global scale accessible to every brand and platform. How we move money is changing at an unprecedented rate, and a digital revolution is happening now. Do you want to just watch? Or are you going to seize on the opportunity to help drive it?


THE CHALLENGE

At the intersection of fiat, crypto, Decentralized Finance (DeFi), non-traditional forms of transfer of value, and Government regulations exists a very difficult problem to solve: How to make it all work -at a global scale-, in a seamless, safe, legal, fair and private way? That’s what Paytrix has set out to address through a combination of global partnerships with tier one organisations, streamlined commercial and legal agreements, and truly progressive technology.


THE ROLE: BACK-END DEVELOPER

We are looking for a relentlessly driven and intellectually curious individual to join our back-end team. Although your primary responsibility will be to focus on the back-end logic, you are most likely a full-stack technologist who spends time writing code, driving technical discussions/decisions and actively guiding architecture, tool choices and internal technical quality. We are deploying to K8S with ArgoCD on AWS but remain somewhat cloud agnostic as we are pursuing a multi-cloud strategy.


To be successful in this role, you:
