Have a broad set of expertise and experience on various technical matters and in particular with designing, developing and deploying API-first cloud-native systems.
Are familiar with the 12 Factor App methodology and may even have formulated your own additional factors!
Are highly proficient in Java (language, data structures and algorithms), Spring Boot, and Spring Cloud, and have extensively used WebFlux or other reactive frameworks, alongside the usual cloud resilience patterns.
Can co-create an environment of psychological safety that enables team members to thrive. This is very important to us, as we are a highly diverse group made up of people from many different ethnicities, religious beliefs and gender identities.
Have some experience in Payments or a FinTech business.

As part of this role you will receive the following:

Base salary between £60k and 85k / You will enjoy 25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) / Private Medical / Pension / Company Options Scheme
We recognise that starting a new job can be intense. That’s why we give all new employees an additional week's paid leave before they join - so that you can have some downtime, and take that holiday you’ve been putting off. Whatever you want to do with that time is up to you - but it’s on us, and doesn’t come out of your annual allowance.



THE OPPORTUNITY

You will be working with a highly experienced and driven team where, alongside your day-to-day activities, you will learn the ins and outs of creating and growing a technology company.
You’ll have the opportunity to make important technical decisions and shape the future of the platform, business, and payments.
You will work with “state of the art” but not “bleeding edge” technologies and will have a clear path to influence decisions and outcomes.
You will be working remotely, but getting together IRL at regular intervals to establish personal and meaningful relationships with your team and the rest of the company.


THE PROCESS

We know interviews can be laborious. To keep the process as streamlined as possible, we’ve split it into 3 stages, and we will keep you informed of your progress at each stage:
Initial interview: (60 minutes)
Technical assessment, This stage typically takes two hours (60 min to design a hypothetical system / 60 min to code a PoC)
Call with Founders
Offer, where we will explain the compensation package, long-term incentive program and ancillary benefits. This stage usually takes less than an hour.

Paytrix does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. Paytrix will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to the specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Paytrix on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description:
About the job
MySQL Developer Tools is the team behind well-known open source tools like MySQL Workbench, MySQL GUI Automator, Casmine C++ BDD testing framework and recently the MySQL Shell extension for Visual Studio code.

General Description:
The MySQL Developer Tools team is seeking a Preact/React/Typescript Developer to help us to realize our vision of a free and open source web-based MySQL and Oracle database tool, which integrates well with Visual Studio Code and provides advanced features for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and MySQL database management for beginners as well as advanced users. This is a 100% remote position.

Responsibilities:
Produce clean, readable code with comments, by following the established team standards
Closely work with documentation and QA teams to produce the best documentation and highest code and product quality
Perform peer code reviews
Identify opportunities for refactoring, abstraction & recombination of the code base
Operate in a self-managed capacity

Required Qualifications:
3 years developing user interfaces using standard web technologies (HTML, CSS)
Typescript, NodeJS, Preact/React, Jest and Git are your daily tools + languages
You have a strong sense of good UI design
You are a fast learner, quick to discover, learn & use frameworks, libraries
You are comfortable in design and architecture discussions
You have strong communications skills
You are a problem solver with a proactive attitude
You are confident in Git, CI/CD tools, Gerrit, Jenkins, Worklog

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with MySQL and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
BS or master degree, or equivalent experiences
Familiarity with client/server technology and communication middleware
Experiences with Usabilty, User experience, and UI design
Experiences with UI accessibility
Experiences with agile work principles (SCRUM or similar)
Familiar/involved with open source projects (show us what you have published, e.g. on Github)

Perks:
Remote work with generous home office and monthly internet reimbursements.
Flexible leave policy - take time off when you need it.
Company shares based on personal performance
Small, but international and super friendly team, working with colleagues from all over the world

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems.

Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.

Additional Information:
Oracle is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).

Other Locations: Norway, Slovakia, Lithuania

Title: JAVA Software Engineer @ Search team
Software Engineer (.NET)
Description:
About the job
About The Role And Team

We are looking for a Regular or talented Junior Software Engineer in IAM BE team, which is responsible for building the back end layer of new Identity and Access Management (aka IAM) system, as well as owning Authorization scope and API gateway in Adform.

Our team owns critical part of Adform Flow – user and permissions management, data access, integration with crucial Adform’s services, and data migration. You, as a Software Engineer will be able to work on building this new system, develop the scaling solution, new features, as well as maintaining and monitoring existing ones that are under the team's ownership. You will be able to learn interesting technologies (like graph databases), have the opportunity to use best tech stack and contribute to one of the most important objectives of the year.

Your future colleagues are real security geeks – always looking for that extra layer of security over identity management. Team is located in 3 different locations – developers in Kaunas, Vilnius and Warsaw – so be ready to smile for the camera.

Your Responsibilities

Design, build, test, deploy, monitor, and maintain products and services
Focus on top-notch value delivery for customer
Collaborate with team and have an ownership attitude
Work closely with other teams to determine interdependencies
Work closely with and incorporating feedback from product management, IT Engineers, enterprise architects, and security analysts
Apply best practice defined by different functional areas (Architecture, Quality, Security, Product Management, Project Management)

We expect you

Have at least 2 years professional experience in .NET
Have experience in the development and maintenance of RESTful API, building applications and Back-End services using C#
Have experience working with SQL and NoSQL databases
Have experience with Continuous Integration, GIT, Unit testing, integration testing, monitoring and logging
Have experience in building solutions according to microservices architecture principles
Have experience with any messaging infrastructure (RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.)
Have knowledge of software design patterns
Have knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, other)
Have an agile & ownership mindset, easily adapt to changes
Be good at written and verbal English (upper-intermediate level)

It would be an advantage if you

Have experience working with GraphQL
Have knowledge of OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect (OIDC), Identity Access Management domain
Have knowledge of VM provisioning (Puppet, Terraform, Ansible, other)
Understand concepts of high availability, high performance, and high security
Have knowledge of Agile software development

Our promise

Experienced and professional team
Challenging and exciting work environment with collaborative team mates sharing local and global objectives
Dynamic, inspiring and international team-oriented „learning “environment
Informal style of leadership and communication – but with the highest expectations of performance and professionalism
Possibilities to learn and work with experts from different countries (offices around the world)
Monthly salary starting from 2800 EUR gross. The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies

If you wonder about these things – we have something to offer you

Worry about health and accident insurance? Chill – we got this!
Eager to enjoy your vacay a bit longer? We offer additional vacation days!
Enjoy having work-fun balance? Good news! Fun office activities, team buildings and a friendly team will cheer you up! Explore our offices by going on a virtual tour!
Enjoy having lunch out? Grab your colleagues and enjoy delicious lunch at a friendly price in our canteen or outside on Adform terrace!
Wanna stay in shape? Join Adform sports team and exercise together!
Worry about your lonely left-at-home pet? Bring it to the office! We are very pet-friendly and happy to get to know your companion!
Having a headache or a sneezing morning? Adform offers 2 trust days for you to get better by staying at home! Use them and get back to work when feeling fresh again!
Not enough? Join us and find out more!

About us Adform is the only global, independent and fully integrated advertising platform built for modern marketing. Its unique enterprise technology – Adform FLOW – harnesses superior user experience and a scalable, modular and open architecture, to enable seamless management of the whole campaign lifecycle. It provides clients with enhanced control and transparency across their advertising operations, including ownership of all data from their campaigns. Since 2002, Adform has developed technology to enhance human/machine collaboration and deliver augmented intelligence, thereby amplifying business results for its clients around the world.

Title: Junior/Mid Android Software Engineer
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

We’re looking for Android Software Engineers to join our Product Engineering teams. We have several positions available and are looking for specialists with varying experience, from junior to mid-level. If you’re skilled at writing elegant code and like working on big-scale projects, then Vinted could be for you.

You’ll be developing new features for our members – all the way from concept to roll-out. Our cross-functional Product Engineering teams have all the main competences needed for shipping new features to our members without outside help.

Each team usually comprises Mobile Developers (iOS and Android), Web Developers, and 1–2 Back-end Software Engineers. As one of our new Android Software Engineers, you’ll be responsible for giving our Android-using members the best user experience and ensuring our app’s quality and stability.

Take a look at engineering.vinted.com to see what we’re up to.

In This Position, You’ll
Work as a team to shape features that make our members’ lives better
Apply Agile (Scrum) principles in your work and always strive for efficiency
Collaborate with other developers through GitHub pull requests and code reviews
Write unit tests for all of the code you write
See your code affect more than 65+ million members
Work with Android, Kotlin, RxJava, and more
Work on App Modularization
Make decisions based on data
About You
Have some experience in building Android apps (1-2 years)
Use “Learning Mode” as often as possible
Know what it’s like to work in a team and reach results together
Not afraid to challenge the status quo
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Private health insurance
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 2675–4770 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need.

Title: Software Engineer III
Description:
About the job
The Software Design Engineer is responsible for the design, development, testing, and deployment of computer software to implement various internal software packages relating directly to electrical engineering requirements.

General Responsibilities

Handles the developing of complex software in selected languages for Sensata products and/or applications consistently following Sensata’s coding standards and in accordance with applicable software development methodology and release processes
Introduces new development of software to control external hardware for automated test equipment and other applicable development
Handles software engineering tools such as configuration management systems, build processes, and debuggers in the software development process
Creates and executes designs for small sets of new functionality as part of a software project
Handles participation in peer code reviews, providing comments and suggestions

Experience / Qualifications

A university degree required (i.e. Bachelors degree) or equivalent relevant work experience.
Must be a team player able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to handle multiple competing tasks and demands
Strong communication skills; oral, written and presentation
Strong organization, planning and time management skills to achieve results
Strong personal and professional ethical values and integrity
Holds self-accountable to achieving goals and standards
Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
Strong interpersonal & collaboration skills to work effectively with all levels of the organization including suppliers and/or external customers

Responsibilities

Review’s project/feature requirements and provides feedback.
Reviews and understands schematics.
Collaborates on design with and takes direction from principal level engineers.
Designs and scopes feature enhancements and smaller scale projects.
Develops software tasks consistent with style and structure of the current codebase in a timely manner
Implements SW (unit) tests, confirms and records results.
Review’scode and provides feedback.
Creates and maintains release binaries and documentation.
Works with a test group to support integration and regression testing.
Supports troubleshooting with hardware engineers and FAEs.
Communicates with customer and partner technical staff as required and conveys information clearly and accurately.

Requirements

5+ years professional experience working with C or C++.
Experience working with ARM processors.
Experience with IOT
Thorough understanding of real-time operating systems.
Thorough understanding of hardware interfaces.
Good communicationskills at all levels.

Desirable Skills

Experience working with ARM Cortex-M series of processors.
Experience working with FreeRTOS or ThreadX.
Experience working with CAN bus, Ethernet or USB.
Experience working with RF engineering.
Thorough understanding of cellular technologies.
Experience working with software versioning tools (Git, SVN).

Strong English communication skills.

SmarterTogether

Collaborating at Sensata means working with some of the world’s most talented people in an enriching environment that is constantly pushing towards the next best thing
Employees work across functions, countries and cultures gaining new perspectives through mutual respect and open communication
As OneSensata, we are working together to make things work together

Click here to view Sensata Recruitment Privacy Statement

Click here to view our Sensata Recruitment Privacy Statement for China

NOTE: If you are a current Sensata employee (or one of our Affiliates), please back out of this application and log into Workday via the Company Intranet to apply directly. Type "FIND JOBS" in the Workday search bar.

Title: Kubernetes Engineer
Description:
About the job
EIS is an insurance software company that enables leading insurers to innovate and operate like a tech company: fast, simple, agile. Founded in 2008, EIS provides an open, flexible platform of core systems and digital solutions allowing insurers to accelerate and scale innovation, launch products faster, deliver new revenue channels, and create experiences the world will love. With thousands of APIs, the platform gives insurers the freedom to connect to a vast ecosystem of insurtech and emerging technologies. EIS powers premium growth for insurers in all lines of business worldwide. For more information visit EISGroup.com

At EIS our DevOps team is cooperating with highly talented software development professionals. The team is responsible for the support and improvement of DevOps tools for the whole organization and microservices engineering practices. DevOps work at EIS can be very different, starting from implementing Jenkins pipelines using Groovy scripts, Terraform scripts, adjusting Maven, Scala and NPM build processes, extending Helm charts, and ending with researching the best approach to have stable and distilled DevOps practices applied to our product development lifecycle. Our DevOps team is managing 20+ different Cloud accounts for customers, which are mostly on AWS and Azure. Our microservice platform has around 100 pods running in non-scaled mode. Our typical CI/CD environment for engineering contains more than 250 VMs which require 2700+ vCPU, 6.5 TB of RAM. These numbers are even bigger on our managed public cloud accounts for our customers where we are supporting SaaS. It’s lots of responsibility but also lots of fun to work with!

We are looking for smart, dynamic and intuitive people to join our growing team of insurance technology professionals and industry experts – this particular opportunity is for an experienced Kubernetes Engineer.

Get ready to:
Ensure optimal Kubernetes platform usage for development and production environments
Collaborating with development teams during product implementation
Constantly challenge the existing practices to propose improvements

What we expect from You:
Kubernetes system architecture knowledge and experience in building and maintaining Kubernetes-based configurations
Good Linux OS administration knowledge and experience
Experience with Ansible and Helm
Experience working with Docker - building, maintaining, executing Docker images. Knowledge of dockerfiles and their maintenance in Kubernetes
An open mind and pro-active approach to any obstacles we may face
A willingness to learn and contribute to our DevOps team future

Bonus points if you have:
Experience using public clouds (AWS, Azure, GCP or other)
Experience in setting up monitoring (Grafana, Prometheus, AWS CloudWatch)
Logging knowledge (ELK, AWS OpenSearch)
DevSecOps knowledge
Some history of IT community work - conferences, meetups etc.
Mentoring or team leading experience

We offer:
An international career working on insurtech product
Agile work environment
Community and knowledge sharing gatherings
EIS University - infinite learning source
External training, conferences, and certification programs
Flexible working hours, office, remote or hybrid work option
Employee referral program
Health insurance and gym coverage
Fun company parties and team building events
Safe bicycle parking space
Personal gifts on different occasions
We work with the newest Apple Macbooks
Salary EUR 3000 - 6500 gross, depending on level of experience

By applying for this job vacancy, the candidate affirms the processing of his/her personal data according to the Personal Data Protection Law and their storage in the HR unit of EIS Lithuania. Without candidate's consent his/her personal data will not be disclosed to the third parties.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
About The Role And Team

Adform is growing and we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join a team, which provides services and consultations for our 250+ internal clients (mostly developers). The core services of the team include, but are not limited to:

Deployment workflows and tooling
Observability platforms
Configuration management
Automation and self-service platforms
Your responsibilities

Building and maintaining team services in a high scale environment on top of Kubernetes and OpenStack
Providing CI/CD tooling, based on GitHub Actions, DroneCI and TeamCity
Building internal tools and services using Go and Python
Automating all the things (with a decent serving of yak shaving)
Sharing knowledge and consulting developers on improving the development process
Following technology trends and implementing best practices
Continuously developing personal, interpersonal and technical competence
We expect you

Linux/Windows Server administration skills
Working experience with observability systems (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Thanos, ELK)
Deep understanding of configuration management practices and tools (e.g., Puppet, Ansible)
Experience managing infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform)
Developed complex applications in Go or Python
Designed and built complex systems at scale
Built a CI/CD platform and pipelines
It would be an advantage if you

Have experience with distributed tracing (e.g., OpenTracing)
Worked with Grafana Loki, HashiCorp Vault or JFrog Artifactory
Have contributed code to an open-source project
Our promise

You will have an opportunity to learn and grow on a daily basis
You will work with highly professional and knowledgeable colleagues
Your Leader will ensure transparent, up to date communication and support your needs
You will be given challenging and unique tasks with creative approach to problem-solving
You will be surrounded by dynamic, inspiring and international environment
Monthly salary range for this position starts from 4100 euros gross. The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies
If you wonder about these things – we have something to offer you

Worry about health and accident insurance? Chill – we got this!
Eager to enjoy your vacay a bit longer? We offer additional vacation days!
Enjoy having work-fun balance? Don‘t worry – fun office activities, team buildings and a friendly team will cheer you up! Explore our offices by going on a virtual tour!
Enjoy having lunch out? Grab your colleagues and enjoy delicious lunch at a friendly price in our canteen or outside on Adform terrace!
Wanna stay in shape? Join Adform sports team and exercise together!
Worry about your lonely left-at-home pet? Bring it to the office! We are very pet-friendly and happy to get to know your companion!
Having a headache or a sneezing morning? Adform offers 2 trust days for you to get better by staying at home! Use them and get back to work when feeling fresh again!
Not enough? Join us and find out more!

About us Adform is the only global, independent and fully integrated advertising platform built for modern marketing. Its unique enterprise technology – Adform FLOW – harnesses superior user experience and a scalable, modular and open architecture, to enable seamless management of the whole campaign lifecycle. It provides clients with enhanced control and transparency across their advertising operations, including ownership of all data from their campaigns. Since 2002, Adform has developed technology to enhance human/machine collaboration and deliver augmented intelligence, thereby amplifying business results for its clients around the world.

Title: Software Engineer (quality assurance) - Baltic Factoring CFT
Front-end Developer
Description:
About the job
About the job

Currently, we are looking for a Front-end Developer. If you want to be part of a winning team, CoinGate is a great place to grow your career, learn something new and even show us some new things as well!

GET READY TO:

Lead the development of the product front-end;
Own and lead front-end stack, architecture;
Mentor, support and lead other developers within the front-end technologies domain;
Ensure the front-end codebase meets the best standards;
Co-deliver top-notch user interfaces and experiences.

WE EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:

React, NextJS, Typescript, RESTful APIs;
Interested in the best practices of UI/UX;
Fluency in English, verbal and written;
Understanding of Agile and Scrum practices.

NICE TO HAVE:

Unit and E2E tests;
A/B testing tools;
Experience with OKR framework.

HERE’S THE DEAL!!!

SALARY RANGE
4100 - 5780 eur /month gross (depending on your skills and experience).

PERKS

We offer a flexible hybrid work model. So if you are feeling tired or not in the right mood for the office, relax and work from home. Or from anywhere you wanna be.
Bond with the whole CoinGate family at our yearly events, workations, team buildings, or casual game nights. If you have some fun activities in mind – let us know and we’re probably gonna make it happen.
Create an impact on worldwide crypto adoption. As crypto is still a relatively new product in the whole fintech sector, every new idea can have a huge impact on our main goal.
Grow or even change your career. If you’ll find a new passion or a super talent of yours while you are with us, don’t be afraid to try yourself in the new role. We promise to help you in every way possible.
Initiate changes and suggest different approaches. As a young, curious, and continuously growing company we like to be informal, but professional. We’re always looking for new challenges in this fast-changing crypto environment.

THE COMPANY

We are a crypto payment gateway, trading platform, and e-commerce store under the same name – CoinGate.
Founded in 2014, CoinGate was and is at the forefront of the global cryptocurrency payments ecosystem. Serving businesses and everyday users alike, CoinGate has processed more than 1,600,000 crypto transactions and has more than 270,000 registered users on its platform.
We have a goal to increase crypto adoption worldwide and an ambitious team, which keeps us going through this wild ride. We’re pioneers in crypto, we’re passionate about the things we do and we try to deliver our best.

Location
Our office is located at the heart of a city, at A. Goštauto g. 8, Vilnius, just in-between the white bridge and Lukiškės square.

Title: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (.NET, React)
Description:
About the job
Are you independent and passionate about IT? A warm colleague who cares about others?

If so, we might be a great match!

About KOMPONENT
Project-based work in the areas of software development, IoT and IT security, mainly with Norwegian Customers, across a broad range of domains: fin-tech, media, robotics, oil, and SoMe to name a few...
We have our priorities straight – we like to keep our employees happy & content!
And we do all this in a professional trust-based work environment.

About YOU
Well educated and/or experienced IT talent, motivated to work with the latest technology.
Highly skilled in .NET 5/.NET 6, React.js and AWS.
Experienced with various IT architectures and have strong cloud computing knowledge.
The opportunity to interact with customers and end users directly adds to your work effectiveness and efficiency.
You are comfortable using English as your work language.
Agile is your preferred way of working.

How do we WORK
With smart people, using the latest technologies.
With cloud and DevSecOps, modern UI frameworks, also backend integrations and databases.
Forge strong, trust-built relationships within the team and the customers. No unnecessary overheads.

Here is what you can EXPECT
Salary in the range of 4500-6500 EUR gross per month, depending on your competence and experience.
Professional colleagues you can learn from and rely on.
Daily encouragement, support & warmth.
Flexible work schedule & remote work option.
Variety of Employee perks & benefits.
Workation options.

Our recruitment process focuses on you as a person as much as your knowledge. By applying, you can expect to have a different rounds of interviews, including one that focuses on your technical knowledge. In addition, we may ask you to share a list of 10 reference people with whom we can talk to learn even more about your personality.

Title: Software Engineer - Ubuntu Gaming Experience
Description:
About the job
We are seeking Software Engineers to join the Ubuntu Gaming Experience team and be part of our mission to ship the best open source operating system in the world. This is an opportunity for a Software Engineer passionate about open source software and gaming on the Linux desktop. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

We are in an exciting time for gaming on Linux. Compatibility tools like Proton have matured and many native Windows titles can be made to work, massively expanding the library of titles available on Linux. Delivering a well rounded gaming experience is about more than just compatibility; it's about maximising performance across a wide range of hardware, ensuring anti-cheat is robust and secure, making it easy to access tools for content creation, driver management and HUD overlays as well as ensuring game controllers, headsets, RGB keyboards and gaming mice are fully supported and customisable.

We want to make the widest selection of games "Just Work" on Ubuntu, and we are creating a team to focus on performance, compatibility and user experience for gamers. We want to create a platform that makes it easy for players to find the games they want, use the devices they own and share those experiences with friends.

In this role you will work with open source projects like Proton and partners like Unity to improve the gaming experience for Ubuntu users around the world, as well as the wider Linux gaming ecosystem in general. You will need to be effective working with low-level libraries, drivers, and the Linux graphics, sound and input stacks.

What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team, on low-level, performance and security-critical software
Integrate work from multiple partners into Ubuntu, ensuring reliability, security and performance
Write high quality code in C, Python and C++, debug issues and produce high quality fixes
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events

Who you are
You have experience with Linux input, sound, graphics, C and C++
You are interested in working with OpenGL, Vulkan, Mesa, Proton, Wine, DXVK, and Direct3D
You love to game and you understand the challenges facing gamers on Linux today!
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are passionate about creating the best gaming experiences, open source, and solving complex problems.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Title: Senior Observability Engineer
Description:
About the job
In the last 10 years, Mambu has been revolutionising banking - making it more accessible, more straightforward and more inclusive for everyone. With fresh funding secured and a near €5 billion valuation we have huge ambitions for ourselves and the whole banking sector.

We bring this same sense of innovation and aspiration to how we support our people. We pioneered the 4 day summer work week, have announced the provision of equity for all and launched Our Mambu Deal to capture how we work with each other and what we offer all Mambuvians.

These are just the beginning. We’ll continue to look for ways to make Mambu an even better place to work.

We’re not here to play it safe.

We’re here to change the world.

Meet your team

The O11y Platform Team is multi-national, remote-first and responsible for making sure Mambuvians - and eventually our customers - have excellent visibility into the state of our systems by supplying platforms and frameworks for monitoring, logging, tracing and alerting.

As a Senior Engineer you will enable engineering teams to own and continuously improve the observability of their services. Your primary role is building, operating and continuously improving observability platforms and services for Mambu products. You also act as an SME in observability area, actively defining and promoting best practices on collecting, refining, processing telemetry data across all product functions. You help teams extract insights from observability data & make meaningful decisions. You will have day to day possibility to interact with public cloud providers, support and development teams, by being a stakeholder and having a role in shaping the roadmaps. This is a role with lots of growth possibilities and a healthy amount of freedom to make it happen together with the team.

What You’ll Do
Be responsible for building and maintaining the multi-cloud observability stack with a focus on reliability and maintainability of the platform.
Contribute hands-on to the critical work of the team, collaborating with a wider engineering team on a shared platform vision.
Define and implement good observability practices company wide to help build a better product, through strong communication and cross-functional collaboration.
What You’ll Bring

Your experience includes:
Designing and supporting observability services for product and infrastructure stacks at scale - with both open source and proprietary solutions;
Having worked as a DevOps/SRE/Ops engineer with focus on reliability and availability of services making use of various sources of telemetry data;
A sound understanding of networking concepts and the fundamentals of logging, metrics, tracing and alerting, preferably including know-how in common technologies like ELK stack, Prometheus, Grafana, OpsGenie, Jaeger;
Confidently finding your way around public cloud providers, including managed kubernetes services and microservices implementations;
Automating stuff using Go and/or Python and building cloud infrastructure using terraform;
Deploying and supporting microservices using automated pipelines and tools like ArgoCD.
Your colleagues would say
You understand Agile methodologies inside out and embrace change rather than shunning it.
You’re able to balance hands-on contribution to the goals of the team as an SME with being a thought leader in the organization setting up the standards and communicating it to the greater organization.
You thrive in a curious environment where openness is the norm and all ideas are welcome so you can maximise your communication skills.
Mambu’s future

We are a diverse group of Mambuvians, and we are growing fast. Our eyes are on the future, and we believe we can use our technology and our talent to deliver banking experiences for billions that are also sustainable and inclusive and accessible.

Your future

We’re also focused on delivering a fantastic working experience for all Mambuvians. We pioneered the 4 day working week between June - August many years ago, and continue to innovate around how work should feel and how it should get done. Our Mambu Deal is how we articulate this relationship of support and dedication which drives us all forward.

To stay on top of the latest Fintech trends and our success stories, please follow us on LinkedIn .

To experience more of the Mambu culture in action, you can follow us on Facebook , Instagram or YouTube .

For more details regarding our global career opportunities, please visit our Career Site .

As part of the recruitment (or HR onboarding) process, you will be required to obtain authorized criminal background and credit screening results, as well as be queried against a sanctions/anti-money-laundering/counter terrorism financing/politically exposed persons screening service and your employment is conditional upon approval of these results.

tag

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many job seekers (including women, people of colour and people from diverse backgrounds) are reluctant to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.

Here at Mambu we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Backend Software Engineer (SRE/Storage and background jobs)
Description:
About the job
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 65+ million members in 16 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

We’re looking for a Backend Engineer to help evolve and scale an infrastructure that consists of more than ~1200 fat servers, in 3 Data Centers. As part of Vinted’s SRE team, you’ll work with us on network, databases, search clusters, and cache clusters for the fast-growing, new generation of Vinted. This presents great opportunities to grow as a professional and take on new responsibilities. If you think you’re up to the challenge – get in touch!

Here are some of the technologies we use: CentOS 7, Chef, Ruby, Rails, MySQL, Vitess, ElasticSearch, Ceph, Mcrouter, Memcached, Redis, Kafka, JVM, Go, Consul, Prometheus, Grafana, Thanos, Nginx, Jenkins, Docker, Datadog and Kubernetes.

This is a partly remote work opportunity, so you have the possibility to stay based in your city, and to only work in the Vilnius office 1 day per week (once the quarantine period has ended).

In this position you’ll be part of “Storage and background jobs” team:
Scale and improve:
Ceph-based images service to operate and store photos into multiregional storage clusters
Background jobs solutions (Sidekiq and Phobos)
Increasing number of Kafka clusters
KV stores (Memcached, Redis, Redis Cluster)
Several ElasticSearch clusters
Solve a range of performance issues in our platform
Contribute code to automate manual work and improve existing tools
Participate in an on-call rotation with the team every 5-8 weeks
About You
3+ years of hands on work experience in developing or operating at scale
A curious individual who wants to learn and master concepts and technologies we use
Familiarity with technologies in our stack
Previous experience of infrastructure management is a plus
Work Perks
Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)
25 working days of holiday
Remote workout classes
Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic
Private health insurance
A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices
Monthly team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
Private health insurance
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)
You’re welcome to work from either home or office, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 3457-8560 € (gross) per month.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Cloud Operations Engineer
Description:
About the job
Imagine being part of one of the most successful IT companies in Europe, helping customers in navigating the operational challenges of cloud computing. Turn imagination into reality and apply for this exiting career opportunity in CLOUDEON part of Devoteam.

Job Highlights:
Joining more than 8.000 talented colleagues around Europe
International career opportunity
Being a part of the Devoteam Microsoft pillar with more than 1.000 specialists
Cozy working environment in a heart of Vilnius
Work in shifts 24x7

Your Highlights?
You are highly interested in IT and Cloud Computing
You have a high level of professionalism while dealing with challenging work situations
You are an excellent team player and always ready to assist your colleagues
You are not a cloud expert but eager to learn with trainings and certifications that we’ll provide to you

Still with us? Then we might have a fantastic job opportunity for you!

OUR NEW CLOUD OPERATIONS ENGINEER

As a Cloud Operations Engineer you will operate and manage cloud platforms, will assist both internal and external customers, implement automated ITSM processes and focus on improving and providing significant additional value. You will closely work with Cloud Automation and Platform Engineering teams and will be responsible for proactive configuration changes, ensuring minimal operational disruptions delivered via infrastructure-as-code, Azure Pipelines, or direct configuration in the portal. In this role you will also be involved in release planning and Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) planning to provide feedback and prepare for operational requirements.

SOME OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Operating and maintaining cloud platforms
Performing monitoring of systems for errors, failures and capacity issues
Detecting, solving and escalating incidents to appropriate support teams
Performing patching
Initiating the Incident Management process and coordinating Major Incidents as well as carrying out the other ITSM processes
Establishing and updating documentation and procedures

SOME OF OUR REQUIREMENTS:
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written, as well as fluent in English
Open and collaborative with strong focus on client and/or customer service experience
Problem solving and troubleshooting
ITIL knowledge
Ability and willingness to work in 24x7 shifts

It would be awesome, if you have:
Understanding of cloud computing technologies and knowing at least one of cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP)
A foundation in system administration (Windows and/or Linux), including performing backups, upgrades and patching
Understanding of IT infrastructure topology, including public and private cloud, networking, virtualization, identity, security and storage
Experience in a similar role

WHAT YOU CAN LOOK FORWARD TO:
Becoming a part of very specialized team who will support your ability to succeed
A challenging and exciting career with an international perspective and opportunities
Attractive compensation package with a mix of fixed and variable
High level of trust and competency to make your own decisions
A warm and talented culture with a focus on business, but knowing that family always comes first
Access to international network of specialists within the organization to build your rep and skills
Salary range: 1800 - 3000 EUR gross (depending on the experience and competencies)

At CLOUDEON-part of Devoteam we have created a culture of honesty and transparency, inclusion, and cooperation which we value a lot. We are looking for colleagues, who are highly motivated and proactive, not afraid of challenges. We are highly invested in the career path development of our employees, and we offer and support possibilities for further training, licensing, and specialization.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description:
About the job
My name is Mindaugas Krokas and I am leading Self-care Portals team in Telia. Right now, we are looking for a DevOps engineer to join our team. As a team member of this team, you will be part of development journey with a lot of exciting challenges ahead. We strive to create world-class digital solutions that exceed our customer’s expectations!

Your next challenge?

As DevOps engineer you will be working on scalable technical solutions to automate our engineering processes and implement business needs. You will be a part of a dynamic Agile team consisting of developers, UX designers and business representatives, with a clear goal to build digital solutions which improves customer experience and satisfaction. You will closely collaborate and work directly with architecture and development team professionals who specialize in scalable and complex systems.

As a DevOps engineer you will:
Work in international Agile team where collaboration is key to success
Design and build solutions which are robust and scalable
Build, enhance and improve CI/CD tools and processes
Implement automation for various engineering processes
Create and maintain proper technical documentation
Work closely with architects and developers to be able to align technical solution design.
Proactively collaborate with team members, ensuring the sharing of knowledge and coaching
Your skills:
Experience working with:
AWS and Terraform
Building CI/CD pipelines for applications and infrastructure
Docker, Kubernetes or similar
GitHub, Jenkins, GitHub Actions or similar
Good verbal and written communication skills with stakeholders and other delivery teams in English.
Personal characteristic:

As a person you are driven, positive and energetic with a solution-oriented mindset. You are analytical and structured, ambitious and proactive. You are a team-player sharing your own ideas and actively listening to others.

What will you find at our home?

We believe that people thrive in a purpose driven and values-oriented culture. Welcome to Telia the home to your next big opportunity. You will be part of an exciting journey to shape the New Generation Telco and we promise to help you grow, both professionally and personally. We believe in self-leadership where you take responsibility for expressing yourself and achieving great results. IT & telecommunications is not just our business, it's our passion. You will join a winning team, to work with talented people and help create ideas and solutions for efficient business and better lives.

Working in this position you will receive a base salary from 4546 Eur (gross). Plus, annual bonuses which vary, depending on your competencies and your and Telia results.

Besides for each employee Telia has additional employee benefits package which includes:
Health insurance and pension plan
Various Telia and partners discounts and offers
Additional vacation days
Flexibility that enables work-life balance
Chance to grow both personally and professionally with our internal programs
Open, relaxed and fun working environment
+19 000 awesome colleagues across Nordic & Baltics
Interested?

If you’re in for a fantastic opportunity – join my team!

If you want to know more please reach out me for more information mindaugas.krokas@telia.lt. We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline.

Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

Title: .NET Backend Developer
Software Engineer - Grafana Business Applications (Remote, EMEA)
Description:
About the job
This is a fully remote position (we’ve been remote even before the pandemic). We are looking for candidates in EMEA time zones.

Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, a popular open source tool for visualizing and analyzing metrics with its instantly recognizable dashboards. With both its open source technology and enterprise products, Grafana Labs allows organizations to understand their metrics no matter where they are stored, and create, explore, and share dashboards to foster a data-driven culture. Founded in 2014, Grafana Labs has grown rapidly ever since. We are believers in the power of global, distributed teams: Talent is not limited by borders, and great workplaces are made up of exceptional colleagues. We have aggressive growth plans and are an ambitious, hardworking, and friendly team.

We're looking for talented software engineers to join our Business Applications team, which is responsible for building and maintaining the internal systems that power Grafana Labs. The Business Applications team works together with our Cloud, Enterprise and Grafana teams to provide the best possible experience for our customers and most efficient workflow for our staff. We build on the grafana.com platform to provide custom solutions and integrate with the many external systems that make up a modern business environment.

What You’ll Be Working On

A normal “day in the life” could include working on functionality in our API, user and staff portals to launch or evolve a product offering, integrating a new 3rd-party tool into our stack, or working with the go-to-market team to improve our internal workflows.

Requirements
You have full-stack experience working across front-end and backend development
You have experience with Javascript/Typescript/NodeJS, React, Go or similar technologies
You work well within a team and you're driven to help others
You strive to be better at your craft!
You can drive your work independently, but you also know when to reach out for help
You care deeply about user experience and the quality of the products that you work on

Bonus Points
Familiarity with deploying & operating large-scale web applications in Kubernetes
Experience with Grafana, Prometheus, Graphite, or other time-series platforms
Open source projects and/or contributions
We understand that you may not have experience on all of the above technologies. Please do apply even if you do not match some of the above criteria.

At our core Grafana Labs is an open company. We believe that open source is the superior way to build and deliver software. We also believe in being open and transparent with our employees. We believe that transparency breeds trust and that trust is the foundation of great teamwork. We actively seek to break down silos, empower employees with information and allow people to “see the whole picture”. This transparency extends to our strategy, our financials, our successes and failures. We empower our team to make their own decisions and trust that they will try to do the right thing.

We are a remote first team. Our three founders are on three different continents and our team of 170+ global employees are based in 30+ different countries. Hiring remotely unlocks the broadest, most diverse, most talented pool of potential employees. It also means that we have built our culture around a flexible and autonomous work environment based on trust.

Equal Opportunity Employer- At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

A note about covid-19: All Grafanistas who wish to attend in-person events or travel for Grafana Labs must be fully-vaccinated.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

Title: Site Reliability Engineer in Data & Analytics at SEB in Vilnius
Description:
About the job
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?

What you will be doing

You will be part of our Data Platform Foundation team with the mission to provide a future-proof, reliable and efficient data platform for SEB. Together with your colleagues you will work with developing our large-scale data solutions, everything with security and automation in mind. You will have the opportunity to broaden your competence and will be given generous amount of time for your own ideas and projects.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data technologies.

As a Site Reliability Engineer you will be responsible for:

data storage
batch processing and operations
workflow automation and orchestration
hybrid cloud integration with GCP
monitoring
and much more!
Who we are looking for:

Someone with required skills:
A Master’s degree in Engineering or Science, or a Bachelor’s degree with some years of successful working experience.
Experience from working in Linux environments.
Programming and scripting skills ( e.g.bash , python)
An automation, DevOps, SRE mindset.
Collaboration skills and high sense of responsibility. We are working team based, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Nice-to-have

Experience from working with distributed computing (e.g. Spark)
Experience from working with distributed storage (e.g. HDFS, S3,Minio)
Version control systems (e.g. Git)
Database knowledge (e.g. SQL, NoSQL)
Well versed in matters of IT security
Experience from working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift)
Experience with monitoring, metrics and log management systems (e.g. Zabbix, Grafana, Prometheus, Splunk, ELK)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins
What we offer:

Challenging, cutting-edge work
Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
Extensive training and learning opportunities
Work-life balance
Deliver world-class service to customers

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

We are looking forward to your application by September 29th, 2022.

Monthly salary range for this position: 1900 - 4800 EUR (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate. Overall remuneration package consists of the salary together with other benefits.

Welcome to a community of tech-savvy and passionate employees from all corners of the world. SEB is in fact one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Together we future proof a world of financial flows by exploring and implementing modern digital architecture and state-of-the-art technology. We are driven by collaboration, insight, and friendship. But also, a desire to change and improve. All in all, it creates a balance - where life and a stable yet exciting job can co-exist. If you want to shape tomorrow's bank - continue reading and apply today.

Read more: sebgroup.com/techcareers

Title: Back-End Engineer (API) - Drive
Description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

The Proton Drive team is building new end-to-end encrypted online storage products to serve millions of customers worldwide. As a software engineer, you will solve complex technical and design challenges, and implement best practices in code quality and architecture to ensure reliable and fast customer experiences. You will develop systems designed to operate at internet scale, and partner with Product, Engineering, Security, and other members of your team to influence future direction of our products. You will make continuous investments in developing code quality, while ensuring fast feature delivery for your customers. Our stack is based on PHP + MySQL + Redis + Ceph. We develop using Docker and Kubernetes and you can use Linux MacOS or Windows.

What You Will Do

Work closely with a cross-functional team to design, build, test, and optimize Proton Drive for Web, mobile, and desktop clients
Develop high-quality customer experiences
Write readable, maintainable, tested, and well-documented code
Ensure that acceptance criteria and all parts of the technical design are correctly incorporated
Follow and promote engineering best practices
Take part in team activities, such as sprint ceremonies, code reviews, and pair programming
Share your unique knowledge and skills with the rest of the team
Experience with PHP or other languages
Familiarity with SQL
Experience working with a team and using source control tools
Understanding of web technologies (REST API, HTTP)

Bonus points for

Having a user-experience-first mindset
Understanding of security best practices from an application development standpoint
Experience using DevOps processes and practices (including CI/CD)
Experience with performance
Experience with Symfony or various backend frameworks and software architecture concepts (layers, single responsibility principle, etc)

Why you should join Proton

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us.

Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.

Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits - These vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. You will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the protonmail.recruitee.com domain as part of the recruitment process.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation where Proton employs the relevant candidate.

By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

Title: Software Engineer III
Description:
About the job
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

Job Description Summary

The Software Engineer-III solves current customer issues, troubleshoots, and debugs and fixes current software programs. Works with the customer support team, Level 3 teams and customers to quickly resolve customer issues. May also develop software tools including operating systems functions and performance monitors.

Position Reports to: Manager, Software Engineering

Job Overview

The Software Engineer-III designs, develops, troubleshoots, and debugs software programs for software enhancements and new products. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, and Internet-related tools. Determines software’s compatibility with hardware and/or influences software's design in relation to hardware.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Taking ownership of customer issues and seeing problems through to resolution.
Researching, diagnosing, troubleshooting and identifying solutions to resolve customer product defect or configuration issues.
Work with customers, customer support and Level 3 team members via their preferred communication channel(s): phone, email or chat, until they’ve solve a technical issue.
Document technical knowledge in strategic content repositories
Prioritize and manage several open issues at one time.
Ensure all issues, analysis, and customer communications are properly logged.
Collaborate on customer situations/escalations as required.
Perform with limited direction, problem verification by confirming a customer’s environment, error messages, and symptoms of a problem.
Preparing, recommending, and guiding the customer through implementing solutions.
Mastery of creating case tracking details for use by team members for similar/future problem resolution
Self-directed learning to expand expertise of Rocket Software products
Able to document and transfer customer files and correspondence timely and accurately
Able to troubleshoot common problems and configuration issues
Use testing tools, tracing and dumps for troubleshooting
Gather and analyze information to develop reproducible cases
Act as a point of escalation in the preparation, recommendation, and implementation of solutions
Provide input on designs for software enhancements and new products.
Ability to read zOS dumps and find software issues causing customers to open cases
Ability to identify the presence of code problems & bring to attention to other Level 3 engineers for resolution.
Focused on working to debug current customer issues in a timely manner.
Research complex software defect cases for resolution using knowledge bases, documentation etc
Work under limited direction of a manager and/or team lead to discover defects
Required Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of software engineering experience.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Able to present a track record of software development in the real world.
Mastery of one or more programming languages.
Excellent debugging and code designing skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Writes code faster than the average developer.
Outstanding quality with few bugs in generated code.
Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent.

Travel Requirements

0-10%
Job Family Group: Engineering
Job Family: Software & Quality Assurance Engineering
Job Profile Name: Software Engineer III
Employee Type: Individual Contributor
Job Level: P3 (Career)
Rocket Software Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Rocket Software Inc. is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Rocket is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please call: 781-577-4321 or send an email to people@rocketsoftware.com. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Title: Flutter Developer
Description:
About the job
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Flutter Developer to join a greenfield project and build a mobile-first personal time management product. We are looking for a team player who enjoys owning what they build, feels comfortable working in a small team and would be excited to build out a stunningly beautiful and life-changing mobile application.

About the role:
As life gets busier and more hectic, we tend to take for granted one of the most precious elements of life -Time. Time is something that we tend to spend and throw away. Yet, it is something that we can never get back and we only have a finite amount to work with.
The application we are building will remind people that time is important. It will allow users to focus on the things that are important and give an idea of where this precious currency called time is being spent. You may think of it as a time management assistant, that allows you to focus on goals, helps understand where time is spent, detects trends and patterns in your behaviour, provides a holistic view of your life, and help you be appreciative of what you have.

As a Flutter developer, you will:
Develop cross-platform applications from scratch
Be responsible for the technical deliverables and front-end related architectural decisions
Collaborate with the rest of the team to come up with the best outcomes for the product and its users

We expect you to:
Have a proven practical experience with cross-platform development using Flutter
Have solid experience in mobile development
Be transparent, good communicator, hands-on and an eager team player
Have very good spoken and written English skills

Salary
Gross salary from 4500 EUR based on skills and experience.

Location
Work from anywhere - see you online. We have offices in old-town Vilnius when you need or feel like coming in.

What about perks?
Outgrow your role. Join other initiatives. Build your skills and test your strengths.
Learn. All the time. Would you like to attend conferences or take paid training? There is a budget for that.
We will not let you become obsolete. But whatever you do - give it your best.
Pitch your ideas about anything. We build startups! Let’s build yours together.
Work hard, play hard. Adrenaline junkie or zen. Or a casual all-nighter in the city.
Take time off. Even if you don't - still do. Don’t feel bad about taking a day with a same-day notice. We have all been there. Just be respectful of your responsibilities and to your team.
Additional health insurance. Take care of yourself. It just makes sense.

About Us
We build cool stuff and have fun doing it. Adroiti is a stack-agnostic technology incubator company. Founded a decade ago, we wondered a lot, built a lot, and learned a lot. We are a diverse group of 50+ engineers, artists, facilitators, avatars and entrepreneurs, empowered by technology. We aim to build disruptive, meaningful, and incremental innovations. We are informal, and we relish adaptive work culture.

Title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer @ KAYAK Hotels
Software Developer (full stack)
Description:
About the job
Job Posting End Date:

--

Xirgo Global provides a full range of global IoT telematics products and software. The company values clean code, good practices, co-creating, caring, and thinking outside the box, to make software scalable. They are working in Agile teams. Some of the technologies being used: Docker, Kubernetes, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Azure, .NET Core, Angular, RabbitMQ.

Xirgo Global company has become a part of Sensata Technologies since April 2021, which is a global industrial technology company and a leading provider of sensor-rich solutions that create insights for customers with operations in 13 countries, including China, Japan, Korea.

Being one of the most important R&D departments, Xirgo Global is looking for a FULL-STACK SOFTWARE DEVELOPER DEVELOPER to join their team in Kaunas.

IN THIS POSITION YOU WILL
Be a part of the product team
Design and develop new features using latest .NET Core stack
Design product around microservices architecture
Manage cloud infrastructure using infrastructure as code (IaC)
Monitor services using Grafana/Kibana
Be able to influence what technologies to use
Be a part of all software development phases including collaborating with product engineers, managers, owners about developing new features, improving performance, scalability, and integrations
Work in agile environment, continuous integration, continuous deployment and writing automated integration tests

APPLY IF
You are a team player and have good communication skills, that are necessary when discussing with other team members about difficult topics
You are willing to learn new technologies and principles
You take the full ownership for your code and are open to receive constructive feedback about it
You have at least 4 years’ experience with C#/.NET
Knowledge of Angular2+ would be a plus
Good English language skills

Company Offers
A team of professionals, who are ready to lead you during on-boarding process, share their knowledge and help to solve problems
Salary starting from 3300 EUR to 5800 Gross per month, depending on your level of experience
Conference budget for self-improvement
Team building events

SmarterTogether
Collaborating at Sensata means working with some of the world’s most talented people in an enriching environment that is constantly pushing towards the next best thing
Employees work across functions, countries and cultures gaining new perspectives through mutual respect and open communication
As OneSensata, we are working together to make things work together

Click here to view Sensata Recruitment Privacy Statement

NOTE: If you are a current Sensata employee (or one of our Affiliates), please back out of this application and log into Workday via the Company Intranet to apply directly. Type "FIND JOBS" in the Workday search bar.

Title: Data analyst
Description:

At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. As an employee you will be part of the Group performance program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. "Join our team and...

be a part of an international team of professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage."
