Be a technical and organizational expert to peers as well as management
Lead the design of solutions within your team
Mentor teammates
Initiate and champion new technologies and development processes

We Expect That You

Have at least 5 years of experience crafting high quality solutions in professional environments
Are fluent in English as we have colleagues from around the world
Are comfortable in applying advanced frontend engineering principles and practicing automated testing

Our stack

We don’t expect you to know our entire stack. Of course, the greater the overlap the better.

Typescript is the default for frontend applications with libraries such as React, Redux, Material UI, GraphQL
We use Python extensively (and Node.js in some cases) for our backend services. Using frameworks such as Django, Flask, GraphQL and Express
We’re quality-conscious and do a lot of automated testing leveraging tools like Cypress, Postman/Newman, K6, pytest, jest and others
CI is the glue between devs and ops. To make full use of it, we also have Terraform and GitLab CI in our toolbelt. Our infrastructure lives in the AWS cloud

Why Revel?

We are a product company: we influence product development decisions and create tools for driving foodservice businesses to success
We have a unique cultural environment: supportive leadership, Agile values, feedback culture, recognition of professional accomplishments
We care about technology and quality: our tech initiatives are bottom-up, teams organize guilds and cross-site meetups
We care about our employees: health insurance is provided for every member of our team
We invest in personal development: annual conference budget, 10% of working time dedicated to learning, Udemy license
We share our success: Profit Sharing Plan for employees
We work flexible hours: you are in control of your working schedule

Revel Systems

Revel Systems powers the ambitions of thousands of restaurants and retailers across the US and Europe with a robust cloud-based point of sale (POS) and enterprise management system. Analytics and BI engineers at Revel are building a modern data pipeline that drives intuitive analytics and surfaces powerful insights. Founded in 2010 with major offices in Atlanta, Vilnius, and San Francisco, Revel is a leading member of the Apple Enterprise Mobility Program.

Salary

Salary ranges from 4800.00 to 6300.00 € gross

Our values

Quality in everything we do. We ensure quality with a range of tools and techniques. These include code reviews, peer programming, CI pipelines and tests. We write robust automated tests for every piece of code we craft using appropriate combinations of unit, integration, performance tests, etc. We release code using automated pipelines that support continuous delivery. We are always working to evolve these processes.
Be the change you want to see. As part of the teams leading the change in Revel, you will continuously get a chance to innovate on the codebase and make a difference in the engineering department by evolving the way we work.
Continuous personal growth. Be challenged and motivated by Revel’s talented, yet friendly engineers who will push you to new levels of professionalism. You’ll have access to both technical and leadership career opportunities across Revel’s expansive suite of products. The next challenge is always just around the corner.
Communicate boldly. We enter conversations with clearly and strongly stated opinions, but eagerly listen and learn from our teammates. Your voice will be heard in our self organizing, team led structure.
Agile as a mindset. Scrum as a framework. We promote an agile mindset by using the scrum framework to let teams self organize and own their work. We always adapt each to our team and project.
Work as a team. We foster and develop new hires at all levels of experience, thereby accelerating their onboarding and helping launch their careers at Revel.

By Applying For a Job Position And Submitting Your Personal Data, You Confirm That You Have Read And Accept Revel Systems’ Applicant Privacy Notice

https://cdn.revelsystems.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/13162216/Applicant-Privacy-Notice-Revel-Systems.pdf

Title: Senior React Developer with relocation to Romania
Description:
About the job
THIS JOB REQUIRES RELOCATION TO ROMANIA

Project Description:

Join our Development Center in Romania, and become a member of our open-minded, progressive, and professional team. In this role you will be working on projects for one our world-famous clients.
We are using a microservice-based, API-driven software architecture built on Spring Boot and Java 11, with React in the front-end. We are using Docker, Kubernetes and OpenShift for deployment on-premise and migrating to Google Cloud (GCP). We automate build and deployment with TeamCity, GitHub Actions, Terraform and Helm. We put special focus on Domain-Driven Design, Design Patterns, Clean Code, automated testing, and Cloud focused Architecture.
On top of attractive salary and benefits package, Luxoft will invest into your professional training and allow you to grow your professional career.

Responsibilities:

Be part of a globally distributed team working on multiple concurrent projects as a Senior Front End Developer.
- Contribute to building a shared platform architecture and code base across Fintech Enablement applications allowing quicker time to market of new solutions.
- Closely collaborate with Full stack Java developers on both greenfield and existing applications within a cloud based high availability architecture.
- Assist in the adoption of modern engineering practices and design principles across the Fintech Enablement team.
- Partner with QA and test managers to ensure quality solutions are delivered to end users
- Provide Level 3 support

Mandatory Skills Description:

• Experience with Java / Kotlin is a plus
• Basic knowledge of SQL
• Basic knowledge of Linux
• Experience in cloud based, distributed, highly available and fault tolerant applications.
• Experience with Redux and TypeScript
• Some experience in the finance industry and an understanding of finance industry products and business processes would be beneficial.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Success Factors for Engineers in CB Tech
• Someone who sets the standard for excellence in their role as an engineer
• Talented individuals who are creative, innovative, and passionate about doing exciting and important work
• People who make wise decisions, despite ambiguity, be it people, technical, business, other
• People who treat others with respect at all times, independent of their status
• An engineer who considers quality as a priority, and think about the client whilst developing for our future
• High-value persons who have a desire make an impact
• Individuals who have a desire of self-improvement through experience, observation, introspection, reading and discussion
• Individuals who accomplish amazing amounts of important work
• Someone who seeks to understand our strategy, our business, the market and our clients
• A person who challenges assumptions when warranted and makes suggestions for better approaches

Languages:

English: B1 Intermediate

Title: Senior JavaScript Developer
Description:
About the job

Description

We are seeking a passionate and talented Senior JavaScript Developer eager and ready for challenges. We use Agile methodologies on the majority of our projects and encourage close communication among all the involved parties.

We are working with the leading companies on the market. Our projects cover different domains including: Banking & Finance, Media & Entertainment, Software development & Design, Life science & Healthcare, E-Commerce and more.

Lead the development process
Write unit tests
Maintain code quality and develop CI processes

Maintain the existing code

Communicate with the customer

ReactJS
Polymer
Redux
RxJS
Electron, Cordova, React Native

Technical background

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
About Pagoda

Pagoda is the first-ever Web3 Startup Platform where developers and entrepreneurs can build, launch, and operate new blockchain-based products and services. As a primary builder of the NEAR Protocol, Pagoda delivers capacity, velocity, simplicity, and affordability needed to power tomorrow’s Web3 startups.

We are looking for an innovative, empathetic, and productive person who is excited about building the next generation of crypto startups, feels comfortable challenging opinions, and most importantly who shares with us the same desire to make the web free again.
We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. Pagoda is committed to creating an inclusive culture, and we celebrate diversity of all kinds.

What You’ll Get For Joining:

Unlimited Annual Leave / PTO
$2,000 Yearly Continued Education Reimbursement
$2,000 Home Office Setup Reimbursement
Yearly Company Retreats (2021’s was in Lisbon!)
Paid Holiday Week: the last week of the year
Paid Summer Wellness Week: the first week of July
Mental Health Support and access to licensed therapists through Spill, 100% paid by us

About The Role:

The Pagoda Data Platform team is looking for a Data Engineer to build and scale our data infrastructure to empower our core products and product analytics.

What You'll Be Doing:

Architect and manage data lakes and data marts needed to provide product analytics insights to product teams and executives (BigQuery, DataBricks);
Create and manage data pipelines for both on-chain (NEAR) and off-chain (OLTP databases, http logs, UI analytics) data;
Automate data quality monitoring and alerting tools;
Optimize time to insight and work with Data Scientist to create data marts for various data products;
Creating data extraction tools using Python, JavaScript, SQL, and Rust;
Collaborate with internal and external engineers and product managers.

What We're Looking For:

Experience building and managing data lakes aggregating dozens of data sources and providing insights to multiple different stakeholders based on terabytes of data;
Experience in GCP and/or AWS data infrastructure products;
Fluency in writing complex analytical SQL queries;
Strong communication and remote friendly working skills;
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or related field is a must.

We'd Love If You Have:

Deep understanding of DataBricks and BigQuery technologies;
Knowledge of product analytics tools such as Segment, FullStory, MixPanel or Amplitude;
Familiarity with crypto or blockchain technologies;
Experience working at a startup.

Here’s What Our Interview Process Looks Like:

Depending on calendar availability, from the first stage to the final stage, we do our best to keep the entire process to under three weeks. Our interviews take place via Zoom and typically consists of the following stages:

Internal Recruiter Call (30 to 45 minutes)
Meet with the Hiring Manager (30-60 minutes)
Technical & Leadership Interviews (4 x 60 minutes)
Culture & Values Interview (30 to 45 minutes)

Please let us know if you require any special requirements for your interview and we’ll do our best to accommodate.

Location: North America, Europe, Africa

Our Values at Pagoda

Innovate and deliver—so our customers can build. We deliver new solutions for real, often urgent, customer needs. Practical over hype. We uphold our standards of excellence while balancing velocity and pragmatism.

Focus precious time and energy on what matters. We are intentional about where we aim our resources. We channel our talents to focus on the critical missions in order to make an outsized impact.

Favor ownership, agency and action. Everyone is an owner. As individuals, we are responsible and accountable for our work. We empower builders to make decisions and innovate without the burden of unnecessary roadblocks or complexity.

Work as a team of empathetic humans. We practice mutual respect, open communication, humility and collaboration. We are kind and empathetic. We are welcoming towards diversity in all forms, including differences of perspective.

Never break trust. Integrity is rare—and valuable—in this space. Reputation is hard to build and easy to break.

Title: Data Analyst (ONLINE) - Hungarian
Description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance Hungarian speaking Online Data Analyst for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Fluency in English and Hungarian
You must be living in Hungary for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Hungary
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss


WHAT'S NEXT?

Please follow the steps below on how to apply for the project:

1. Create an account here: https://www.telusinternational.ai/cmp/contributor/jobs/available/279

2. Click "Sign Up" and answer the necessary fields.

3. Check your email inbox to confirm your email and set up your password and account.

4. Select HU (HUNGARY) as your country and HUNGARIAN as your primary language. Please note that you must set up your country and primary language correctly in order to view this project.

Once you complete the registration process, click the "Apply" button to start your application process for the project.

Title: Lead Frontend Developer for Global Design system
Description:
About the job
Hi, my name is Svetla Tomova, I’m leading the Design System team in Shared Engagement Services unit. I am looking for a strong Lead Front-End Developer to join our team.

Your next challenge?

You will be developing the Global Design System for Telia with international team members from Nordic countries. The team is just entering the implementation phase with lots of interesting challenges and opportunities on our way. We expect the use of our Design system to grow and become an essential tool for every engineering team at Telia Company. It's a great time to join the Core team and build a strong foundation to go forward.

Job Responsibilities:
Development of web components using StencilJS.
Solution architecture.
Review code and mentor more junior colleagues, to help them acquire more technical knowledge. Collaboration via coding. Pair coding. Expand the knowledge in the team.
Communicate with many different teams trying to set common ground and attract/help more teams to start using the Global Design System.
Solve complicated business cases with assistance from experienced architects.
Work one step ahead of the team so work is done in the right direction.
Ensure teams follow code review process and documentation.
Outlining ideas, tools and practices for improving the development process.
Background & Skills:
Passion and relevant experience in modern technologies i.e., JavaScript, TypeScript.
Relevant experience with Web Components, StencilJs and Storybook.
Relevant experience with JavaScript bundlers i.e., Webpack, Rollup, TypeScript compiler, and bundle outputs like ES modules, commonjs, etc.
Good understanding of Functional Programming, Object-oriented programming.
Experience in agile development methods and practices, i.e., Scrum/
Experience building and maintaining large-scale projects.
Skills in writing styles with pre-processors and methodologies (SCSS and BEM preferably, but not necessary).
Experience working with component libraries i.e., Design Systems.
Good understanding of Design approach, customer experience, and accessibility standards.
Good practices with testing and test automation.
Experience with DevOps and CI/CD pipelines.
AWS knowledge. Infrastructure.
Who are you?
Forward-thinking.
Team player.
Fluent English speaker and a good communicator.
Business-minded.
Problem solver.
Proactive.
What will you find at our home?

We believe that people thrive in a purpose-driven and values-oriented culture. Welcome to Telia, the home of your next big opportunity. You will be part of an exciting journey to shape the New Generation Telco and we promise to help you grow, both professionally and personally. We believe in self-leadership where you take responsibility for expressing yourself and achieving great results. IT & telecommunications is not just our business, it’s our passion. You will join a winning team, work with talented people and help create ideas and solutions for efficient business and better lives.

Working in this position you will receive a base salary within the range of 4500 - 6500 EUR Gross (this is a reference range; the exact salary will depend on your competencies). Also, annual bonuses which vary, depending on your competencies as well as Telia's results. Besides, each employee at Telia has an additional employee benefits package which includes:
Health insurance and pension plan.
Various Telia and our partners’ discounts and offers.
Additional vacation days.
Workation.
The flexibility that enables work-life balance.
Chance to grow both personally and professionally with our internal programs.
Open, relaxed, and fun working environment.
20 000 awesome colleagues across Nordic & Baltics.
Interested?

If you fancy joining our team – we are waiting for your CV! If you need more information about this role – do not hesitate to contact Svetla Tomova on LinkedIn.

In the last steps, required controls will be performed.

Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!

Title: Software Engineer, Full-Stack JavaScript
Description:
About the job
JUVARE is a technology company focused on developing innovative enterprise resilience solutions for government agencies, corporations, healthcare providers and higher education around the world. JUVARE solutions have supported over 500,000 emergency response incidents in all 50 states and 20 countries around the world. JUVARE helps our clients prepare, connect, and respond to protect people, property, and brands.

Software Engineer, Full-Stack JavaScript is responsible for the design, implementation and support of market leading applications used before, during and after emergency management situations.

You will be part of a team that practices a disciplined development methodology and will interact directly with our Product Management, Client Experience, Infrastructure and Support Teams to develop effective, reliable, and scalable solutions in an Agile, test-driven environment. We are looking for a self-directed individual who functions well in a team environment. You should have a passion for working with stakeholders to solve their business and support challenges.

Technologies include (but are not limited to): REST/Web Services, AJAX, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, MaterialUI.

Location: Kaunas, Lithuania

Reports to: Manager, Software Engineering

Responsibilities:

Develop Frontend part of applications using JavaScript, TypeScript and React.
Develop Backend part of applications using TypeScript.
Develop high quality code and automated tests.
Develop collaborative relationships with team members.
Do code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
Evaluate newly emerging technologies and participate in business decisions regarding technologies to implement.
Implement Proof of Concepts to objectively evaluate possible solutions.
Troubleshoot escalated client support issues.
Follow OWASP and other security best practices to develop reliable solutions.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
3+ years of technical software development experience with a minimum of 2 years in Frontend development.

Skills/Knowledge Requirements:

Object Oriented Analysis, Design, Programming methodologies, data structures and design patterns.
Experience in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience with TypeScript.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks, preferably React.
Able to write effective unit and E2E tests.
Able to troubleshoot problems by reviewing logs and debugging.
Experience with cross-cutting concerns such as security and performance.
Strong attention to detail, personal initiative, and commitment to quality.
Easily and quickly absorb and implement new technologies and procedures.
Attention to details, personal initiative, and commitment to quality.

What we offer:

Work on products that help the heroes fighting on the front lines of the emergency management situations (COVID-19 outbreak, Hurricanes, active shooters, etc).
Unlimited paid vacation time.
Remote work opportunities.
Medical Insurance.
Anything you need for your continuous professional development (Pluralsight license, company paid certificates and etc.).
Employee Referral Program.
Juvare Book Club.
Parking and Locked Bicycle Storage.

Gross salary from 3500 euro/month and above (depends on your experience).

Juvare is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.

CCPA disclosure notice and Juvare privacy policy: https://www.juvare.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
Description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Key Areas of Focus:

In this role, you’ll get to:

Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.

Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.

Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.

Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers

Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.

Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.

Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Minimum of 3-5 years of total experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work
Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders

It’s Great if you have:

Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn
Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus

Title: Senior Data Engineer / Data Architect
Description:
About the job
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

The Role

To empower scientists and radically improve how science is published, evaluated and disseminated to researchers, innovators and the public, we have built our own state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence Review Assistant (AIRA). Data is at the heart of AIRA in the form of AIRA Knowledge – a rich graph of academic knowledge such as scientific publications, citation relationships between those publications, as well as authors, institutions and fields of research. This serves as the basis of all the AI/ML models used by our reviewer recommendation service and our quality checks.

Additionally, we have created a Cloud Data Warehouse, that allows integrating information coming from our editorial platform and external sources from the publishing industry to calculate real-time insights and feed cutting-edge machine learning algorithms.

We are now looking for a passionate Senior Data Engineer / Data Architect to join our growing team and help us evolve AIRA Knowledge and our Cloud Data Warehouse.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for optimising or even re-designing AIRA Knowledge’s data architecture to support our next generation of product features and data initiatives. You will be expanding and optimising our data pipeline architecture, as well as optimising data flow and collection for AIRA.

You will support the teams to implement solutions, pipelines, and integrations over our Cloud Data Warehouse.

The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimising existing data systems or building them from the ground up. You will work together with other data engineers, software developers, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

Tech Stack & Key Requirements:
Proven experience as a Data Engineer
Databricks (Python & Spark or PySpark)
Experience with ETLs/ELT
Experience with Data Modelling
Understanding of big data principles and ability to implement these (volume, velocity, variety, veracity and value)
Expertise in data processing
Ability to prioritise
Familiarity with Agile framework
Good English skills

Nice to have
Experience with a Cloud Platform (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Experience with a workflow engine (e.g. Data Factory, Airflow)

Your Main responsibilities:
Work closely with IT Architects to provide overall consistent and reliable data solutions for all the applications’ ecosystem
Design, implement, monitor, and optimize our data platforms to meet the data pipeline needs
Understand the functional requirements for defining the best data models and data flows between our applications, services, data storage and synchronization mechanisms
Integrate, transform, and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems into structures that are suitable for building analytics solutions
Support the different SW development teams in the modelling, design, construction, evolution, and decommission of their data-intensive applications and data models
Understand and promote the best Data frameworks and solutions, technical standards and key technologies, to effectively support existing and future business requirements
Collaborate closely with Machine Learning and Data Science Team to improve the performance of our ML pipelines

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

At Toptal, we measure everything and always rely on data to guide all of our initiatives, including both our long-term strategy and our day-to-day operations.

As a Senior Data Engineer, your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have a significant impact on our velocity. We, in turn, will give you autonomy and freedom to turn your ideas into reality.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Build scalable, highly performant infrastructure for delivering clear business insights from a variety of raw data sources.
Develop batch & real-time analytical solutions, prototypes, and proofs of concept for selected solutions.
Build frameworks and tools to empower our data scientists and analysts.
Implement complex analytical projects with a focus on collecting, managing, analyzing, and visualizing data.
Be in constant communication with team members and other relevant parties and convey results efficiently and clearly.
In The First Week, Expect To
Meet mentors that will help you during your onboarding month.
Start participating in company-wide training sessions.
Setup your local environment and become familiar with our tech stack.
In The First Month, Expect To
Build your first Pull Request and have it deployed to production.
Learn about the technology that powers Toptal - the services, patterns, and libraries we use and develop.
Have a good understanding of Toptal’s business.
Develop a deeper understanding of our technology, processes, and product pipeline.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Have strong knowledge of Toptal’s business.
Actively supply software planning, development, and maintenance.
Be ready to propose and implement improvements to Toptal’s processes and codebase.
Deliver value in a regular cadence.
Get comfortable in your daily work within your team.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Lead technical initiatives on our team.
Drive improvements to the codebase and processes.
Contribute to planning and executing multi-sprint initiatives inside your team.
Be able to not only solve complex problems, but also consider multiple solutions, weigh them and decide on the best course of action.
Proactively identify technical debt and product areas that require attention or improvements and suggest improvements in our technology stack.
In The First Year, Expect To
Have a detailed understanding of Toptal’s business, collaboration rituals, processes, performance, and future work.
Determine what your career path looks like at Toptal.
Mentor Toptal’s new team members.
Meet your team in person during an off-site.
Give and receive 360 feedback in a yearly review cycle.
Requirements
Working experience with Python and Pandas.
Experience with SQL.
Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling.
Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns, including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures.
Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus.
Working experience with Scala is a plus.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus.
Working experience with Dimensional Modeling.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Be excited about collaborating daily with your team and other groups while working via a distributed model.
Be eager to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
Be open to receiving constructive feedback.
You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
For Toptal Use Only: #individualcontributoreurope #individualcontributorSA

Title: Data Analyst(Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
2+ years’ experience in top-tier management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or strategy/business operations for a fast-growing globally operating tech company
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Title: Technical Data Analyst (VAG)
Description:
About the job
Voltas IT – innovative technology company operating worldwide, creators of professional diagnostic software – OBDeleven. Distributed in 21 country OBDeleven is rapidly gaining popularity among automotive enthusiasts. Endless software possibilities lead us towards the goal – to become number one in intelligent automotive diagnostics. Together we can do more and your contribution is very important to us.

Before going through the requirements and responsibilities of a Technical Data Analyst, there are a few in-house terms we want to share with you in order to understand - what this role is all about.

Who is Technical Data Analyst that belongs to OCA’s team @Voltas IT:

Our OCA team consists of skilled engineers with strong technical automotive background who conduct relevant market research, develop One-Click Apps (further OCAs), provides technical support to our companies’ specialist teams, moderators, and customers.

What is the One-click application:

One-Click Apps are pre-coded adaptations that will allow our consumers to change or adjust vehicle settings and functions using the mobile app in just one click without having extensive automotive knowledge. Or as we like to say we made the coding for them.

How it is made:

Our OCA team members search for possibilities or gather our community requests for the needed features activations in the cars, making them into applications, and testing them on particular vehicles.

Your responsibilities in the role as a Technical Data Analyst will include:
Monitoring of One-Click Apps (OCA's)
Analyzing vehicles control units for OCA's creation
Searching, copying, and adapting existing OCA's for different car models
Developing and testing of new OCA's
Maintenance of OCA builder - suggestions for improvements
Connecting vehicle control units for car simulation

Requirements
Technical knowledge of automotive engineering (ability to explain car components principles of operation; principles of vehicle control units communication, etc.)
At least minimal VAG car coding experience and ability to code the car control units (long codings, codings, adaptations etc.)
Understanding of car diagnostic tools possibilities
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in a technical field (electronics, automotive or related) If your degree is from a different field - your application is also proper. But we must receive arguments that you have some knowledge/practice regarding car electronics or automotive diagnostic solutions
Ability to work in a team as well as find solutions independently
Attention to details with excellent follow-up practices
Good knowledge of English and fluency in Lithuanian;
Some knowledge of German would be an advantage

Benefits
Involvement in the development process of a global brand
Transparent remuneration system and stock options
Opportunities for personal and professional development with a yearly training budget included
Annual performance reviews and bonuses
Flexible working hours and remote work opportunities (possibility to work remotely for up to 183 days per year abroad)
A modern office based in a heart of Kaunas
Private health insurance
One paid Self-learning day and a sick day per month
Team building events
Stocked kitchen & each Friday lunch out of the office
Gross salary in a range: 1569 - 2279 € /month (depends on your experience)

Still having doubts? Learn more about:
our product. OBDeleven – an innovative automotive diagnostic software, operating via small Bluetooth device helps daily drivers to customize their vehicles via mobile application. is officially licensed by Volkswagen AG and BMW, and honoured by two international design awards. 2,3 Million vehicles are already connected to OBDeleven.
our company. Voltas IT is the first Lithuanian company announced a winner among the fastest growing technology company in Central Europe in 2019. It is awarded "For Innovations" in Kaunas District Business in 2020. Company is a member of AAAA (Australian Aftermarket Automotive Association, Equipment and Tool institute; Kaunas Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Crafts; Lithuania Diversity Charter and a partner of Kaunas University of Technology.

Here at Voltas IT we feel the vibe, take ownership, never stop learning, enjoy teamwork, being ambituous and smart. If our company‘s culture maches your values let‘s join forces and prove that on a scale of 10 we are ready to go for 11!

Confidentiality guaranteed. Only selected candidates will be informed.

Title: Freelance Researcher (Hungarian)
Description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance Hungarian speaking Online Data Analyst for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Fluency in English and Hungarian
You must be living in Hungary for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Hungary
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss


WHAT'S NEXT?

Please follow the steps below on how to apply for the project:

1. Create an account here: https://www.telusinternational.ai/cmp/contributor/jobs/available/279

2. Click "Sign Up" and answer the necessary fields.

3. Check your email inbox to confirm your email and set up your password and account.

4. Select HU (HUNGARY) as your country and HUNGARIAN as your primary language. Please note that you must set up your country and primary language correctly in order to view this project.

Once you complete the registration process, click the "Apply" button to start your application process for the project.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
Thousands of design teams use Sketch to transform their ideas into incredible products. Would you like to help build and scale the original disruptor in digital design? We’re looking for a Data Lead to take our team to the next level.

Your Role At Sketch:

Sketch is a high-velocity, low-touch, product-led company. At our core, we believe the best products sell themselves. In order for us to wisely and respectfully target new opportunities, we rely on data. That’s where you come in.
You’ll work as a data evangelist within Sketch; working across business and technical functions to help everyone capture, store, access, and analyze hard data.
As the Data Lead at Sketch, you’ll be responsible for data governance across teams, the infrastructure that internal tools and analytics utilize, and new data capture across marketing, sales, and product.

About Sketch:

We’re a company of diverse thinkers and doers who take pride in always improving our product. We share a vision and commitment to help each other — and our customers — create great work.
We’ve been fully remote since day one. It’s meant we can bring together incredible people from around the world. You’ll join coworkers based everywhere from Scotland to South Africa, and Australia to the US.
We encourage our people to be themselves and embrace what makes us unique. We value different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and we strongly believe this is key to achieving outstanding results.
We work asynchronously as much as we can. Our team communicates mostly in writing, using Slack and GitHub. When we need it, we also have video calls. We have a culture of collaboration and knowledge-sharing, and we provide the environment and the tools you need to do your best work.

What you’ll be doing:
Engaging with department leaders and internal stakeholders to identify and solve problems (including our Founders, COO, CTO, and heads of Infrastructure, Sales, and Marketing).
Serving as a subject matter expert for data and coordinating projects as a bridge between business and technical teams.
Providing vision and strategy for all data management activities.
Overseeing the development, management, and monitoring of data pipelines and associated curated data sources.
Conceptualizing, building, and managing a data warehousing strategy with clean, consistent, and integrated data.
Establishing architecture and decision-support applications to give easy access to operational, marketing, and product data.
Organizing, contributing to, and implementing policies, procedures, and responsibilities that define the accountabilities for the effective management of information assets.
Essentials:
5+ years of relevant working experience in data engineering, analytics, or software engineering
Strong technical accomplishments in architecting, implementing, and managing Data Models, pipelines and ETLs
Previous experience partnering with Business and Technical teams to gather requirements, make informed recommendations, and solve problems
Strong technical intuition and ability to understand complex business systems
Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or similar data warehouse handling experience
Ability to work remotely as part of a close-knit team
Stellar written and verbal English communication skills
Working experience with Python or similar scripting language and SQL
Willing to work during Eastern US or Western European working hours
Bonus points!
Demonstrated expertise with dirty data at a startup company
A self-starter who can diagnose inefficiencies and optimize processes to maximize results.
Experience with visualization tools (ie. Tableau, Sigma)
We care about your wellbeing and your professional success, so we offer you:
Full-time employment, with a flexible schedule
International environment and working culture
As many vacation days as you need
Whatever training you need to develop in your job
The hardware you need
The option to work anywhere
Company equity
Paid family leave
An annual company meetup (when possible)

Title: Data Engineer - AWS Redshift, Glue, Athena, Aurora
Description:
About the job
Data Engineer - AWS Redshift, Glue, Athena, Aurora
6 Months +
Remote in Europe

Sentinel is working with a major construction industry client, seeking an experienced Data Engineer with experience programming in Python and PySpark and designing and implementing AWS Serverless technologies such as Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Aurora.

Job Overview
Support the team during the MDP (marketing data platform) migration, creating necessary views and datasets specially by means of glue jobs in our Athena and Aurora environments.

Responsibilities
Design develop and support AWS-based data lake and data warehouse solution.
Develop process flows using Python and PySpark for Data ingestion validation enrichment and extraction services.
Develop and support batch and real-time data pipelines built using AWS Serverless services.
Develop and configure S3, Athena, Lambda, Glue, Dynamo, DB Kinesis, and SQS-related components.
Develop a framework to perform extract transform and load data from a wide variety of SQL and No-SQL data sources.
Perform unit testing and integration testing using SonarQube and implement quality validation rules defined by Stakeholders.
Work hand in hand with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Intelligence experts to ensure the data needs and business rules are accurately captured understood and delivered.

Required Experience
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience.
Minimum of five (5) years of experience performing software and/or data analytics requirements gathering and analysis.
Proficient in programming language Python and experience in enterprise-wide solution.
Experience working as Data Engineer role in design and implementing AWS Serverless technologies such as Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, and Aurora.
Experience with Python modules such as Pandas/Unit test and SonarQube.
Experience with GIT, GitHub, and JIRA.
Knowledge of software engineering development life cycle, Agile methodologies, coding, standards, testing, and operations (nice to have).

Experience with the following is essential: AWS Athena, AWS Redshift, AWS Aurora, AWS Glue


Please apply now for more details!


Your application with Sentinel
Sentinel is an award-winning recruitment and consulting company with offices in the UK, Czech Republic, and Switzerland. We work with global brands, ambitious start-ups, and leading recruitment outsourcers, ensuring access to exceptional talent through permanent, contingent labour, and statement of work services.
Get in touch today for new opportunities, or guidance on sourcing strategies, salary and rate benchmarking.
We aspire to provide great service to all applicants. If we think you’re right for the role, we’ll be in touch as soon as possible. If not, we’ll keep you updated with other opportunities in your field.

To apply for this role or more information, please apply with your up to date CV or email joel.hawkins@sentinelit.com

Joel Hawkins - Key Account Manager
joel.hawkins@sentinelit.com

+420 228 881 413
+ 44 1892 550000

Title: User Researcher
Description:
About the job
Do you want to build next generation SaaS products that power the automotive industry?

JATO are currently looking to hire a User Researcher to join our growing User Experience Team.

The role is responsible for bringing user-centered research expertise to the design and delivery of JATO’s web-based software. Including internal tools, customer facing products and their underlying services.

The role will identify and implement a systematic approach to user research, select and deliver appropriate research studies, and to document and present the findings and insight. This role will build the evidence base for user-centered decisions within the software development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities
• Plan, design and conduct appropriate user research, both quantitative and qualitative, to provide an evidence base for user-centered design decisions.
• Bring user-centered research expertise and practice to the software development lifecycle by including colleagues in the process of research and analysis.
• Communicate research findings to the wider organisation to aid understanding of our users and their needs.
• Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers and Engineers to turn research conclusions into actions.
• Develop the practice of user research with a library of research methods and a research repository of insights.

Key Requirements
• User experience: Web, User Needs, User-centered Design, User Journey Mapping, Usability
• Experience in Quantitative/Qualitative Methods: Contextual Discovery, Experience Mapping, Diary Studies, Lab Testing, Surveys, Analytics
• Strong communication skills
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Passionate about constant learning
• Desire to help others improve through mentoring
• A good grounding in research theory and practice
• Attention to detail
• Working in an agile software development environment

JATO Dynamics is a global business and people drive our success. We draw upon the diverse viewpoints, skills and experiences of our employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.

Title: Games Data Analyst
Description:
About the job
Plarium is one of the biggest gaming companies in the world, dedicated to the creation of competitive, compelling and highly immersive online games. Our passion for games reaches the fingertips of +400M players worldwide, and this is where inspiration is born. Plarium is home to anyone who has a spark of play and desire to take the world, together.

We are looking for our first ever Game Analyst that will come and join our top notch Studio. Our Studio is currently working on our next big RPG game and we are looking for a superstar to come and work with us! You will be vital in all things analytics when it comes to our new game and working with our game studio departments of Art, Game Design and product!

You will be the first in-house Game Analyst who will be part of the studio team! If you love games, Analytics and want to get your hands dirty from the beginning, then this position is for you!

Responsibilities
Provide various teams of the studio (Product, GD, Art…) with data, information, and insights
Supply instant and very fast analysis to day-to-day questions and challenges
Recognize relevant KPIs to focus on for different parts of the product
Collect, analyze and interpret player behavior data
Identify and communicate key trends and actionable development improvements
Fast feedback to the changes implemented in the product
Provide supporting data for prioritizing new features and initiatives
Define the dashboards and the reports the studio wants to have internally for analysis
Provide the detailed requirements for such reports and dashboards
Support the development team along with their work with feedback, correction of the requirements
Maintain the changes to be made in previously designed dashboards
Working together with the existing BI team to maximize in-house capabilities
Supply external data teams with all necessary information from inside the studio


What we expect
3+ years of experience as a Game analyst in a game dev company- Must
Experience working in a Gaming company- A Must
BA/B.Sc. in Statistics / Math / Engineering / Economics or other quantitative field
English: Professional working proficiency
Product-oriented approach
Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets
Familiarity with Mongo DB is an advantage
Strong background in Data Visualisation (Qlik Sense, Grafana, Tableau)
High communication and project management skills

Pease send your CV in English Only

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
About the job
Every day, millions of people rely on WeTransfer to share their creative ideas.

Having made its name in the game of quick and simple file-sharing, WeTransfer has grown into an end-to-end suite of digital solutions with more than 87 million monthly active users in 190 countries. Beyond the WeTransfer.com platform, we have the storytelling platform WePresent, quick slide-making tool Paste, immersive sketching app Paper, and inspiration-capturing tool Collect. We design and deliver delightful experiences that continue to feel obvious and intuitive to millions of people—from our moms to your favorite artists. As a certified B-Corp, WeTransfer aims to be a sustainable and responsible tech company, balancing people, planet, and profit

So, the work we do matters. Come and be a part of it.

What you'll be working on :

Evolve our data architecture, assisting the team to build the solution that best fit our problems.
Design and implement reliable data ingestion and transform pipelines that can handle large data volumes.
Build and maintain our observability data stack, so data is delivered accurately and on time.
Collaborate with a diverse team, developing best practices, sharing knowledge and making sure we're building the right services.

What we will be looking for :
Experience designing with data-intensive applications in the cloud, preferably AWS
Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Spark is desirable.
Extensive knowledge in ETL/ELT best practices and data warehouse/lake technologies, like Redshift and DeltaLake
Hands-on experience with orchestration tools, like Airflow
Exposure to kubernetes and docker

WeTransfer is an equal opportunity employer and we pride ourselves on the diversity of our people. We welcome you, and everything that makes you—well, you. That includes your gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status.

A note on remote

Our work environment is hybrid-remote, meaning that we support our employees to work remotely and in the office. We encourage employees to decide for themselves and with their team whether or when to go to the office.

While it is not necessarily a determining or disqualifying factor for any role, you may be required to complete a standard employment background screening.

Title: Data Analyst [Freelance]
Description:
About the job
Scopely’s In-House Agency [IHA] Flamed is looking for an Analyst. This is a newly created role, reporting into the Director of Creative Operations. Flamed produces hundreds of marketing assets per month to generate demand for Scopely’s live and launching games. We have grown rapidly over the last three years from 10 people to a team of over 60, and are now at a point where we require the support of an analyst to design and implement a robust analytical system and reporting structure to provide the data insights we need to support strategic decisions to optimise our asset production, capacity planning and financial forecasting process.

This role is a freelance remote and can be based anywhere that fits the CET/ Barcelona, Spain timezone.

About the Opportunity

As Flamed’s Analyst, you will develop new and optimize existing reporting and financial tracking systems for Flamed including:
Supporting the Flamed Project Management team by evolving the existing game budget tracking system to effectively and efficiently manage and forecast the creative production budgets and capacity at a game level
Provide the Flamed Leadership Team with a Looker dashboard to monitor agency efficiency month on month - Your insights will be used to guide resource allocation, insource/outsource decisions, and track our cost per asset
You will be expected to understand and document leadership requirements and agency KPI’s and design a system to uncover improvement opportunities, and establish a reliable and accurate budget and forecasting protocol.
Pull, analyse and interpret both operational and financial data
Partnering closely with Flamed leadership and PM team to understand requirements and working with other Scopely departments like HR, Finance and to integrate data sources

About you
Self-motivated with a natural ability to influence at all operational levels. You are comfortable communicating and implementing your ideas to ensure operational excellence and efficiency
Able to work autonomously, confident working communicating with and presenting to senior leaders in English.
A natural propensity for democratizing data as needed.
Have an entrepreneurial mindset paired with solid business acumen.
Ability to deliver results quickly and to work proactively and flexibly in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Job requirements
3+ years of experience as an Analyst within a high volume creative agency or marketing team for a global brand or a consulting firm with clients in this area
A natural ability to think outside-the-box and approach problems with a strong combination of growth mindset, business acumen and analytical thinking.
Professional English, in spoken and written forms.
Advanced excel skills are a must, and experience with more sophisticated BI tools (Looker) is a major advantage
Finesse in manoeuvring within ambiguity, and proven ability to thrive within an agency or fast-paced startup setting.

About us:
Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Scrabble® GO, MARVEL Strike Force, Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. Scopely has global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona, Boulder, Dublin (DIGIT game studio), London and Tokyo, with additional studios in seven countries across four continents. For more information, visit scopely.com.

Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.

Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job
Leadfeeder is a fast-growing international SaaS scale-up. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence into business. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website visitors, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales leads.

We’re excited to share that Leadfeeder has merged with Echobot, a leading provider of European Sales Intelligence. As a result, we now have 250+ team members based across 30+ countries and six offices across the US and Europe. Together, our companies are striving to be the leading sales intelligence and go-to-market platform in our core European and North American markets.

Are you a self-starter looking to learn and grow as part of a world-class team? We are hiring many key people around the world to strengthen our rapid growth. Join our journey!

We are organized in feature-oriented, cross-functional squads. Each squad is responsible for specific features of the product and works tightly together with high autonomy.

We believe in listening to everyone's ideas and feedback – no matter what your role is, you get to have a say in the product and technical decisions of your squad.

Team:
At Bizops & Analytics, we’re focusing on improving the operational efficiency of the three key business units: Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success & Support. We perform data analysis to build KPIs for the business units to focus on, create reports to see how they execute against these KPIs, set up processes and tools to automate their job and populate these tools with the necessary customer and usage data.
For example, we have run an analysis on historical data to determine what properties describe more valuable customers to Leadfeeder, created a KPI for the Marketing team to bring more customers of this kind, and set up the reporting in Tableau to show trends in these KPIs and created a process to share this data to GoogleAdwords and Active Campaign.

Responsibilities:

Work with business units managers (your focus will be on Sales & Marketing). Understand goals, objectives and initiatives within business unit
Use SQL or Python to explore and analyze the data, build KPIs or derive insights for business units. We mainly use Amazon Redshift SQL
Build dashboards and reports with KPIs. We use Tableau
Explore what data or automation shall be available to business units to operate more efficient and work with the developers to implement it
Help growing the culture of measurement, metrics and efficiency across the company

Requirements

Excellent SQL skills. We mainly use Amazon Redshift
Experience with BI/Data Visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlik or similar. We use Tableau
Good understanding of SaaS metrics
Strong English language skills both written and spoken
Desire to find answers in the data and help business growing
Some experience with Python and predictive analytics is a plus

Benefits
The chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun team
An international and diverse work atmosphere
The opportunity to work remotely in a fast-paced and results-oriented startup environment
Personal budget for home office improvements
Flexible working hours
Access to weekly yoga / fitness / meditation classes online
Mental Health support
Bi-annual company retreats

Title: Data Analyst (ONLINE) - DANISH
Description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. We are hiring freelance Danish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally.
